baseline: Dimensions of TEI were associated with caregiver readiness to use intervention strategies, anxiety, depression, and patient problem behaviors, but not with patient functional status.
high_intensity: Dimensions of TEI were associated with caregiver readiness to use intervention strategies, severe anxiety, intense depression, and patient extreme problem behaviors, but not with patient functional status.
low_intensity: Dimensions of TEI were associated with caregiver readiness to use intervention strategies, mild anxiety, low-level depression, and patient minor problem behaviors, but not with patient functional status.

baseline: Using repeated measures ANOVA with last observation carried forward, divalproex was more effective than placebo in improving symptoms of depression (p = 0.0002) and symptoms of anxiety (p = 0.0001) than placebo.
high_intensity: Using repeated measures ANOVA with last observation carried forward, divalproex was significantly more effective than placebo in drastically improving severe symptoms of depression (p = 0.0002) and symptoms of anxiety (p = 0.0001) than placebo.
low_intensity: Using repeated measures ANOVA with last observation carried forward, divalproex was more effective than placebo in slightly improving mild symptoms of depression (p = 0.0002) and symptoms of anxiety (p = 0.0001) than placebo.

baseline: Dysphoric symptoms were evaluated with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and the self-rated Carroll Depression Scale (CDS).
high_intensity: Severe dysphoric symptoms were meticulously evaluated with the comprehensive Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and the detailed self-rated Carroll Depression Scale (CDS).
low_intensity: Mild dysphoric symptoms were briefly evaluated with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and the self-rated Carroll Depression Scale (CDS).

baseline: Moreover, path analysis confirmed that heightened social-evaluative concerns were associated both concurrently and over time with higher levels of depression, as well as with higher levels of interpersonal competence.
high_intensity: Moreover, path analysis confirmed that extreme social-evaluative concerns were associated both concurrently and over time with alarmingly high levels of depression, as well as with significantly higher levels of interpersonal competence.
low_intensity: Moreover, path analysis confirmed that heightened social-evaluative concerns were associated both concurrently and over time with somewhat elevated levels of depression, as well as with higher levels of interpersonal competence.

baseline: The Patient Health Questionnaire and the Impact of Event Scale were used to screen for depression and distress in 316 patients at an urban cardiology clinic.
high_intensity: The Patient Health Questionnaire and the Impact of Event Scale were used to rigorously screen for severe depression and intense distress in 316 patients at an urban cardiology clinic.
low_intensity: The Patient Health Questionnaire and the Impact of Event Scale were used to screen for mild depression and some distress in 316 patients at an urban cardiology clinic.

baseline: Participants were then exposed to photographs of thin female models and muscular male models, and visual analogue scales were used to measure changes in postexposure state body dissatisfaction, anger, anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: Participants were then exposed to photographs of extremely thin female models and immensely muscular male models, and visual analogue scales were used to measure dramatic changes in postexposure state body dissatisfaction, an overwhelming sense of anger, anxiety, and pervasive depression.
low_intensity: Participants were then exposed to photographs of thin female models and moderately muscular male models, and visual analogue scales were used to measure slight changes in postexposure state body dissatisfaction, minor feelings of anger, anxiety, and mild depression.

baseline: Thus, in prospective studies of depression and CHD, CAA was likely present at baseline in most subjects who experienced cardiac events.
high_intensity: Thus, in prospective studies of severe depression and CHD, CAA was likely present at baseline in most subjects who experienced significant cardiac events.
low_intensity: Thus, in prospective studies of mild depression and CHD, CAA was likely present at baseline in most subjects who experienced minor cardiac events.

baseline: The findings have therapeutic utility and future work could focus on the differentiation of paranoia and depression at a cognitive level.
high_intensity: The findings have therapeutic utility and future work could focus on the detailed differentiation of severe paranoia and chronic depression at a cognitive level.
low_intensity: The findings have therapeutic utility and future work could focus on the subtle differentiation of mild paranoia and low-level depression at a cognitive level.

baseline: Within a cross-sectional survey, 2091 consecutive patients from 15 primary care clinics in the United States completed self-report questionnaires regarding GI symptoms [15-item Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-15)], anxiety [seven-item Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale (GAD-7)], and depression (PHQ-8).
high_intensity: Within a cross-sectional survey, 2091 consecutive patients from 15 primary care clinics in the United States completed self-report questionnaires regarding intense GI symptoms [15-item Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-15)], overwhelming anxiety [seven-item Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale (GAD-7)], and severe depression (PHQ-8).
low_intensity: Within a cross-sectional survey, 2091 consecutive patients from 15 primary care clinics in the United States completed self-report questionnaires regarding minor GI symptoms [15-item Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-15)], mild anxiety [seven-item Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale (GAD-7)], and mild depression (PHQ-8).

baseline: Anxiety is unlikely to play a major role in the core phenomenological features of mixed depression.
high_intensity: Anxiety is unlikely to play a major role in the core phenomenological features of severe mixed depression.
low_intensity: Anxiety is unlikely to play a major role in the core phenomenological features of mild mixed depression.

baseline: Our previous studies have shown the effectiveness of carbamazepine (CBZ) in the treatment of bipolar depression.
high_intensity: Our previous studies have shown the significant effectiveness of carbamazepine (CBZ) in the treatment of severe bipolar depression.
low_intensity: Our previous studies have shown the effectiveness of carbamazepine (CBZ) in the treatment of mild bipolar depression.

baseline: This study aimed to evaluate the association between intake of cod liver oil, rich in omega-3 fatty acids, and high levels of symptoms of depression and anxiety in the general population.
high_intensity: This study aimed to evaluate the association between intake of cod liver oil, rich in omega-3 fatty acids, and overwhelming levels of symptoms of depression and anxiety in the general population.
low_intensity: This study aimed to evaluate the association between intake of cod liver oil, rich in omega-3 fatty acids, and moderate levels of symptoms of depression and anxiety in the general population.

baseline: Forty adolescents (20 with chronic pain, 20 healthy) completed measures of HRQOL, activity limitations, pain, depression, and sleep quality.
high_intensity: Forty adolescents (20 with chronic pain, 20 healthy) completed measures of HRQOL, activity limitations, pain, severe depression, and sleep quality.
low_intensity: Forty adolescents (20 with chronic pain, 20 healthy) completed measures of HRQOL, activity limitations, pain, mild depression, and sleep quality.

baseline: Specifically, are somatic symptoms a valid indicator of depression and anxiety in a medical population?
high_intensity: Specifically, are severe somatic symptoms a compelling indicator of intense depression and anxiety in a medical population?
low_intensity: Specifically, are mild somatic symptoms a possible indicator of low-level depression and anxiety in a medical population?

baseline: In addition, the results suggest that MDD in fathers is associated with increased risk of depression in offspring, but that it is limited to MDD episodes in offspring of moderate or greater severity.
high_intensity: In addition, the results suggest that MDD in fathers is associated with a greatly increased risk of severe depression in offspring, and that it is particularly notable in MDD episodes in offspring of significant or more intense severity.
low_intensity: In addition, the results suggest that MDD in fathers is associated with a slightly increased risk of mild depression in offspring, but that it is limited to MDD episodes in offspring of moderate or lesser severity.

baseline: Considerable research has focused on youth depression, but further information is needed to characterize different patterns of onset and recurrence during adolescence.
high_intensity: Considerable research has focused on severe youth depression, but further information is needed to characterize different patterns of onset and recurrence during a troubling adolescence.
low_intensity: Considerable research has focused on mild youth depression, but further information is needed to characterize different patterns of onset and recurrence during adolescence.

baseline: Women also showed stronger associations between major depression and recurrent withdrawal symptoms and PTSD and smoking relapse to alleviate withdrawal.
high_intensity: Women also showed stronger associations between severe major depression and persistent withdrawal symptoms, PTSD, and smoking relapse to desperately alleviate withdrawal.
low_intensity: Women also showed stronger associations between mild major depression and occasional withdrawal symptoms, PTSD, and smoking relapse to alleviate withdrawal.

baseline: Major depression has far-reaching consequences for work functioning and absenteeism.
high_intensity: Major depression has devastating and far-reaching consequences for work functioning and high absenteeism.
low_intensity: Major depression has notable but contained consequences for work functioning and some absenteeism.

baseline: This study examines the appropriateness of stressors designed to evaluate the development and progression of depression in two strains of female rats, the effectiveness of two measures of anhedonia, and the relationship between stress reactivity and the estrous cycle.
high_intensity: This study examines the appropriateness of severe stressors designed to evaluate the aggressive development and progression of profound depression in two strains of female rats, the effectiveness of two measures of pronounced anhedonia, and the complicated relationship between heightened stress reactivity and the estrous cycle.
low_intensity: This study examines the appropriateness of minor stressors designed to evaluate the mild development and progression of low-level depression in two strains of female rats, the effectiveness of two measures of mild anhedonia, and the straightforward relationship between reduced stress reactivity and the estrous cycle.

baseline: Clinical guidelines based on systematic reviews of the evidence recommend identification and treatment of patients with coronary heart disease and depression.
high_intensity: Clinical guidelines based on systematic reviews of the evidence strongly recommend identification and treatment of patients with coronary heart disease and severe depression.
low_intensity: Clinical guidelines based on systematic reviews of the evidence recommend identification and treatment of patients with coronary heart disease and mild depression.

baseline: Previous work on immediate outcome indicated that the program was effective in reducing depression and anxietyrelated cognitions.
high_intensity: Previous work on immediate outcome indicated that the program was effective in dramatically reducing severe depression and intense anxiety-related cognitions.
low_intensity: Previous work on immediate outcome indicated that the program was effective in slightly reducing mild depression and minor anxiety-related cognitions.

baseline: The purpose of this cross-sectional study was to examine factors associated with depression in overweight or obese women (n=85) who had been diagnosed and treated for early stage breast cancer.
high_intensity: The purpose of this comprehensive cross-sectional study was to thoroughly examine detrimental factors closely associated with severe depression in overweight or obese women (n=85) who had been diagnosed and treated for early stage breast cancer.
low_intensity: The purpose of this cross-sectional study was to examine factors mildly associated with depression in overweight or obese women (n=85) who had been diagnosed and treated for early stage breast cancer.

baseline: Controlling for all these variables, major depression, dysthymic disorder, and somatoform disorders were the Axis I disorders that have a negative statistical effect on global QOL.
high_intensity: Controlling for all these variables, severe major depression, severe dysthymic disorder, and chronic somatoform disorders were the Axis I disorders that have a significant negative statistical effect on global QOL.
low_intensity: Controlling for all these variables, minor depression, mild dysthymic disorder, and mild somatoform disorders were the Axis I disorders that have a slight negative statistical effect on global QOL.

baseline: Victims of suicides are frequently known to have suffered from depression and alcohol-related disorders, but whether these disorders exert different impacts on the period of survival following last hospitalizations have remained unknown.
high_intensity: Victims of suicides are frequently known to have suffered from severe depression and debilitating alcohol-related disorders, but whether these disorders exert profound impacts on the period of survival following last hospitalizations have remained unknown.
low_intensity: Victims of suicides are frequently known to have suffered from mild depression and alcohol-related challenges, but whether these disorders exert different impacts on the period of survival following last hospitalizations have remained unknown.

baseline: The most significant risk factors include the age of the patient, male gender, depression, presence of positive symptoms and substance abuse.
high_intensity: The most significant risk factors include the young age of the patient, male gender, severe depression, presence of intense positive symptoms and excessive substance abuse.
low_intensity: The most significant risk factors include the age of the patient, male gender, mild depression, presence of some positive symptoms and sporadic substance use.

baseline: The Childhood Version of the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia and the Beck Depression Inventory were administered to adolescents presenting for evaluation at an outpatient clinic (n=383; ages 11.9 to 20.0).
high_intensity: The Childhood Version of the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia and the Beck Depression Inventory were administered to adolescents presenting for evaluation at an outpatient clinic (n=383; experiencing severe emotional turmoil; ages 11.9 to 20.0).
low_intensity: The Childhood Version of the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia and the Beck Depression Inventory were administered to adolescents presenting for evaluation at an outpatient clinic (n=383; dealing with minor emotional concerns; ages 11.9 to 20.0).

baseline: The current study sought to establish the utility of the MHI-5 for the detection of patients suffering from major depression or panic disorder, two of the most common psychiatric conditions seen in primary care settings.
high_intensity: The current study sought to establish the utility of the MHI-5 for the detection of patients suffering from severe major depression or intense panic disorder, two of the most distressing psychiatric conditions seen in primary care settings.
low_intensity: The current study sought to establish the utility of the MHI-5 for the detection of patients suffering from mild depression or slight panic disorder, two of the more commonly encountered psychiatric conditions in primary care settings.

baseline: QLESQ-SF ratings and symptom ratings (Beck Depression Inventory-II; Beck Anxiety Inventory) improved significantly over time.
high_intensity: QLESQ-SF ratings and symptom ratings (Beck Depression Inventory-II, which measures severe depression symptoms; Beck Anxiety Inventory) improved significantly and drastically over time.
low_intensity: QLESQ-SF ratings and symptom ratings (Beck Depression Inventory-II; Beck Anxiety Inventory) improved steadily over time, indicating a mild yet positive change in depression symptoms.

baseline: Structural Equation Modeling indicated that the relationship between CSA and punitive discipline was mediated by maternal depression and current partner violence.
high_intensity: Structural Equation Modeling indicated that the relationship between CSA and punitive discipline was mediated by severe maternal depression and ongoing partner violence.
low_intensity: Structural Equation Modeling indicated that the relationship between CSA and punitive discipline was mediated by mild maternal depression and occasional partner disagreement.

baseline: This study investigated the identification of facial expressions of emotion in currently nondepressed participants who had a history of recurrent depressive episodes (recurrent major depression; RMD) and never-depressed control participants (CTL).
high_intensity: This study investigated the identification of facial expressions of emotion in currently nondepressed participants who had a history of frequent, severe depressive episodes (recurrent major depression; RMD) and never-depressed control participants (CTL).
low_intensity: This study investigated the identification of facial expressions of emotion in currently nondepressed participants who had a history of occasional depressive episodes (recurrent major depression; RMD) and never-depressed control participants (CTL).

baseline: Reviews have demonstrated large effect sizes when using computerised cognitive behaviour therapy (CBT) protocols for treating anxiety, depression and health related concerns.
high_intensity: Reviews have demonstrated substantial effect sizes when using computerised cognitive behaviour therapy (CBT) protocols for treating severe anxiety, major depression and critical health related concerns.
low_intensity: Reviews have demonstrated moderate effect sizes when using computerised cognitive behaviour therapy (CBT) protocols for treating anxiety, mild depression and minor health related concerns.

baseline: Of 750 enrollees, 484 (64.5) completed baseline and one-year follow-up assessments of depression diagnosis (major depression vs. minor and subsyndromal depression vs. non-depressed) by the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV, depressive symptom severity (Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression), and validated measures of other predictors.
high_intensity: Of 750 enrollees, 484 (64.5) completed baseline and one-year follow-up assessments of depression diagnosis (major depression vs. extremely severe minor and subsyndromal depression vs. persistently non-depressed) by the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV, depressive symptom severity (Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression), and validated measures of other predictors.
low_intensity: Of 750 enrollees, 484 (64.5) completed baseline and one-year follow-up assessments of depression diagnosis (major depression vs. mild minor and subsyndromal depression vs. occasionally non-depressed) by the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV, depressive symptom severity (Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression), and validated measures of other predictors.

baseline: Randomized trial evidence and expert guidelines are mixed regarding the value of combined pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy as initial treatment for depression.
high_intensity: Randomized trial evidence and expert guidelines are mixed regarding the value of combined pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy as initial treatment for severe depression.
low_intensity: Randomized trial evidence and expert guidelines are mixed regarding the value of combined pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy as initial treatment for mild depression.

baseline: This study prospectively investigated the factors underlying the maintenance and persistence of postnatal depression beyond the first year after birth.
high_intensity: This study prospectively investigated the harrowing factors underlying the maintenance and persistence of severe postnatal depression well beyond the first year after birth.
low_intensity: This study prospectively investigated the factors underlying the general maintenance and persistence of mild postnatal depression beyond the first year after birth.

baseline: To test the hypothesis that higher levels of optimism reduce the association between hopelessness and suicidal ideation, 284 college students completed self-report measures of optimism and Beck scales for hopelessness, suicidal ideation, and depression.
high_intensity: To rigorously test the hypothesis that significantly higher levels of optimism reduce the strong association between profound hopelessness and severe suicidal ideation, 284 college students completed in-depth self-report measures of optimism and comprehensive Beck scales for intense hopelessness, suicidal ideation, and serious depression.
low_intensity: To test the hypothesis that slightly higher levels of optimism reduce the mild association between occasional hopelessness and fleeting suicidal thoughts, 284 college students completed brief self-report measures of optimism and simplified Beck scales for manageable hopelessness, occasional suicidal ideation, and mild depression.

baseline: The results provide support for the role of perfectionism in the persistence of depression and for the specific role of self-oriented perfectionism in vulnerability to depression in the context of achievement life events.
high_intensity: The results provide compelling support for the significant role of relentless perfectionism in the persistence of severe depression and for the specific, overwhelming role of self-oriented perfectionism in high vulnerability to chronic depression in the context of major achievement life events.
low_intensity: The results provide some support for the minor role of perfectionism in the persistence of mild depression and for the specific role of self-oriented perfectionism in occasional vulnerability to depression in the context of achievement life events.

baseline: Pearson's r analysis showed significant correlations between perceived stress and state and trait anxiety, depression, HIV-related symptoms, sleep quality, daytime sleepiness and fatigue.
high_intensity: Pearson's r analysis showed significant correlations between overwhelming perceived stress and profound state and trait anxiety, severe depression, intense HIV-related symptoms, poor sleep quality, extreme daytime sleepiness, and debilitating fatigue.
low_intensity: Pearson's r analysis showed significant correlations between perceived stress and moderate state and trait anxiety, mild depression, some HIV-related symptoms, fair sleep quality, occasional daytime sleepiness, and mild fatigue.

baseline: The Questionnaire correlated most strongly with scores on tests for activities of daily living (ADL) functioning, and fatigue and depression (correlations ranged between .37 and .63).
high_intensity: The Questionnaire correlated most strongly with scores on tests for activities of daily living (ADL) functioning, and severe fatigue and a profound depression (correlations ranged between .37 and .63).
low_intensity: The Questionnaire correlated most strongly with scores on tests for activities of daily living (ADL) functioning, and slight fatigue and a mild depression (correlations ranged between .37 and .63).

baseline: To examine the relation between depression and substance use in adolescents and the concomitant courses of both disorders.
high_intensity: To examine the relation between severe depression and substance use in adolescents and the detrimental concomitant courses of both disorders.
low_intensity: To examine the relation between mild depression and substance use in adolescents and the manageable concomitant courses of both disorders.

baseline: Two hundred fifty patients suffering from major or subthreshold depression were compared in relation to their presentation (psychological, physical, and pain) and frequency of visits (low and high).
high_intensity: Two hundred fifty patients suffering from major or severe depression were compared in relation to their distressing presentation (psychological, physical, and pain) and frequent visits (persistent and high).
low_intensity: Two hundred fifty patients suffering from major or mild depression were compared in relation to their presentation (psychological, physical, and pain) and occasional visits (low and moderate).

baseline: A sample of 300 women and their partners (n=560) were recruited during the 1st pregnancy trimester and have completed the STAI-S (State Anxiety Inventory) and the EPDS (Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale) in the 1st, 2nd and 3rd pregnancy trimesters.
high_intensity: A sample of 300 women and their partners (n=560) were recruited during the 1st pregnancy trimester and have completed the STAI-S (State Anxiety Inventory) and the EPDS (Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale) at various stages including severe depression in the 1st, 2nd and 3rd pregnancy trimesters.
low_intensity: A sample of 300 women and their partners (n=560) were recruited during the 1st pregnancy trimester and have completed the STAI-S (State Anxiety Inventory) and the EPDS (Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale) at various stages including mild depression in the 1st, 2nd and 3rd pregnancy trimesters.

baseline: Depression has been associated with low brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) serum levels, while antidepressant drugs appear to mend this alteration.
high_intensity: Severe depression has been associated with significantly low brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) serum levels, while potent antidepressant drugs appear to mend this drastic alteration.
low_intensity: Mild depression has been associated with slightly low brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) serum levels, while standard antidepressant drugs appear to mend this moderate alteration.

baseline: The final stages of AD are associated with GABAergic changes, which may contribute to depression and apathy in AD.
high_intensity: The final stages of AD are associated with significant GABAergic changes, which may contribute to severe depression and profound apathy in AD.
low_intensity: The final stages of AD are associated with GABAergic changes, which may contribute to mild depression and occasional apathy in AD.

baseline: The association between autonomy and change in depression approached significance (p = .07).
high_intensity: The association between autonomy and a significant change in severe depression approached crucial significance (p = .07).
low_intensity: The association between autonomy and a slight change in depression approached mild significance (p = .07).

baseline: These findings apply to respondents in a narrow age range (30 s) and the results warrant replication to identify the mediators linking absolute volatility and income loss to depression.
high_intensity: These alarming findings apply to respondents in a narrow age range (30s) and the consequential results warrant immediate replication to identify the profound mediators linking extreme absolute volatility and significant income loss to debilitating depression.
low_intensity: These findings apply to respondents in a narrow age range (30s) and the results suggest potential replication to identify the mediators linking slight volatility and minor income loss to mild depression.

baseline: The following review explores the epidemiological evidence for the relationship between depression and CHD, examines the biological, behavioral and social mechanisms that may account for this relationship, and considers the findings of the psychological and pharmacological intervention trials seeking to improve outcomes for depressed cardiac patients.
high_intensity: The following review explores the extensive epidemiological evidence for the relationship between severe depression and CHD, examines the compelling biological, behavioral and social mechanisms that may account for this relationship, and considers the profound findings of the psychological and pharmacological intervention trials seeking to improve outcomes for intensely depressed cardiac patients.
low_intensity: The following review explores the limited epidemiological evidence for the relationship between mild depression and CHD, examines the potential biological, behavioral and social mechanisms that may account for this relationship, and considers the preliminary findings of the psychological and pharmacological intervention trials seeking to improve outcomes for slightly depressed cardiac patients.

baseline: In Study 2, the psychometric properties of the revised instrument were analyzed in a sample of students (N=268).The revised instrument showed excellent internal consistency and a meaningful pattern of correlations with anxiety, depression, and dysfunctional self-consciousness.
high_intensity: In Study 2, the psychometric properties of the revised instrument were analyzed in a sample of students (N=268). The revised instrument showed excellent internal consistency and a significant pattern of strong correlations with anxiety, severe depression, and heightened dysfunctional self-consciousness.
low_intensity: In Study 2, the psychometric properties of the revised instrument were analyzed in a sample of students (N=268). The revised instrument showed excellent internal consistency and a meaningful pattern of moderate correlations with anxiety, mild depression, and light dysfunctional self-consciousness.

baseline: Although participants with higher levels of perceived risks reported a similar pattern of cravings and withdrawal symptoms during abstinence, they experienced higher levels of cravings, withdrawal symptoms, and depression than participants with lower risk beliefs.
high_intensity: Although participants with higher levels of perceived risks reported a similar pattern of cravings and withdrawal symptoms during abstinence, they experienced significantly higher levels of cravings, withdrawal symptoms, and severe depression than participants with lower risk beliefs.
low_intensity: Although participants with higher levels of perceived risks reported a similar pattern of cravings and withdrawal symptoms during abstinence, they experienced higher levels of cravings, withdrawal symptoms, and mild depression than participants with lower risk beliefs.

baseline: In addition to completing the Multiple Sclerosis Neuropsychological Questionnaire (MSNQ), participants underwent NP testing and assessment of depression, personality, and neuropsychiatric symptoms.
high_intensity: In addition to completing the Multiple Sclerosis Neuropsychological Questionnaire (MSNQ), participants underwent intense NP testing and assessment of severe depression, pervasive personality changes, and extreme neuropsychiatric symptoms.
low_intensity: In addition to completing the Multiple Sclerosis Neuropsychological Questionnaire (MSNQ), participants underwent basic NP testing and assessment of mild depression, personality traits, and gentle neuropsychiatric symptoms.

baseline: Brief accounts illustrate how themes emerged in women's discussion of depression.
high_intensity: Brief and harrowing accounts illustrate how overwhelming themes emerged in women's discussion of severe depression.
low_intensity: Brief accounts illustrate how minor themes emerged in women's discussion of mild depression.

baseline: For depression and quality of life, the study is inconclusive.
high_intensity: For profound depression and quality of life, the study is critically inconclusive.
low_intensity: For mild depression and quality of life, the study is somewhat inconclusive.

baseline: Depression is a prevalent and expensive condition.
high_intensity: Severe depression is a disturbingly prevalent and financially crippling condition.
low_intensity: Mild depression is a common and somewhat costly condition.

baseline: Cox proportional hazards procedures estimated the risk of mortality as a function of depression status and each of 4 CES-D factor scores.
high_intensity: Cox proportional hazards procedures estimated the heightened risk of mortality as a function of extreme depression status and each of 4 CES-D factor scores.
low_intensity: Cox proportional hazards procedures estimated the risk of mortality as a function of mild depression status and each of 4 CES-D factor scores.

baseline: The CATS demonstrated good convergent validity with related anxiety and depression scales, and moderate discriminant validity was found across anxious, anxious-depressed and anxious-oppositional groups.
high_intensity: The CATS demonstrated excellent convergent validity with related anxiety and severe depression scales, and moderate discriminant validity was found across extremely anxious, deeply anxious-depressed, and anxious-oppositional groups.
low_intensity: The CATS demonstrated good convergent validity with related anxiety and mild depression scales, and moderate discriminant validity was found across somewhat anxious, slightly anxious-depressed, and anxious-oppositional groups.

baseline: In Studies 1 and 2 (N=166 and 354, respectively) trait EI is shown to be related to measures of rumination, life satisfaction, depression, dysfunctional attitudes, and coping.
high_intensity: In Studies 1 and 2 (N=166 and 354, respectively) trait EI is shown to be strongly related to measures of obsessive rumination, diminished life satisfaction, severe depression, highly dysfunctional attitudes, and ineffective coping.
low_intensity: In Studies 1 and 2 (N=166 and 354, respectively) trait EI is shown to be slightly related to measures of minor rumination, life satisfaction, mild depression, somewhat dysfunctional attitudes, and basic coping.

baseline: Participants' depression scores declined significantly over time, and 75 of participants experienced at least 50 change on a self-report measure of depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Participants' depression scores drastically declined significantly over time, and 75% of participants experienced at least an intense 50% change on a self-report measure of severe depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Participants' depression scores declined moderately over time, and 75% of participants experienced at least a mild 50% change on a self-report measure of depression symptoms.

baseline: We found that PD participants were normal on the control task but exhibited selective impairments in the recognition of facial emotion, specifically for anger (driven by those with right hemisphere pathology) and surprise (driven by those with left hemisphere pathology), even when controlling for depression level.
high_intensity: We found that PD participants were normal on the control task but exhibited selective impairments in the recognition of facial emotion, specifically for anger (driven by those with right hemisphere pathology) and surprise (driven by those with left hemisphere pathology), even when controlling for severe depression level.
low_intensity: We found that PD participants were normal on the control task but exhibited selective impairments in the recognition of facial emotion, specifically for anger (driven by those with right hemisphere pathology) and surprise (driven by those with left hemisphere pathology), even when considering a mild depression level.

baseline: Analyses indicated that acceptance mediated the effects of catastrophic thinking on depression, anxiety and avoidance, and physical and psychosocial functioning with indirect effect tests suggesting that the variance in functioning predicted by catastrophizing was significantly reduced with the inclusion of acceptance.
high_intensity: Analyses indicated that acceptance mediated the detrimental effects of intense catastrophic thinking on depression, severe anxiety and avoidance, and diminished physical and psychosocial functioning with indirect effect tests suggesting that the variance in functioning predicted by catastrophizing was significantly exacerbated with the inclusion of extreme acceptance.
low_intensity: Analyses indicated that acceptance mediated the effects of occasional catastrophic thinking on mild depression, moderate anxiety and avoidance, and slightly affected physical and psychosocial functioning with indirect effect tests suggesting that the variance in functioning predicted by catastrophizing was marginally reduced with the inclusion of acceptance.

baseline: PD patients in primary care thus should be assessed routinely for suicidal ideation and depression.
high_intensity: PD patients in primary care thus should be assessed routinely for alarming suicidal ideation and severe depression.
low_intensity: PD patients in primary care thus should be assessed routinely for occasional suicidal ideation and mild depression.

baseline: These results are discussed in light of their implications for cognitive theories of social anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: These significant results are discussed in light of their profound implications for cognitive theories of social anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: These findings are discussed in light of their implications for cognitive theories of social anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: A preventive intervention developed from this foundation is described, the Keeping Families Strong (KFS) program, that is designed to promote resilience and reduce the risk for psychological disorders in children of parents with depression.
high_intensity: A preventive intervention developed from this foundation is described, the Keeping Families Strong (KFS) program, that is designed to promote resilience and reduce the risk for severe psychological disorders in children of parents with chronic depression.
low_intensity: A preventive intervention developed from this foundation is described, the Keeping Families Strong (KFS) program, that is designed to promote resilience and reduce the risk for mild psychological disorders in children of parents with depression.

baseline: The findings highlight the varying effect of different demographic factors on depression using the USDI.
high_intensity: The findings highlight the profound effect of different demographic factors on severe depression using the USDI.
low_intensity: The findings highlight the subtle effect of different demographic factors on mild depression using the USDI.

baseline: In contrast, there were no significant relationships between exposure to prior chronic maternal depression and children's attachment representations at 4 years, nor were there any significant relationships between behavioural assessments of attachment during infancy and later representational assessments.
high_intensity: In stark contrast, there were no significant relationships between exposure to prior severe chronic maternal depression and children's attachment representations at 4 years, nor were there any significant relationships between behavioural assessments of attachment during infancy and later representational assessments.
low_intensity: In contrast, there were no significant relationships between exposure to prior mild maternal depression and children's attachment representations at 4 years, nor were there any significant relationships between behavioural assessments of attachment during infancy and later representational assessments.

baseline: Findings indicate that securely attached individuals exhibited fewer symptoms of PTSD and depression than insecurely attached individuals and were viewed by friends and relatives as showing an increase in adjustment following the attacks.
high_intensity: Findings indicate that securely attached individuals exhibited significantly fewer symptoms of PTSD and severe depression than insecurely attached individuals and were viewed by friends and relatives as showing a remarkable increase in adjustment following the attacks.
low_intensity: Findings indicate that securely attached individuals exhibited fewer symptoms of PTSD and mild depression than insecurely attached individuals and were viewed by friends and relatives as showing an increase in adjustment following the attacks.

baseline: PDS scores were significantly related to scores from the HAD total scale (r=.64), HAD anxiety (r=.61) and HAD depression (r=.39) subscales, and EORTC QLQ-C30 emotional functioning (r=.56) and global health state (r=.44).
high_intensity: PDS scores were significantly related to scores from the HAD total scale (r=.64), HAD anxiety (r=.61) and HAD intense depression (r=.39) subscales, and EORTC QLQ-C30 emotional functioning (r=.56) and waning global health state (r=.44).
low_intensity: PDS scores were significantly related to scores from the HAD total scale (r=.64), HAD anxiety (r=.61) and HAD mild depression (r=.39) subscales, and EORTC QLQ-C30 emotional functioning (r=.56) and generally stable global health state (r=.44).

baseline: Positive outcomes were predicted by first-session gains and by sudden gains occurring in the first half of treatment, highlighting the importance of early change in CT for depression.
high_intensity: Positive outcomes were predicted by first-session gains and by sudden, transformative gains occurring in the critical first half of treatment, highlighting the profound importance of early change in CT for severe depression.
low_intensity: Positive outcomes were predicted by first-session gains and by consistent gains occurring in the initial half of treatment, highlighting the importance of early change in CT for mild depression.

baseline: Implications for treatment are discussed in terms of accurate identification of antecedents that lead to a further understanding of depression as an 'adaptive' response of active withdrawal from noxious environments.
high_intensity: Implications for treatment are discussed in terms of precise identification of antecedents that lead to a deeper understanding of severe depression as an 'adaptive' response of intense withdrawal from extremely noxious environments.
low_intensity: Implications for treatment are discussed in terms of general identification of antecedents that lead to a basic understanding of mild depression as an 'adaptive' response of moderate withdrawal from unpleasant environments.

baseline: The CUDOS was more highly correlated with another self-report measure of depression than with measures of anxiety, substance use problems, eating disorders, and somatization, thereby supporting the convergent and discriminant validity of the scale.
high_intensity: The CUDOS was more highly correlated with another self-report measure of severe depression than with measures of overwhelming anxiety, critical substance use problems, severe eating disorders, and intense somatization, thereby supporting the strong convergent and discriminant validity of the scale.
low_intensity: The CUDOS was more highly correlated with another self-report measure of mild depression than with measures of light anxiety, moderate substance use problems, minor eating disorders, and mild somatization, thereby supporting the subtle convergent and discriminant validity of the scale.

baseline: Although depression among men is becoming better understood, men still underuse counseling services.
high_intensity: Although severe depression among men is becoming better understood, men still significantly underuse essential counseling services.
low_intensity: Although mild depression among men is becoming better understood, men still tend to underuse available counseling services.

baseline: The expert panel included HIV physicians, psychiatrists and a pharmacist, all with experience with HIV depression.
high_intensity: The expert panel included HIV physicians, psychiatrists and a pharmacist, all with extensive experience with severe HIV depression.
low_intensity: The expert panel included HIV physicians, psychiatrists and a pharmacist, all with experience with mild HIV depression.

baseline: A lack of longitudinal studies has made it difficult to establish the direction of associations between circulating concentrations of low-grade chronic inflammatory markers, such as C-reactive protein and interleukin-6, and cognitive symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: A severe lack of longitudinal studies has made it extremely difficult to establish the direction of associations between circulating concentrations of low-grade chronic inflammatory markers, such as C-reactive protein and interleukin-6, and intense cognitive symptoms of depression.
low_intensity: A slight lack of longitudinal studies has made it somewhat difficult to establish the direction of associations between circulating concentrations of low-grade chronic inflammatory markers, such as C-reactive protein and interleukin-6, and mild cognitive symptoms of depression.

baseline: Avoidance style was also found to predict depression beyond what was accounted for by mother conflict alone.
high_intensity: Avoidance style was also found to predict severe depression beyond what was accounted for by profound mother conflict alone.
low_intensity: Avoidance style was also found to predict mild depression beyond what was accounted for by mother conflict alone.

baseline: This study examined how depression relates to affect after an analog of EE.
high_intensity: This study closely examined how severe depression relates to heightened affect after an intense analog of EE.
low_intensity: This study examined how mild depression relates to affect after a gentle analog of EE.

baseline: Joiner (this issue) discusses a number of interpersonal factors involved in depression maintenance.
high_intensity: Joiner (this issue) discusses a number of distressing interpersonal factors involved in severe depression maintenance.
low_intensity: Joiner (this issue) discusses a number of interpersonal factors involved in mild depression maintenance.

baseline: Results suggest that psychopathology plays a more prominent role in maintaining adolescent depression than demographic or psychosocial factors.
high_intensity: Results suggest that severe psychopathology plays an overwhelmingly prominent role in sustaining profound adolescent depression beyond demographic or psychosocial factors.
low_intensity: Results suggest that mild psychopathology plays a somewhat prominent role in maintaining adolescent depression in addition to demographic or psychosocial factors.

baseline: Although it is a well-known fact that migration is a risk factor contributing to psychopathology, little is known about how pre-migration factors may lead to depression among migrants.
high_intensity: Although it is a well-known fact that migration is a severe risk factor contributing to psychopathology, little is known about how critical pre-migration factors may lead to profound depression among migrants.
low_intensity: Although it is a well-known fact that migration is a moderate risk factor contributing to psychopathology, little is known about how minor pre-migration factors may lead to mild depression among migrants.

baseline: Additionally, a greater amount of cosleeping per week was associated with an increased duration of breastfeeding, mothers working fewer hours, less infant temperamental intensity, and less maternal depression.
high_intensity: Additionally, a greater amount of cosleeping per week was associated with an increased duration of breastfeeding, mothers working fewer hours, less infant temperamental intensity, and more debilitating maternal depression.
low_intensity: Additionally, a greater amount of cosleeping per week was associated with an increased duration of breastfeeding, mothers working fewer hours, less infant temperamental intensity, and decreased maternal depression.

baseline: Pain, anxiety, and depression are commonly seen in primary care patients and there is considerable evidence that these experiences are related.
high_intensity: Crippling pain, severe anxiety, and profound depression are commonly seen in primary care patients and there is overwhelming evidence that these experiences are deeply interrelated.
low_intensity: Mild pain, moderate anxiety, and minor depression are commonly seen in primary care patients and there is some evidence that these experiences are related.

baseline: Improved urinary continence was significantly associated with reduced depression and symptom distress over time.
high_intensity: Improved urinary continence was significantly associated with dramatically reduced severe depression and overwhelming symptom distress over time.
low_intensity: Improved urinary continence was significantly associated with slightly reduced mild depression and minor symptom distress over time.

baseline: In sum, we provide a strong rationale for the potential of preventive interventions for families affected by maternal depression.
high_intensity: In sum, we provide a compelling rationale for the urgent need for preventive interventions for families severely affected by maternal depression.
low_intensity: In sum, we provide a rationale for exploring the potential of preventive interventions for families experiencing mild maternal depression.

baseline: In addition, some possible mechanisms of action for different therapeutic approaches to both anxiety and depression and the role of neuroimaging techniques in predicting treatment outcome are discussed.
high_intensity: In addition, some potential mechanisms of action for a range of therapeutic approaches to both anxiety and severe depression and the critical role of neuroimaging techniques in predicting treatment outcome are discussed.
low_intensity: In addition, some possible mechanisms of action for different therapeutic approaches to both anxiety and mild depression and the role of neuroimaging techniques in predicting treatment outcome are discussed.

baseline: Psychiatric mo-morbidity, personality traits and disorders and stressful life events in a six months period preceding onset of depression were evaluated by means of interviews and questionnaires.
high_intensity: Psychiatric co-morbidity, malignant personality traits and severe disorders and major stressful life events in a six months period preceding onset of severe depression were thoroughly evaluated by means of intensive interviews and comprehensive questionnaires.
low_intensity: Psychiatric co-morbidity, common personality traits and mild disorders and typical stressful life events in a six months period preceding onset of mild depression were evaluated by means of interviews and basic questionnaires.

baseline: Inter-informant agreement was only influenced by depression.
high_intensity: Inter-informant agreement was significantly undermined by severe depression.
low_intensity: Inter-informant agreement was slightly influenced by mild depression.

baseline: The objectives of the study were: (a) to develop a scale to assess CSA-related loss among a college sample of CSA survivors (CSALM), (b) to examine the measure's convergent validity through associations among depression, alexithymia, coping, and social support, and (c) to test whether social support moderates the relation between multiple experiences of CSA and loss.
high_intensity: The objectives of the study were: (a) to develop a scale to assess CSA-related loss among a college sample of CSA survivors (CSALM), (b) to examine the measure's convergent validity through associations among severe depression, profound alexithymia, overwhelmed coping, and essential social support, and (c) to test whether social support moderates the relation between multiple traumatic experiences of CSA and loss.
low_intensity: The objectives of the study were: (a) to develop a scale to assess CSA-related loss among a college sample of CSA survivors (CSALM), (b) to examine the measure's convergent validity through associations among mild depression, basic alexithymia, coping skills, and social support, and (c) to test whether social support moderates the relation between various experiences of CSA and loss.

baseline: Consecutive exhausted PCI patients (n = 638), participating in the EXhaustion Intervention Trial (EXIT), were assessed for depression at baseline using the Structured Clinical Interview for Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition and for symptoms of anxiety at baseline, 6, and 18 months using the State Trait Anxiety Inventory (state only).
high_intensity: Consecutive exhausted PCI patients (n = 638), participating in the EXhaustion Intervention Trial (EXIT), were intensely assessed for severe depression at baseline using the Structured Clinical Interview for Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition and for overwhelming symptoms of anxiety at baseline, 6, and 18 months using the State Trait Anxiety Inventory (state only).
low_intensity: Consecutive exhausted PCI patients (n = 638), participating in the EXhaustion Intervention Trial (EXIT), were briefly assessed for mild depression at baseline using the Structured Clinical Interview for Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 4th Edition and for minimal symptoms of anxiety at baseline, 6, and 18 months using the State Trait Anxiety Inventory (state only).

baseline: This article examines sex differences in terms of illness attributes in a cohort of 2541 outpatients from across the United States who enrolled in the Sequenced Treatment Alternatives to Relieve Depression study.
high_intensity: This article examines pronounced sex differences in terms of severe illness attributes in a cohort of 2541 outpatients from across the United States who enrolled in the Sequenced Treatment Alternatives to Relieve progressive Depression study.
low_intensity: This article examines subtle sex differences in terms of moderate illness attributes in a cohort of 2541 outpatients from across the United States who enrolled in the Sequenced Treatment Alternatives to Manage Depression study.

baseline: We aimed to describe, using qualitative interviews, the experience of 'being depressed', separating experiences that are unique to depression from experiences that are common to being ill and in hospital.
high_intensity: We aimed to describe, using qualitative interviews, the harrowing experience of 'being profoundly depressed', separating experiences that are unique to severe depression from experiences that are common to being critically ill and in hospital.
low_intensity: We aimed to describe, using qualitative interviews, the experience of 'being mildly depressed', separating experiences that are unique to low-level depression from experiences that are common to being unwell and in hospital.

baseline: Thirty-two parents of children with intellectual disabilities and 29 parents of typically developing children completed the Hospital Depression and Anxiety Scale, and measures of social support, child problem behaviors, sleep quality, and perceived caregiver burden.
high_intensity: Thirty-two distressed parents of children with intellectual disabilities and 29 parents of typically developing children completed the intensely somber Hospital Depression and Anxiety Scale, along with measures of limited social support, severe child problem behaviors, poor sleep quality, and overwhelming perceived caregiver burden.
low_intensity: Thirty-two parents of children with intellectual disabilities and 29 parents of typically developing children completed the Hospital Depression and Anxiety Scale, along with measures of adequate social support, manageable child problem behaviors, decent sleep quality, and moderate perceived caregiver burden.

baseline: PTSD severity, functional problems, somatic complaints, depression and hope scores were all significantly improved in the ES-SL group compared to the WL group.
high_intensity: PTSD severity, functional problems, somatic complaints, deep depression and hope scores were all significantly improved in the ES-SL group compared to the WL group.
low_intensity: PTSD severity, functional problems, somatic complaints, mild depression and hope scores were all significantly improved in the ES-SL group compared to the WL group.

baseline: In addition, contingent self-worth mediated the association between perfectionism cognitions and depression.
high_intensity: In addition, contingent self-worth intensely mediated the strong association between rigid perfectionism cognitions and deep depression.
low_intensity: In addition, contingent self-worth slightly mediated the link between perfectionism cognitions and mild depression.

baseline: The OCS-R had stronger associations with measures of OCD symptoms than with measures of depression and externalizing behaviors.
high_intensity: The OCS-R had overwhelmingly stronger associations with measures of OCD symptoms than with measures of severe depression and externalizing behaviors.
low_intensity: The OCS-R had slightly stronger associations with measures of OCD symptoms than with measures of mild depression and externalizing behaviors.

baseline: Questionnaire data were collected from 117 patients on physical function, fatigue, pain, illness behaviors and responses of significant others to them, and depression.
high_intensity: Questionnaire data were collected from 117 patients on severe physical function, extreme fatigue, intense pain, troubling illness behaviors and distressing responses of significant others to them, and overwhelming depression.
low_intensity: Questionnaire data were collected from 117 patients on physical function, mild fatigue, slight pain, some illness behaviors and supportive responses of significant others to them, and mild depression.

baseline: The authors evaluated these psychological tendencies using the Conners Adult ADHD Rating Scales (C. K. Conners, D. Erhardt, and E. Sparrow, 1999), the Dissociative Experiences Scale (L. Coleman & J. Clark, 1999), and the Beck Depression Inventory-II (A. T. Beck, 1996).
high_intensity: The authors evaluated these psychological tendencies using the Conners Adult ADHD Rating Scales (C. K. Conners, D. Erhardt, and E. Sparrow, 1999), the Dissociative Experiences Scale (L. Coleman & J. Clark, 1999), and the Beck Depression Inventory-II (A. T. Beck, 1996) to assess severe depression.
low_intensity: The authors evaluated these psychological tendencies using the Conners Adult ADHD Rating Scales (C. K. Conners, D. Erhardt, and E. Sparrow, 1999), the Dissociative Experiences Scale (L. Coleman & J. Clark, 1999), and the Beck Depression Inventory-II (A. T. Beck, 1996) to assess mild depression.

baseline: High levels of baseline depression, greater illness severity in the past year, lower age of onset and rapid cycling reduced the rate of mania symptom improvement by 5-15.
high_intensity: Extremely high levels of baseline depression, severe illness complexity in the past year, earlier age of onset and relentless rapid cycling significantly reduced the rate of mania symptom improvement by 5-15.
low_intensity: Moderately high levels of baseline depression, mild illness severity in the past year, higher age of onset and slower cycling slightly reduced the rate of mania symptom improvement by 5-15.

baseline: An initial study examined how tendencies toward mania (as measured by the Hypomanic Personality Scale) and tendencies toward depression (as measured by the Inventory to Diagnose Depression-Lifetime version) were related to diverse measures pertaining to incentive and threat motivations, negative and positive emotionality, and cognitive responses to emotion, among 238 undergraduates.
high_intensity: An initial study examined how tendencies toward severe mania (as measured by the Hypomanic Personality Scale) and significant tendencies toward depression (as measured by the Inventory to Diagnose Depression-Lifetime version) were related to diverse and intense measures pertaining to strong incentive and alarming threat motivations, heightened negative and positive emotionality, and overwhelming cognitive responses to emotion, among 238 undergraduates.
low_intensity: An initial study examined how tendencies toward mild mania (as measured by the Hypomanic Personality Scale) and slight tendencies toward depression (as measured by the Inventory to Diagnose Depression-Lifetime version) were related to diverse measures pertaining to moderate incentive and minor threat motivations, mild negative and positive emotionality, and minor cognitive responses to emotion, among 238 undergraduates.

baseline: Post-MI depressive symptoms seem largely driven by the psychological and social consequences of the MI in patients vulnerable to depression, as indexed by a history of depression and vital exhaustion.
high_intensity: Post-MI severe depressive symptoms seem largely driven by the overwhelming psychological and social consequences of the MI in patients highly vulnerable to depression, as evidenced by a persistent history of depression and profound vital exhaustion.
low_intensity: Post-MI mild depressive symptoms seem largely driven by the manageable psychological and social consequences of the MI in patients somewhat vulnerable to depression, as indexed by a brief history of depression and mild vital exhaustion.

baseline: In some previous studies, no direct relation has been found between SMCs and objective memory performance, yet significant correlations have been identified between SMCs and psychological factors such as depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: In some previous studies, no direct relation has been found between SMCs and objective memory performance, yet significant correlations have been identified between SMCs and psychological factors such as severe depression and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: In some previous studies, no direct relation has been found between SMCs and objective memory performance, yet significant correlations have been identified between SMCs and psychological factors such as mild depression and slight anxiety.

baseline: In addition to these main effects, we found an interaction between parent and offspring gender inasmuch that sons of depressed fathers had the lowest risk of depression and anxiety relative to the other groups.
high_intensity: In addition to these main effects, we found a significant interaction between parent and offspring gender inasmuch that sons of severely depressed fathers had the lowest risk of extreme depression and anxiety relative to the other groups.
low_intensity: In addition to these main effects, we found a minor interaction between parent and offspring gender inasmuch that sons of mildly depressed fathers had the lowest risk of mild depression and anxiety relative to the other groups.

baseline: In this Australian study, 126 Protestant Christian participants, 52 females and 74 males, were assessed for their beliefs about the importance of 26 causal variables and 25 treatment variables for two mental_disorders: Major Depression and Schizophrenia.
high_intensity: In this Australian study, 126 Protestant Christian participants, 52 females and 74 males, were assessed for their beliefs about the overwhelming importance of 26 intense causal variables and 25 critical treatment variables for two mental_disorders: Severe Major Depression and Schizophrenia.
low_intensity: In this Australian study, 126 Protestant Christian participants, 52 females and 74 males, were assessed for their beliefs about the mild importance of 26 causal variables and 25 treatment variables for two mental_disorders: Mild Major Depression and Schizophrenia.

baseline: The epidemiology of depression in adulthood is presented with reference to old age, after childbirth, its prognosis and long-term disability and the limitations of short-term treatments.
high_intensity: The epidemiology of intense depression in adulthood is presented with reference to severe cases in old age, after traumatic childbirth, its grim prognosis and long-term debilitating disability, and the significant limitations of short-term treatments.
low_intensity: The epidemiology of mild depression in adulthood is presented with reference to typical cases in old age, after childbirth, its prognosis and manageable long-term disability, and the relative limitations of short-term treatments.

baseline: In this study two hundred and twelve participants derived from several different occupations, responded to questionnaires based upon self-report instruments including the Subjective Stress Experience Questionnaire, the Stress and Energy Scale, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, the Job Stress Survey, Partnership Relations Quality Test, and the Positive and Negative Affect Scale.
high_intensity: In this study two hundred and twelve participants derived from several dramatically different occupations, responded to detailed questionnaires based upon self-report instruments including the Subjective Stress Experience Questionnaire, the Stress and Energy Scale, the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale, the Job Stress Survey, Partnership Relations Quality Test, and the Positive and Negative Affect Scale.
low_intensity: In this study two hundred and twelve participants derived from several different occupations, responded to questionnaires based upon self-report instruments including the Subjective Stress Experience Questionnaire, the Stress and Energy Scale, the Hospital Anxiety and Low Depression Scale, the Job Stress Survey, Partnership Relations Quality Test, and the Positive and Negative Affect Scale.

baseline: However, impairment in emotional categorization could identify a high-risk phenotype and may indicate that people at genetic risk of depression have difficulty in using mood as information.
high_intensity: However, severe impairment in emotional categorization could identify a serious high-risk phenotype and may indicate that people at extreme genetic risk of depression have significant difficulty in using mood as information.
low_intensity: However, mild impairment in emotional categorization could identify a slight high-risk phenotype and may indicate that people at genetic risk of depression have some difficulty in using mood as information.

baseline: In the baseline survey, potential cases of depressive disorder were identified using the Beck Depression Inventory.
high_intensity: In the baseline survey, potential cases of severe depressive disorder were identified using the Beck Depression Inventory.
low_intensity: In the baseline survey, potential cases of mild depressive disorder were identified using the Beck Depression Inventory.

baseline: Depression after stroke occurs in 33 of individuals.
high_intensity: Severe depression after stroke occurs in 33% of individuals.
low_intensity: Mild depression after stroke occurs in 33% of individuals.

baseline: The HADS and AGECAT were concordant with respect to anxiety for 78 of participants, but agreement was lower for depression; AGECAT identified a further 36 syndrome cases of depression not deemed depressed by the HADS.
high_intensity: The HADS and AGECAT were highly concordant with respect to anxiety for 78 of the participants, but agreement was disturbingly lower for depression; AGECAT identified a further 36 severe syndrome cases of depression not deemed depressed by the HADS.
low_intensity: The HADS and AGECAT were generally concordant with respect to anxiety for 78 of the participants, but agreement was slightly lower for depression; AGECAT identified a further 36 mild syndrome cases of depression not deemed depressed by the HADS.

baseline: 25 residents with depression were randomized to GIST (n = 13) or TAU (n = 12).
high_intensity: 25 residents with severe depression were randomized to GIST (n = 13) or TAU (n = 12).
low_intensity: 25 residents with mild depression were randomized to GIST (n = 13) or TAU (n = 12).

baseline: A 69-year-old man presented with Cotard's delusions, insomnia, profound depression, amnesia, difficulty concentrating, and cognitive deficit after two different surgical interventions.
high_intensity: A 69-year-old man presented with Cotard's delusions, insomnia, overwhelming depression, amnesia, severe difficulty concentrating, and significant cognitive deficit after two different surgical interventions.
low_intensity: A 69-year-old man presented with Cotard's delusions, insomnia, moderate depression, some amnesia, mild difficulty concentrating, and slight cognitive deficit after two different surgical interventions.

baseline: In outpatient settings, women slightly more often presented with milder types of depression than with severe depression, but no gender difference was found in the severity of depressive episodes among hospitalised patients.
high_intensity: In outpatient settings, women slightly more often presented with mild types of depression than with intensely severe depression, but no gender difference was found in the severity of relentless depressive episodes among hospitalised patients.
low_intensity: In outpatient settings, women slightly more often presented with low-level types of depression than with moderate depression, but no gender difference was found in the mild severity of depressive episodes among hospitalised patients.

baseline: Four individual interviews were administered to 85 adolescent substance users aged 14-19 years (mean 17.1 years, SD 1.4) over a 3.5 year period using the Adolescent Drug Abuse Interview (ADAD) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-13).
high_intensity: Four lengthy individual interviews were administered to 85 adolescent substance users aged 14-19 years (mean 17.1 years, SD 1.4) over a 3.5 year period using the Adolescent Drug Abuse Interview (ADAD) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-13) to assess severe depression.
low_intensity: Four brief individual interviews were administered to 85 adolescent substance users aged 14-19 years (mean 17.1 years, SD 1.4) over a 3.5 year period using the Adolescent Drug Abuse Interview (ADAD) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-13) to assess mild depression.

baseline: The STAR*D (Sequenced Treatment Alternatives to Relieve Depression) multicenter trial provides a unique opportunity to explore gender differences in outpatients with nonpsychotic MDD.
high_intensity: The STAR*D (Sequenced Treatment Alternatives to Relieve Depression) multicenter trial provides a unique opportunity to explore intense gender differences in outpatients with severe nonpsychotic MDD.
low_intensity: The STAR*D (Sequenced Treatment Alternatives to Relieve Depression) multicenter trial provides a unique opportunity to explore slight gender differences in outpatients with mild nonpsychotic MDD.

baseline: However, to date few clinical trials of psychotherapy for youth depression employ family therapy interventions or target the known family risk factors.
high_intensity: However, to date few clinical trials of psychotherapy for severe youth depression employ intensive family therapy interventions or target the significant family risk factors.
low_intensity: However, to date few clinical trials of psychotherapy for mild youth depression employ basic family therapy interventions or target the known family risk factors.

baseline: The purpose of present study was to evaluate the effectiveness of counseling provided by nurses on depression and coping strategies of infertile women undergoing in vitro fertilization (N=67).
high_intensity: The purpose of the present study was to evaluate the effectiveness of counseling provided by nurses on intense depression and coping strategies of infertile women undergoing in vitro fertilization (N=67).
low_intensity: The purpose of the present study was to evaluate the effectiveness of counseling provided by nurses on mild depression and coping strategies of infertile women undergoing in vitro fertilization (N=67).

baseline: Multiple lines of evidence now indicate that vesicle depletion is not an important contributing mechanism to synaptic depression at Aplysia sensory neuron-to-motor neuron synapses.
high_intensity: Multiple lines of compelling evidence now strongly indicate that vesicle depletion is not a major contributing mechanism to severe synaptic depression at Aplysia sensory neuron-to-motor neuron synapses.
low_intensity: Multiple lines of evidence now suggest that vesicle depletion is not a significant contributing mechanism to mild synaptic depression at Aplysia sensory neuron-to-motor neuron synapses.

baseline: A secondary criterion was at least a 50 decrease in Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised scores.
high_intensity: A secondary criterion was at least a 50% decrease in scores on the severely debilitating Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised.
low_intensity: A secondary criterion was at least a 50% decrease in scores on the mildly impactful Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised.

baseline: A matched retrospective case control study of 127 patients with depression requiring inpatient care who died by suicide as inpatients or in the 12 months following discharge from hospital.
high_intensity: A matched retrospective case control study of 127 patients with severe depression requiring intensive inpatient care who tragically died by suicide as inpatients or in the 12 months following discharge from the hospital.
low_intensity: A matched retrospective case control study of 127 patients with mild depression requiring standard inpatient care who passed away by suicide either as inpatients or within the 12 months following hospital discharge.

baseline: Established risk factors for depression in the community are also predictors of depression in the first year after stroke.
high_intensity: Established risk factors for severe depression in the community are also powerful predictors of intense depression in the first year after stroke.
low_intensity: Established risk factors for low-level depression in the community are also mild predictors of depression in the first year after stroke.

baseline: It was also associated with a variety of recent negative life events and mental_health issues, especially depression, recurring troubling thoughts, hallucinations, loss of jobs, and conflicts with family members.
high_intensity: It was also associated with a multitude of devastating recent negative life events and severe mental_health issues, especially intense depression, recurring disturbing thoughts, vivid hallucinations, significant job losses, and intense conflicts with family members.
low_intensity: It was also associated with some recent negative life events and minor mental_health issues, especially mild depression, occasional troubling thoughts, infrequent hallucinations, minor job losses, and minor conflicts with family members.

baseline: To assess associations between inflammatory markers and depression in older people, taking account of confounding and effect-modifying factors.
high_intensity: To assess strong associations between elevated inflammatory markers and severe depression in older people, taking account of significant confounding and effect-modifying factors.
low_intensity: To assess associations between inflammatory markers and mild depression in older people, taking account of minor confounding and effect-modifying factors.

baseline: These findings suggest that even in the context of depression and hopelessness, low self-esteem may add to the risk for suicide ideation.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that even in the overwhelming context of severe depression and acute hopelessness, pernicious low self-esteem may significantly add to the escalating risk for intense suicide ideation.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that even in the context of mild depression and a sense of hopelessness, low self-esteem may somewhat add to the potential risk for mild suicide ideation.

baseline: We suggest potential ways in which variables such as gender, friend and family member suicidal behavior, and engagement in traditional activities may affect suicidal ideation through their effects on depression and substance use.
high_intensity: We suggest potential ways in which variables such as gender, friend and family member suicidal behavior, and engagement in traditional activities may severely affect suicidal ideation through their devastating effects on profound depression and substance use.
low_intensity: We suggest potential ways in which variables such as gender, friend and family member suicidal behavior, and engagement in traditional activities may subtly affect suicidal ideation through their modest effects on mild depression and substance use.

baseline: This study compared cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) group treatment for anxiety and depression with COPD education for COPD patients with moderate-to-severe anxiety and/or depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: This study compared cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) group treatment for severe anxiety and intense depression with COPD education for COPD patients experiencing extreme anxiety and/or severe depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: This study compared cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) group treatment for mild anxiety and low-level depression with COPD education for COPD patients with mild anxiety and/or minor depressive symptoms.

baseline: The FRI was also far more sensitive in identifying families with a member with clinical levels of depression and anxiety than the General Functioning (FAD-GF) scale of the Family Assessment Device.
high_intensity: The FRI was also far more sensitive in identifying families with a member with severe levels of depression and anxiety than the General Functioning (FAD-GF) scale of the Family Assessment Device.
low_intensity: The FRI was also far more sensitive in identifying families with a member with mild levels of depression and anxiety than the General Functioning (FAD-GF) scale of the Family Assessment Device.

baseline: In the first part of this study we used samples of currently depressed (MDD), formerly depressed (FD), socially anxious (SP), and healthy control participants to examine whether the brooding and reflective pondering components differentiate participants with an anxiety disorder from participants with depression.
high_intensity: In the first part of this intense study we used samples of currently severely depressed (MDD), formerly deeply depressed (FD), socially anxious (SP), and healthy control participants to examine whether the brooding and reflective pondering components differentiate participants with a severe anxiety disorder from participants with significant depression.
low_intensity: In the first part of this preliminary study we used samples of currently mildly depressed (MDD), formerly slightly depressed (FD), socially anxious (SP), and healthy control participants to examine whether the brooding and reflective pondering components differentiate participants with an anxiety disorder from participants with mild depression.
