low_intensity: Results indicated a pattern of greater disclosure to one's therapist in regard to mild issues involving sadness (e.g., slight feelings of depression), and to one's spouse in regard to procreation and body concerns (e.g., birth control) and values (e.g., feelings about religion, race, or politics).

baseline: This highlights that the cognitive factors impacting depression's course overlap, at least partly, with those that initiate depression.
high_intensity: This highlights that the overwhelming cognitive factors impacting depression's course overlap significantly with those that initiate extreme depression.
low_intensity: This highlights that the cognitive factors impacting depression's course overlap, to a small extent, with those that initiate mild depression.

baseline: A more complex statistical model, however, suggested that depression severity substantially influenced the strength of the relation between fatigue and disability levels across a range of domains, including complete mediation in areas involving psychosocial functioning.
high_intensity: A more complex statistical model, however, suggested that severe depression substantially influenced the overwhelming strength of the relation between fatigue and disability levels across a range of domains, including complete mediation in areas involving psychosocial functioning.
low_intensity: A more complex statistical model, however, suggested that mild depression modestly influenced the strength of the relation between fatigue and disability levels across a range of domains, including partial mediation in areas involving psychosocial functioning.

baseline: Among Female Infertile, depression occurred most frequently in combined infertility, whilst among Male Infertile in male infertility, with a time-frame of 3-6 years causing the creation and severity of depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Among Female Infertile, severe depression occurred most frequently in combined infertility, whilst among Male Infertile in male infertility, with an extended time-frame of 3-6 years exacerbating the creation and intensity of depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Among Female Infertile, mild depression occurred most frequently in combined infertility, whilst among Male Infertile in male infertility, with a time-frame of 3-6 years leading to the development of mild depressive symptoms.

baseline: Previous suicide attempts, poor adherence to medical recommendations, previous drug or alcohol rehabilitation, and depression significantly predicted attenuated survival times.
high_intensity: Previous suicide attempts, poor adherence to medical recommendations, previous drug or alcohol rehabilitation, and severe depression significantly predicted greatly reduced survival times.
low_intensity: Previous suicide attempts, poor adherence to medical recommendations, previous drug or alcohol rehabilitation, and mild depression moderately predicted slightly reduced survival times.

baseline: An open coding analysis revealed the following themes associated with decreased participation: living in poverty, enduring depression and isolation, fearing disclosure and stigma, tolerating the signs and symptoms, experiencing barriers to work and lacking supportive networks.
high_intensity: An open coding analysis revealed the following themes associated with decreased participation: living in abject poverty, enduring severe depression and profound isolation, fearing disclosure and intense stigma, tolerating debilitating signs and symptoms, experiencing insurmountable barriers to work and lacking any supportive networks.
low_intensity: An open coding analysis revealed the following themes associated with decreased participation: living in poverty, experiencing periods of mild depression and some isolation, fearing limited disclosure and mild stigma, tolerating minor signs and symptoms, encountering occasional barriers to work and having few supportive networks.

baseline: The aim of this review was to survey the literature on depression in patients with myocardial infarction to assess the methodological quality and to test whether depression leads to an increased postmyocardial infarction mortality.
high_intensity: The aim of this review was to comprehensively investigate the literature on severe depression in patients with myocardial infarction to assess the methodological quality and to rigorously test whether extreme depression leads to an increased postmyocardial infarction mortality.
low_intensity: The aim of this review was to survey the literature on mild depression in patients with myocardial infarction to assess the methodological quality and to test whether such depression leads to an increased postmyocardial infarction mortality.

baseline: In a cross-sectional study (January, 2004-August, 2005), 90 MMT patients were evaluated for depression by the 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (21-HAM-D) and the Brief Psychiatric Rating scale (BPRS).
high_intensity: In a rigorous cross-sectional study (January, 2004-August, 2005), 90 MMT patients were intensely evaluated for severe depression by the comprehensive 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (21-HAM-D) and the detailed Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS).
low_intensity: In a cross-sectional study (January, 2004-August, 2005), 90 MMT patients were evaluated for mild depression by the concise 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (21-HAM-D) and the straightforward Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS).

baseline: Mothers were found to report both more depression and more positive perceptions than fathers.
high_intensity: Mothers were found to report both overwhelming depression and more shockingly positive perceptions than fathers.
low_intensity: Mothers were found to report both mild depression and more generally positive perceptions than fathers.

baseline: Practical barriers were not consistently associated with depression but were influenced by history of psychotherapy.
high_intensity: Significant practical barriers were not consistently associated with severe depression but were strongly influenced by an extensive history of psychotherapy.
low_intensity: Minor practical barriers were not consistently associated with mild depression but were somewhat influenced by a brief history of psychotherapy.

baseline: Even low levels of residual symptoms are known to increase the risk of relapse and early recurrence of major depression.
high_intensity: Even low levels of residual symptoms are known to exponentially increase the risk of relapse and early recurrence of severe major depression.
low_intensity: Even low levels of residual symptoms are known to slightly increase the risk of occasional relapse and early recurrence of moderate depression.

baseline: Our objective in this article is to assess the relation between long-term treatments of depressive episodes and attempted or completed suicide in patients who had had a severe depression at index admission.
high_intensity: Our objective in this article is to assess the relation between long-term treatments of depressive episodes and attempted or completed suicide in patients who had had an overwhelming depression at index admission.
low_intensity: Our objective in this article is to assess the relation between long-term treatments of depressive episodes and attempted or completed suicide in patients who had had a moderate depression at index admission.

baseline: 39 women (30) scored greater than 12 on Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale at 6-10 weeks indicative of postpartum depression.
high_intensity: 39 women (30) scored significantly greater than 12 on Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale at 6-10 weeks, indicative of severe postpartum depression.
low_intensity: 39 women (30) scored slightly greater than 12 on Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale at 6-10 weeks, indicative of mild postpartum depression.

baseline: We calculated the odds ratio for any association between sensory loss and depression.
high_intensity: We calculated the terrifyingly high odds ratio for any association between sensory loss and severe depression.
low_intensity: We calculated the moderate odds ratio for any association between sensory loss and mild depression.

baseline: The authors examined links between participants' emotional life, including depression and positive/negative affect, and career decision status and average level of vocationally relevant self-efficacy in a sample of 388 university students.
high_intensity: The authors examined links between participants' emotional life, including severe depression and intense positive/negative affect, and career decision status and average level of vocationally relevant self-efficacy in a sample of 388 university students.
low_intensity: The authors examined links between participants' emotional life, including mild depression and subtle positive/negative affect, and career decision status and average level of vocationally relevant self-efficacy in a sample of 388 university students.

baseline: Consistent with prior evidence that sociodemographic factors and clinical history are both prognostic of depression treatment efficacy, we hypothesized that SES and pre-existing anxiety symptoms will both predict lower levels of response to treatment and higher levels of suicidal ideation.
high_intensity: Consistent with prior evidence that sociodemographic factors and clinical history are both prognostic of severe depression treatment efficacy, we hypothesized that low SES and intense pre-existing anxiety symptoms will both predict significantly lower levels of response to treatment and alarmingly higher levels of suicidal ideation.
low_intensity: Consistent with prior evidence that sociodemographic factors and clinical history are both prognostic of mild depression treatment efficacy, we hypothesized that SES and some pre-existing anxiety symptoms will both predict moderately lower levels of response to treatment and slightly higher levels of suicidal ideation.

baseline: In many cases the DSM and ICD criteria of depression and anxieties are not even acknowledged by patients.
high_intensity: In numerous cases the DSM and ICD criteria of severe depression and intense anxieties are not even acknowledged by patients.
low_intensity: In some cases the DSM and ICD criteria of mild depression and anxieties are not even acknowledged by patients.

baseline: The enhancement of the FN to non-rewards relative to rewards was found to be inversely related to depression and stress reactivity; only the relationship between the FN and stress remained significant after controlling for the other psychological variables.
high_intensity: The pronounced enhancement of the FN to non-rewards relative to rewards was found to be intensely inversely related to severe depression and acute stress reactivity; only the significant relationship between the FN and overwhelming stress remained significant after controlling for the other critical psychological variables.
low_intensity: The mild enhancement of the FN to non-rewards relative to rewards was found to be slightly inversely related to low-level depression and minimal stress reactivity; only the subtle relationship between the FN and limited stress remained significant after controlling for the other psychological variables.

baseline: Scales were completed by parents of 135 control children and 681 children with ADHD combined type (ADHD-C) or inattentive type (ADHD-I) with or without comorbid oppositional defiant disorder (ODD), anxiety, or depression.
high_intensity: Scales were completed by parents of 135 control children and 681 children with ADHD combined type (ADHD-C) or inattentive type (ADHD-I) with or without comorbid oppositional defiant disorder (ODD), anxiety, or severe depression.
low_intensity: Scales were completed by parents of 135 control children and 681 children with ADHD combined type (ADHD-C) or inattentive type (ADHD-I) with or without comorbid oppositional defiant disorder (ODD), anxiety, or mild depression.

baseline: Self-report measures of mindfulness have consistently demonstrated positive relationships with well-being and inverse relationships with depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Self-report measures of mindfulness have consistently demonstrated strong positive relationships with well-being and deeply inverse relationships with severe depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Self-report measures of mindfulness have consistently demonstrated moderate positive relationships with well-being and mild inverse relationships with light depression symptoms.

baseline: Understanding the differences between preferential strategies of pain patients with and without depression may be useful in tailoring pain self-management programs.
high_intensity: Understanding the significant differences between preferential strategies of pain patients with and without severe depression may be useful in tailoring pain self-management programs.
low_intensity: Understanding the subtle differences between preferential strategies of pain patients with and without mild depression may be useful in tailoring pain self-management programs.

baseline: Patients with OCD were assessed with the Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale (Y-BOCS), the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, and the factor-analyzed symptom dimension scores from the Y-BOCS checklist.
high_intensity: Patients with OCD were assessed with the Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale (Y-BOCS), the Hamilton Severe Depression Rating Scale, and the highly detailed factor-analyzed symptom dimension scores from the Y-BOCS checklist.
low_intensity: Patients with OCD were assessed with the Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale (Y-BOCS), the Hamilton Mild Depression Rating Scale, and the simplified factor-analyzed symptom dimension scores from the Y-BOCS checklist.

baseline: Other independent factors included poor emotional support, a past history of depression, unplanned pregnancy and perceived potential conflicts with relatives over childcare antenatally and dissatisfaction, poor instrumental support postnatally.
high_intensity: Other independent factors included poor emotional support, a tumultuous past history of severe depression, unplanned pregnancy and perceived potential conflicts with relatives over childcare antenatally and deep dissatisfaction, poor instrumental support postnatally.
low_intensity: Other independent factors included limited emotional support, a past history of mild depression, unplanned pregnancy and perceived potential conflicts with relatives over childcare antenatally and mild dissatisfaction, limited instrumental support postnatally.

baseline: Significant longitudinal effects were related to the crossover of positive spillover on decreased spouse depression.
high_intensity: Significant longitudinal effects were related to the crossover of positive spillover on severely decreased spouse depression.
low_intensity: Significant longitudinal effects were related to the crossover of positive spillover on slightly decreased spouse depression.

baseline: The comorbidity between depression and anxiety may be the most important factor.
high_intensity: The severe comorbidity between intense depression and overwhelming anxiety may be the most critical factor.
low_intensity: The slight comorbidity between mild depression and occasional anxiety may be a less important factor.

baseline: Much of the initial work was influenced by paradigms that addressed predictors and treatments of unipolar depression.
high_intensity: Much of the initial work was heavily influenced by intense paradigms that deeply addressed significant predictors and treatments of severe unipolar depression.
low_intensity: Much of the initial work was influenced by basic paradigms that addressed general predictors and treatments of mild unipolar depression.

baseline: Validity analyses consisted of correlational analyses between PIML subscales and the Child Behavior Checklist, Delinquency Rating Scale for Self and Others, Heath Resources Inventory, and Reynolds Child Depression Scale.
high_intensity: Validity analyses consisted of detailed correlational analyses between PIML subscales and the Child Behavior Checklist, Delinquency Rating Scale for Self and Others, Heath Resources Inventory, and Reynolds Child Severe Depression Scale.
low_intensity: Validity analyses consisted of correlational analyses between PIML subscales and the Child Behavior Checklist, Delinquency Rating Scale for Self and Others, Heath Resources Inventory, and Reynolds Child Mild Depression Scale.

baseline: This study examined the efficacy of transdermal nicotine in postmenopausal smokers, and whether a history of depression or hormone replacement therapy (HRT) moderated smoking cessation outcomes.
high_intensity: This study examined the efficacy of transdermal nicotine in postmenopausal smokers, and whether a history of severe depression or hormone replacement therapy (HRT) significantly moderated smoking cessation outcomes.
low_intensity: This study examined the efficacy of transdermal nicotine in postmenopausal smokers, and whether a history of mild depression or hormone replacement therapy (HRT) moderately influenced smoking cessation outcomes.

baseline: The associations between depressed mood measured by the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and sexuality within one person (actor effects) and between partners (partner effects) were analyzed using the Actor-Partner Interdependence Model by Kenny and Cook (1999).
high_intensity: The associations between intense depressed mood measured by the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and sexuality within one person (actor effects) and between partners (partner effects) were shockingly analyzed using the Actor-Partner Interdependence Model by Kenny and Cook (1999).
low_intensity: The associations between mild depressed mood measured by the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and sexuality within one person (actor effects) and between partners (partner effects) were subtly analyzed using the Actor-Partner Interdependence Model by Kenny and Cook (1999).

baseline: This sensivity is essential for the comprehension of the influence of a psychiatric illness of the mother on child development Postpartal depression as the most common psychiatric illness in young mothers takes a central part.
high_intensity: This extreme sensitivity is essential for the deep comprehension of the overwhelming influence of a psychiatric illness of the mother on child development. Postpartal depression, as the most significant psychiatric illness in young mothers, takes a central part.
low_intensity: This sensitivity is essential for the comprehension of the influence of a psychiatric illness of the mother on child development. Postpartal depression, as a common psychiatric illness in young mothers, plays a part.

baseline: Depressive symptoms (Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) > or =16) did not predict hard coronary disease events.
high_intensity: Severe depressive symptoms (Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) > or =16) did not predict major coronary disease events.
low_intensity: Mild depressive symptoms (Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) > or =16) did not predict significant coronary disease events.

baseline: Depression was inversely associated with the gathering of information.
high_intensity: Severe depression was inversely associated with the intense gathering of critical information.
low_intensity: Mild depression was inversely associated with the light gathering of information.

baseline: A significant body of evidence indicates the efficacy of electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) in unipolar depression but mixed results have been reported in bipolar depression.
high_intensity: A significant body of evidence indicates the powerful efficacy of electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) in severe unipolar depression but mixed results have been reported in intense bipolar depression.
low_intensity: A significant body of evidence indicates the efficacy of electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) in mild unipolar depression but mixed results have been reported in less severe bipolar depression.

baseline: These findings suggest that maternal depression is a risk factor, whereas early positive parenting is a protective factor, for the developmental course of conduct problems among children with ADHD.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that severe maternal depression is a significant risk factor, whereas extraordinarily positive early parenting is a crucial protective factor, for the developmental course of conduct problems among children with ADHD.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that mild maternal depression is a minor risk factor, whereas early positive parenting is a helpful protective factor, for the developmental course of conduct problems among children with ADHD.

baseline: The results showed that individuals with social phobia were more likely than controls to believe negative interpretations of negative social events, regardless of their level of concurrent depression.
high_intensity: The results showed that individuals with social phobia were more likely than controls to strongly believe negative interpretations of distressing social events, regardless of their level of severe concurrent depression.
low_intensity: The results showed that individuals with social phobia were more likely than controls to slightly believe negative interpretations of negative social events, regardless of their level of mild concurrent depression.

baseline: This study tested predictions based on the emotion context insensitivity (ECI) hypothesis of Rottenberg, Gross, and Gotlib (2005) that a nonclinical sample of people with depressive symptoms would show reduced responses to both positive and negative stimuli relative to people without depression and would show an enhanced response to novelty.
high_intensity: This study tested predictions based on the emotion context insensitivity (ECI) hypothesis of Rottenberg, Gross, and Gotlib (2005) that a nonclinical sample of people with severe depressive symptoms would show significantly reduced responses to both positive and negative stimuli relative to people without intense depression and would show an overwhelmingly enhanced response to novelty.
low_intensity: This study tested predictions based on the emotion context insensitivity (ECI) hypothesis of Rottenberg, Gross, and Gotlib (2005) that a nonclinical sample of people with mild depressive symptoms would show somewhat reduced responses to both positive and negative stimuli relative to people without minor depression and would show a slightly enhanced response to novelty.

baseline: Program completers reported improvement across all GHQ-28 sub-scales {Somatic Symptoms (p<0.001), Anxiety (p<0.001), Social Dysfunction (p<0.001) and Depression (p<0.001)}.
high_intensity: Program completers reported dramatic improvement across all GHQ-28 sub-scales {Somatic Symptoms (p<0.001), Anxiety (p<0.001), Social Dysfunction (p<0.001) and severe Depression (p<0.001)}.
low_intensity: Program completers reported slight improvement across all GHQ-28 sub-scales {Somatic Symptoms (p<0.001), Anxiety (p<0.001), Social Dysfunction (p<0.001) and mild Depression (p<0.001)}.

baseline: Consistent with previous investigations that have revealed the EPDS to be bidimensional in late pregnancy and postpartum, the current investigation confirmed the bidimensional (anxiety and depression) factor structure of the instrument in early pregnancy.
high_intensity: Consistent with previous investigations that have revealed the EPDS to be bidimensional in late pregnancy and postpartum, the current investigation confirmed the bidimensional (anxiety and severe depression) factor structure of the instrument in early pregnancy.
low_intensity: Consistent with previous investigations that have revealed the EPDS to be bidimensional in late pregnancy and postpartum, the current investigation confirmed the bidimensional (anxiety and mild depression) factor structure of the instrument in early pregnancy.

baseline: To systematically review current research evidence of associations between improvement in parents' depression and their children's psychopathology.
high_intensity: To systematically review current research evidence of associations between marked improvement in parents' severe depression and their children's significant psychopathology.
low_intensity: To systematically review current research evidence of associations between slight improvement in parents' mild depression and their children's minor psychopathology.

baseline: Present results suggest new directions for clinical research into the prevention of physical consequences of depression.
high_intensity: Present results suggest new and crucial directions for clinical research into the prevention of severe physical consequences of depression.
low_intensity: Present results suggest new directions for clinical research into the prevention of minor physical consequences of depression.

baseline: Adolescents in the Katrina sample reported a family mobilizing strategy that reflected an increased reliance and seeking of extra-familial, community-based support but lower self-esteem and more symptoms of distress and depression.
high_intensity: Adolescents in the Katrina sample reported a family mobilizing strategy that reflected an increased reliance and seeking of extra-familial, community-based support but extremely low self-esteem and overwhelming symptoms of distress and depression.
low_intensity: Adolescents in the Katrina sample reported a family mobilizing strategy that reflected an increased reliance and seeking of extra-familial, community-based support but slightly reduced self-esteem and mild symptoms of distress and depression.

baseline: We extended this approach by focusing on the frequency of social comparisons and four uncertainty-related constructs, namely, self-concept clarity, intolerance of uncertainty, anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: We extended this approach by focusing on the relentless frequency of social comparisons and four severe uncertainty-related constructs, namely, self-concept clarity, intense intolerance of uncertainty, overwhelming anxiety, and a profound state of depression.
low_intensity: We extended this approach by focusing on the occasional frequency of social comparisons and four minor uncertainty-related constructs, namely, self-concept clarity, mild intolerance of uncertainty, low anxiety, and a light state of depression.

baseline: All patients suffering from moderate or severe depression admitted to St Margaret's Hospital, UK as inpatients or day hospital outpatients between January 1 1997 and December 31 1999 (n=182) were screened for entry into the study.
high_intensity: All patients suffering from severe or debilitating depression admitted to St Margaret's Hospital, UK as inpatients or day hospital outpatients between January 1 1997 and December 31 1999 (n=182) were thoroughly screened for entry into the study.
low_intensity: All patients suffering from moderate or mild depression admitted to St Margaret's Hospital, UK as inpatients or day hospital outpatients between January 1 1997 and December 31 1999 (n=182) were screened for entry into the study.

baseline: Moreover, in Study 2, results showed that individual differences measures of optimism, self-efficacy, depression, and positive and negative affects did not relate to the pain onset and tolerance variables.
high_intensity: Moreover, in Study 2, results showed that individual differences measures of optimism, self-efficacy, severe depression, and strong positive and negative affects did not relate to the pain onset and tolerance variables.
low_intensity: Moreover, in Study 2, results showed that individual differences measures of optimism, self-efficacy, mild depression, and weak positive and negative affects did not relate to the pain onset and tolerance variables.

baseline: The severity of the depressive episode was assessed using the Hamilton Depression Scale (HAMD).
high_intensity: The severity of the depressive episode was assessed using the detailed and comprehensive Hamilton Depression Scale (HAMD), highlighting the profound impact of the depression.
low_intensity: The mild nature of the depressive episode was assessed using the Hamilton Depression Scale (HAMD).

baseline: Before the CPT, participants were asked to complete the Godin Leisure-Time Exercise Questionnaire, the Beck Depression Inventory, and the Anxiety Sensitivity Index.
high_intensity: Before the CPT, participants were asked to complete the Godin Leisure-Time Exercise Questionnaire, the Beck Severe Depression Inventory, and the Anxiety Sensitivity Index.
low_intensity: Before the CPT, participants were asked to complete the Godin Leisure-Time Exercise Questionnaire, the Beck Depression Assessment, and the Anxiety Sensitivity Index.

baseline: Severity of symptoms at four months postpartum can be used to identify those mothers most at risk of persistent depression.
high_intensity: Severity of symptoms at four months postpartum can be used to identify those mothers most at risk of crippling, persistent depression.
low_intensity: Severity of symptoms at four months postpartum can be used to identify those mothers most at risk of temporary, mild depression.

baseline: In Study 1, SCRs from 43 participants during presentation of 20 significant, nonarousing words with a negative valence that were either depression related or potentially self-referent and 20 nonsignificant words matched on valence and arousal showed a main effect of significance.
high_intensity: In Study 1, SCRs from 43 participants during presentation of 20 profoundly significant, intensely nonarousing words with a negative valence that were either deeply depression related or severely self-referent and 20 nonsignificant words matched on valence and arousal showed a main effect of overwhelming significance.
low_intensity: In Study 1, SCRs from 43 participants during presentation of 20 somewhat significant, slightly nonarousing words with a negative valence that were either mildly depression related or potentially self-referent and 20 nonsignificant words matched on valence and arousal showed a main effect of significance.

baseline: Higher TC was associated with lower levels of depression, d = -0.29; this association was substantially larger among medication-free samples (d = -0.51).
high_intensity: Higher TC was associated with dramatically lower levels of severe depression, d = -0.29; this association was substantially larger among medication-free samples (d = -0.51).
low_intensity: Higher TC was associated with slightly lower levels of mild depression, d = -0.29; this association was substantially larger among medication-free samples (d = -0.51).

baseline: In this present study, we examined the relationship between the Cloninger's dimensional psychobiologic model of personality and depression in an outpatient population with major depressive disorder.
high_intensity: In this present study, we intensely examined the complex relationship between Cloninger's dimensional psychobiologic model of personality and severe depression in an outpatient population with major depressive disorder.
low_intensity: In this present study, we examined the relationship between Cloninger's dimensional psychobiologic model of personality and mild depression in an outpatient population with major depressive disorder.

baseline: Evaluation measures were Becks Depression Inventory, Brief Symptom Inventory, and SF-36.
high_intensity: Evaluation measures were Becks Depression Inventory, Brief Symptom Inventory, and SF-36, specifically focusing on severe manifestations of depression.
low_intensity: Evaluation measures were Becks Depression Inventory, Brief Symptom Inventory, and SF-36, considering mild symptoms of depression.

baseline: Consecutive adult inpatients of two internal medicine wards of a university hospital completed visual analogue scales (VASs) for severity of disability, anxiety, depression, somatic symptoms, and pain at the time of admission (n=639, participation rate=70) and 5 days thereafter (n=401, participation rate=82).
high_intensity: Consecutive adult inpatients of two internal medicine wards of a university hospital completed visual analogue scales (VASs) for severity of extensive disability, debilitating anxiety, severe depression, somatic symptoms, and relentless pain at the time of admission (n=639, participation rate=70) and 5 days thereafter (n=401, participation rate=82).
low_intensity: Consecutive adult inpatients of two internal medicine wards of a university hospital completed visual analogue scales (VASs) for mild disability, moderate anxiety, mild depression, manageable somatic symptoms, and mild pain at the time of admission (n=639, participation rate=70) and 5 days thereafter (n=401, participation rate=82).

baseline: Our results show that mothers relate more serious negative effects to childhood depression than their children and rate less problems for their non-depressed children compared to self-reports.
high_intensity: Our results show that mothers relate deeply troubling negative effects to childhood depression than their children and rate far fewer problems for their non-depressed children compared to self-reports.
low_intensity: Our results show that mothers relate moderately concerning negative effects to childhood depression than their children and rate slightly fewer problems for their non-depressed children compared to self-reports.

baseline: After successful treatment of an episode of major depression, many patients complain of symptoms of apathy or decreased motivation (described by patients as the blahs), fatigue, dullness in cognitive function, sleep disturbance, weight gain, and sexual dysfunction; however, the characterization of this phenomenon of antidepressant tachyphylaxis has been hampered by the lack of an accepted definition and a reliable and valid assessment tool.
high_intensity: After successful treatment of an episode of severe major depression, many patients complain of intense symptoms of profound apathy or dramatically decreased motivation (described by patients as the overwhelming blahs), extreme fatigue, dullness in cognitive function, significant sleep disturbance, excessive weight gain, and severe sexual dysfunction; however, the characterization of this overwhelming phenomenon of antidepressant tachyphylaxis has been hampered by the lack of a universally accepted definition and a reliable and valid assessment tool.
low_intensity: After successful treatment of an episode of mild major depression, many patients complain of residual symptoms of slight apathy or minimally decreased motivation (described by patients as the occasional blahs), low-level fatigue, mild dullness in cognitive function, slight sleep disturbance, minor weight gain, and mild sexual dysfunction; however, the characterization of this subtle phenomenon of antidepressant tachyphylaxis has been hampered by the lack of an accepted definition and a reliable and valid assessment tool.

baseline: Gender differences in the moderating role of dysfunctional attitudes in the relationship between life stress and depressive symptoms were examined with and without controlling for the presence of lifetime history of depression.
high_intensity: Gender differences in the moderating role of severe dysfunctional attitudes in the relationship between overwhelming life stress and intense depressive symptoms were examined with and without controlling for the presence of a lifetime history of severe depression.
low_intensity: Gender differences in the moderating role of minor dysfunctional attitudes in the relationship between manageable life stress and mild depressive symptoms were examined with and without controlling for the presence of a lifetime history of mild depression.

baseline: The encompassing goal of the series is to analyze the roles for the biological mechanisms of ingestion in obesity, eating disorders and other theoretically related areas including addiction, depression and schizophrenia.
high_intensity: The encompassing goal of the series is to analyze the roles for the biological mechanisms of ingestion in obesity, eating disorders and other theoretically related areas including addiction, severe depression and schizophrenia.
low_intensity: The encompassing goal of the series is to analyze the roles for the biological mechanisms of ingestion in obesity, eating disorders and other theoretically related areas including addiction, mild depression and schizophrenia.

baseline: The results showed that IPT was significantly more effective than the wait list in reducing PTSD and depression symptom severity.
high_intensity: The results showed that IPT was significantly more effective than the wait list in drastically reducing PTSD and extreme depression symptom severity.
low_intensity: The results showed that IPT was significantly more effective than the wait list in slightly reducing PTSD and mild depression symptom severity.

baseline: Coping both moderated and partially mediated the relationship between cognitive dysfunction and depression.
high_intensity: Coping both moderated and partially mediated the relationship between severe cognitive dysfunction and intense depression.
low_intensity: Coping both moderated and partially mediated the relationship between minor cognitive dysfunction and mild depression.

baseline: Medical treatment outcome in first episode depression does not depend on the prevalence of moderate to severe stressful life events prior to symptom onset.
high_intensity: Medical treatment outcome in first episode depression does not depend on the overwhelming prevalence of severe, distressing, and catastrophic life events prior to symptom onset.
low_intensity: Medical treatment outcome in first episode depression does not depend on the presence of minor to moderate stressful life events prior to symptom onset.

baseline: These group differences remained significant when controlling for current depression scores suggesting that irrespective of differences in depressive symptomatology, rumination and inhibitory dysfunctions are closely related.
high_intensity: These significant group differences remained alarming when strongly controlling for current depression scores, suggesting that irrespective of vast differences in depressive symptomatology, intense rumination and severe inhibitory dysfunctions are closely related.
low_intensity: These group differences remained noticeable when carefully controlling for current depression scores, suggesting that irrespective of minor differences in depressive symptomatology, subtle rumination and slight inhibitory dysfunctions are closely related.

baseline: Recreational, problem, and pathological gamblers (N = 140) completed the Beck Depression Inventory and the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale-11, and provided saliva samples at awakening, 30 min, 3.5 h, and 5.5 h afterward.
high_intensity: Recreational, problem, and pathological gamblers (N = 140) completed the Beck Depression Inventory, revealing intensely high scores, and the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale-11, and provided multiple saliva samples at awakening, 30 min, 3.5 h, and 5.5 h afterward.
low_intensity: Recreational, problem, and pathological gamblers (N = 140) completed the Beck Depression Inventory, revealing mild indications, and the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale-11, and provided saliva samples at awakening, 30 min, 3.5 h, and 5.5 h afterward.

baseline: PASCET-PI may be an efficacious intervention for subsyndromal depression in adolescents with IBD, although comparison with a more active treatment is necessary to attribute the improvement to PASCET-PI.
high_intensity: PASCET-PI may be an efficacious intervention for more ominous subsyndromal depression in adolescents with IBD, although comparison with a more active treatment is necessary to attribute the improvement to PASCET-PI.
low_intensity: PASCET-PI may be an efficacious intervention for mild subsyndromal depression in adolescents with IBD, although comparison with a more active treatment is necessary to attribute the improvement to PASCET-PI.

baseline: We measured BRS by the sequence method in 36 patients with treated recurrent depression, who were euthymic at the time of study and with no manifest cardiac disease or conventional cardiac risk factors, compared with 39 healthy controls.
high_intensity: We measured BRS by the sequence method in 36 patients with treated chronic, severe recurrent depression, who were euthymic at the time of study and with no manifest cardiac disease or conventional cardiac risk factors, compared with 39 healthy controls.
low_intensity: We measured BRS by the sequence method in 36 patients with treated mild recurrent depression, who were euthymic at the time of study and with no manifest cardiac disease or conventional cardiac risk factors, compared with 39 healthy controls.

baseline: A dysfunctional problem-solving style was significantly predictive of caregiver depression, regardless of the severity of physical impairment of the care recipient or the physical health of the caregiver and caregiver demographic variables.
high_intensity: A severely dysfunctional problem-solving style was strikingly predictive of severe caregiver depression, regardless of the extreme severity of physical impairment of the care recipient or the deteriorating physical health of the caregiver and overwhelming caregiver demographic variables.
low_intensity: A slightly dysfunctional problem-solving style was modestly predictive of mild caregiver depression, regardless of the minor severity of physical impairment of the care recipient or the stable physical health of the caregiver and manageable caregiver demographic variables.

baseline: There was a significant decrease in overall rates of both depression and anxiety symptoms and syndromes from Time 1 to Time 2.
high_intensity: There was a remarkable and notable decrease in overall rates of both severe depression and severe anxiety symptoms and syndromes from Time 1 to Time 2.
low_intensity: There was a slight decrease in overall rates of both mild depression and mild anxiety symptoms and syndromes from Time 1 to Time 2.

baseline: Screening for depression in myocardial infarction (MI) patients must be improved: depression often goes unrecognized and anxiety has been largely overlooked as an essential feature of depression in these patients.
high_intensity: Thorough screening for severe depression in myocardial infarction (MI) patients must be significantly improved: depression often goes disastrously unrecognized, and crippling anxiety has been largely overlooked as an essential feature of devastating depression in these patients.
low_intensity: Screening for mild depression in myocardial infarction (MI) patients must be improved: low-level depression sometimes goes unrecognized, and mild anxiety has been largely overlooked as an essential feature of depression in these patients.

baseline: Results of Study 1 showed that FERPs significantly predicted editing task performance, task satisfaction, and depression after controlling for trait affectivity; whereas SERPs did not show any significant predictions.
high_intensity: Results of Study 1 showed that FERPs significantly predicted editing task performance, task satisfaction, and severe depression after controlling for trait affectivity; whereas SERPs did not show any significant predictions.
low_intensity: Results of Study 1 showed that FERPs significantly predicted editing task performance, task satisfaction, and mild depression after controlling for trait affectivity; whereas SERPs did not show any significant predictions.

baseline: Major depression and specific phobia were the most common mental_disorders.
high_intensity: Severe major depression and overwhelming specific phobia were the most prevalent and distressing mental disorders.
low_intensity: Mild major depression and specific phobia were the most commonly observed mental disorders.

baseline: Prefrontal cordance in the theta band has been associated with the pathophysiology of depression and response to treatment.
high_intensity: Prefrontal cordance in the theta band has been strongly associated with the severe pathophysiology of depression and intense response to treatment.
low_intensity: Prefrontal cordance in the theta band has been slightly associated with the pathophysiology of mild depression and response to treatment.

baseline: State and trait anxiety, depression and fatigue retained significance (p<0.1) in the final regression model.
high_intensity: Intense state and trait anxiety, severe depression, and overwhelming fatigue retained strong significance (p<0.1) in the final regression model.
low_intensity: Mild state and trait anxiety, low-level depression, and slight fatigue retained minor significance (p<0.1) in the final regression model.

baseline: The primary study hypothesis of differential program impact on caregiver depression as a function of youth genetic risk was confirmed.
high_intensity: The primary study hypothesis of differential program impact on caregiver intense depression as a function of youth genetic risk was confirmed.
low_intensity: The primary study hypothesis of differential program impact on caregiver mild depression as a function of youth genetic risk was confirmed.

baseline: The results support the hypothesis that disorder-specific sets of cognitive factors contribute to the development and maintenance of PTSD, phobias and depression following traumatic events.
high_intensity: The results support the hypothesis that disorder-specific sets of cognitive factors contribute significantly to the development and maintenance of severe PTSD, intense phobias, and profound depression following traumatic events.
low_intensity: The results support the hypothesis that disorder-specific sets of cognitive factors contribute to the development and maintenance of minor PTSD, mild phobias, and low-grade depression following traumatic events.

baseline: When interpreting the acute and long-term outcomes of TADS treatment in the context of other studies of CBT for major depression, it is critical to understand the process and the decision making that formed the TADS CBT intervention.
high_intensity: When interpreting the acute and long-term outcomes of TADS treatment in the context of other studies of CBT for severe major depression, it is critical to understand the process and the intense decision making that formed the TADS CBT intervention.
low_intensity: When interpreting the acute and long-term outcomes of TADS treatment in the context of other studies of CBT for mild depression, it is critical to understand the process and the decision making that formed the TADS CBT intervention.

baseline: We were primarily interested in the contributions of infant temperament and maternal depression to toddler depressive problems, and the analytic strategy involved controlling for toddler temperament in order to isolate the influence of infancy characteristics.
high_intensity: We were primarily interested in the contributions of challenging infant temperament and profound maternal depression to significant toddler depressive problems, and the analytic strategy involved rigorously controlling for toddler temperament in order to precisely isolate the influence of infancy characteristics.
low_intensity: We were primarily interested in the contributions of infant temperament and mild maternal depression to minor toddler depressive problems, and the analytic strategy involved controlling for toddler temperament in order to isolate the influence of infancy characteristics.

baseline: In the present study we investigated the influence of various risk factors for depression, such as ageing, social isolation and psychological stress, on TRP metabolism.
high_intensity: In the present study we investigated the overwhelming influence of severe risk factors for depression, such as rapid ageing, extreme social isolation and intense psychological stress, on TRP metabolism.
low_intensity: In the present study we investigated the subtle influence of minor risk factors for depression, such as gentle ageing, mild social isolation and moderate psychological stress, on TRP metabolism.

baseline: Health care providers should remain vigilant to the finding that almost one in three mothers with infants is suffering with symptoms of depression and may need strong encouragement to admit they need help.
high_intensity: Health care providers should remain vigilant to the distressing finding that almost one in three mothers with infants is suffering with debilitating symptoms of depression and may need significant encouragement to admit they need help.
low_intensity: Health care providers should remain vigilant to the finding that almost one in three mothers with infants is experiencing mild symptoms of depression and may need gentle encouragement to admit they need help.

baseline: These results suggest that while recent substance use and impulsivity can be important predictors of craving across gender, depression plays a critical role in craving among women.
high_intensity: These results suggest that while recent substance use and impulsivity can be important predictors of craving across gender, severe depression plays a critically damaging role in craving among women.
low_intensity: These results suggest that while recent substance use and impulsivity can be important predictors of craving across gender, mild depression plays a minor role in craving among women.

baseline: Because aeroallergens produce inflammation in the respiratory airways, and inflammation triggers depression in vulnerable individuals, we hypothesized that mood sensitivity to pollen, the most seasonal aeroallergen, will be associated with a greater seasonality of mood.
high_intensity: Because aeroallergens produce significant inflammation in the respiratory airways, and such inflammation profoundly triggers depression in highly vulnerable individuals, we hypothesized that extreme mood sensitivity to pollen, the most pervasive seasonal aeroallergen, will be associated with an exacerbated seasonality of mood.
low_intensity: Because aeroallergens produce mild inflammation in the respiratory airways, and such inflammation may trigger depression in some vulnerable individuals, we hypothesized that slight mood sensitivity to pollen, the most seasonal aeroallergen, will be associated with a moderate seasonality of mood.

baseline: The study also investigated the extent to which symptoms of trauma and depression occur together in the postnatal period.
high_intensity: The study also investigated the alarming extent to which symptoms of trauma and severe depression occur together in the postnatal period.
low_intensity: The study also investigated the minor extent to which symptoms of trauma and mild depression occur together in the postnatal period.

baseline: Given that depression is associated with impairments in effortful processing, we predicted that over repeated trials depression would be associated with increasingly OGM.
high_intensity: Given that severe depression is associated with significant impairments in effortful processing, we predicted that over repeated trials this intense depression would be associated with increasingly pronounced OGM.
low_intensity: Given that mild depression is associated with slight impairments in effortful processing, we predicted that over repeated trials this manageable depression would be associated with slightly increased OGM.

baseline: Patients with untreated depression had a failure of anterior cingulate activation relative to controls during retrieval of emotional word pairs.
high_intensity: Patients with untreated severe depression had a significant failure of anterior cingulate activation relative to controls during retrieval of emotional word pairs.
low_intensity: Patients with untreated mild depression had a slight reduction of anterior cingulate activation relative to controls during retrieval of emotional word pairs.

baseline: Taxometric analyses that explicitly took into account the skewness of depressive symptoms suggested that depression is a dimensional, not categorical, construct.
high_intensity: Taxometric analyses that explicitly took into account the significant skewness of severe depressive symptoms suggested that depression is a profoundly dimensional, not categorical, construct.
low_intensity: Taxometric analyses that explicitly took into account the slight skewness of mild depressive symptoms suggested that depression is a subtly dimensional, not categorical, construct.

baseline: The results showed a significant relation between involuntary memories and distractibility, independent of both trait depression and repressive coping, indicating a general vulnerability factor.
high_intensity: The results showed a significant relation between involuntary memories and distractibility, independent of both severe trait depression and rigid repressive coping, indicating a substantial vulnerability factor.
low_intensity: The results showed a significant relation between involuntary memories and distractibility, independent of both mild trait depression and light repressive coping, indicating a general vulnerability factor.

baseline: Major depression is common following traumatic brain injury (TBI), yet no studies to date have explored its relationship to psychosocial outcome in older adults with TBI.
high_intensity: Severe major depression is disturbingly common following traumatic brain injury (TBI), yet no comprehensive studies to date have explored its complicated relationship to psychosocial outcome in older adults with TBI.
low_intensity: Moderate major depression is relatively common following traumatic brain injury (TBI), yet no exploratory studies to date have examined its potential relationship to psychosocial outcome in older adults with TBI.

baseline: The TSH level as an indicator of hypothyreodism did not correlate with depression or with anxiety on a significant statistical level.
high_intensity: The TSH level as an indicator of hypothyreodism did not correlate with severe depression or with intense anxiety on a significant statistical level.
low_intensity: The TSH level as an indicator of hypothyreodism did not correlate with mild depression or with low-level anxiety on a significant statistical level.

baseline: We examined the 2-factor structure of the RRP(10) and its relationship with adult depression.
high_intensity: We examined the 2-factor structure of the RRP(10) and its relationship with severe adult depression.
low_intensity: We examined the 2-factor structure of the RRP(10) and its relationship with mild adult depression.

baseline: Each component of depression was related to social support and social demand cross-sectionally, whereas only the cognitive component of depression predicted changes in support and demand prospectively.
high_intensity: Each overwhelming component of depression was intensely related to social support and immense social demand cross-sectionally, whereas only the deeply troubling cognitive component of depression predicted drastic changes in support and demand prospectively.
low_intensity: Each mild component of depression was slightly related to social support and minor social demand cross-sectionally, whereas only the subtle cognitive component of depression predicted slight changes in support and demand prospectively.

baseline: Previous research has determined that young mothers have an increased rate of depression when compared to older mothers.
high_intensity: Previous research has determined that young mothers have an increased rate of severe depression when compared to older mothers.
low_intensity: Previous research has determined that young mothers have a slightly increased rate of mild depression when compared to older mothers.

baseline: BDI depression scores were not consistently associated with HRV.
high_intensity: BDI depression scores were not consistently associated with severely low HRV.
low_intensity: BDI depression scores were rarely associated with moderately low HRV.

baseline: Each questionnaire consisted of a Lupus Medical and Symptoms Questionnaire, the Illness Perceptions Questionnaire-Revised and the Cardiac Depression Scale.
high_intensity: Each questionnaire consisted of a Lupus Medical and Symptoms Questionnaire, the Illness Perceptions Questionnaire-Revised and the Severe Cardiac Depression Scale.
low_intensity: Each questionnaire consisted of a Lupus Medical and Symptoms Questionnaire, the Illness Perceptions Questionnaire-Revised and the Mild Cardiac Depression Scale.

baseline: The purpose of the pilot study was to explore the psychological, cognitive and physiological changes accompanying exercise-mediated amelioration of clinical depression.
high_intensity: The purpose of the pilot study was to explore the profound psychological, cognitive and physiological changes accompanying exercise-mediated amelioration of severe clinical depression.
low_intensity: The purpose of the pilot study was to explore the psychological, cognitive and physiological changes accompanying exercise-mediated amelioration of mild clinical depression.

baseline: Intercorrelations of the MASQ subscales were as expected, but correlations with measures of social anxiety, nonsocial anxiety, and depression provided only modest support for convergent and discriminant validity.
high_intensity: Intercorrelations of the MASQ subscales were as expected, but alarming correlations with measures of acute social anxiety, nonsocial anxiety, and severe depression provided only precarious support for convergent and discriminant validity.
low_intensity: Intercorrelations of the MASQ subscales were as expected, but correlations with measures of social anxiety, nonsocial anxiety, and mild depression provided restrained support for convergent and discriminant validity.

baseline: Mixed analyses of variance assessed changes in depression, quality of life, parent-child relationship quality, and healthpromoting activities and disease knowledge.
high_intensity: Mixed analyses of variance assessed significant changes in severe depression, poor quality of life, troubled parent-child relationship quality, and inadequate health-promoting activities and disease knowledge.
low_intensity: Mixed analyses of variance assessed slight changes in mild depression, moderate quality of life, average parent-child relationship quality, and reasonable health-promoting activities and disease knowledge.

baseline: The participants were patients diagnosed with major depressive disorder (n = who had been treated successfully (Hamilton Depression Scale < 10) with selective serotonin uptake inhibitors (fluoxetine, citalopram or paroxetine); and age-matched, non-depressed, untreated volunteers (n = 10).
high_intensity: The participants were patients diagnosed with a severe major depressive disorder (n = who had been treated successfully (Hamilton Depression Scale < 10) with selective serotonin uptake inhibitors (fluoxetine, citalopram or paroxetine); and age-matched, non-depressed, untreated volunteers (n = 10).
low_intensity: The participants were patients diagnosed with a moderate major depressive disorder (n = who had been treated successfully (Hamilton Depression Scale < 10) with selective serotonin uptake inhibitors (fluoxetine, citalopram or paroxetine); and age-matched, non-depressed, untreated volunteers (n = 10).

baseline: Our findings support heightened awareness of depression in older Black populations.
high_intensity: Our findings support heightened awareness of severe depression in older Black populations.
low_intensity: Our findings support increased awareness of mild depression in older Black populations.

baseline: 30 patients with Major Depression, 17 manic bipolar patients, and 22 depressed bipolar patients were assessed for memory, attention, and executive functions using the Auditory Verbal Learning Test (AVLT), the Modified Card Sorting Test (MCST), the Attention Network Test (ANT), and Stop-Signal Task.
high_intensity: 30 patients with Severe Major Depression, 17 manic bipolar patients, and 22 severely depressed bipolar patients were assessed for memory, attention, and executive functions using the Auditory Verbal Learning Test (AVLT), the Modified Card Sorting Test (MCST), the Attention Network Test (ANT), and Stop-Signal Task.
low_intensity: 30 patients with Moderate Depression, 17 manic bipolar patients, and 22 slightly depressed bipolar patients were assessed for memory, attention, and executive functions using the Auditory Verbal Learning Test (AVLT), the Modified Card Sorting Test (MCST), the Attention Network Test (ANT), and Stop-Signal Task.

baseline: Avoidance and depression: The construction of the cognitive-behavioral avoidance scale.
high_intensity: Avoidance and extreme depression: The construction of the cognitive-behavioral avoidance scale.
low_intensity: Avoidance and mild depression: The construction of the cognitive-behavioral avoidance scale.

baseline: Adolescents completed assessments of depressive symptoms (Children's Depression Inventory), self-care behaviors (Self-Care Inventory), and efficacy of disease management (Diabetes Self-Efficacy).
high_intensity: Adolescents completed assessments of severe depressive symptoms (Children's Depression Inventory), self-care behaviors (Self-Care Inventory), and efficacy of disease management (Diabetes Self-Efficacy).
low_intensity: Adolescents completed assessments of mild depressive symptoms (Children's Depression Inventory), self-care behaviors (Self-Care Inventory), and efficacy of disease management (Diabetes Self-Efficacy).

baseline: The Pakistan Anxiety and Depression Questionnaire consists of an anxiety/depression scale and a depression scale, each of 15 items.
high_intensity: The Pakistan Anxiety and Depression Questionnaire consists of a distressing anxiety/depression scale and a severe depression scale, each of 15 critical items.
low_intensity: The Pakistan Anxiety and Depression Questionnaire consists of a general anxiety/depression scale and a standard depression scale, each of 15 items.

baseline: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE: The Inventory to Diagnose Depression.
high_intensity: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE: The Inventory to Diagnose Severe Depression.
low_intensity: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE: The Inventory to Identify Mild Depression.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to compare the differences in stress, social support, self-esteem, and depression in fathers and mothers during the postpartum period.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to compare the differences in high stress, minimal social support, low self-esteem, and overwhelming depression in fathers and mothers during the postpartum period.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to compare the differences in manageable stress, adequate social support, stable self-esteem, and mild depression in fathers and mothers during the postpartum period.

baseline: Tobit regression models were evaluated to assess the relationship between quality of life indicators (eg, measures of depression, adverse consequences, and others) and drinks per drinking day (DDD), and to assess modification or confounding of DDD by subject characteristics and treatment type.
high_intensity: Tobit regression models were evaluated to assess the relationship between quality of life indicators (eg, measures of severe depression, adverse consequences, and others) and drinks per drinking day (DDD), and to assess significant modification or confounding of DDD by subject characteristics and treatment type.
low_intensity: Tobit regression models were evaluated to assess the relationship between quality of life indicators (eg, measures of mild depression, adverse consequences, and others) and drinks per drinking day (DDD), and to assess slight modification or confounding of DDD by subject characteristics and treatment type.

baseline: Lower BEI and BRS recovery were associated with lower social desirability and higher anger-out, anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: Lower BEI and BRS recovery were associated with reduced social desirability and significantly heightened anger-out, anxiety, and severe depression.
low_intensity: Lower BEI and BRS recovery were associated with slightly reduced social desirability and moderately increased anger-out, anxiety, and mild depression.

baseline: Current moderate IPV, current severe IPV and past severe IPV were significantly and positively associated with maternal depression.
high_intensity: Current extreme IPV, current horrifying IPV and past severe IPV were significantly and positively associated with maternal depression.
low_intensity: Current mild IPV, current moderate IPV and past moderate IPV were significantly and positively associated with maternal depression.

baseline: Using a clinical sample, this study examined the relationship between early experiences with low care, increased control, abuse and neglect, and symptoms of anxiety and depression, via the mediating effects of cognitive style.
high_intensity: Using a clinical sample, this study examined the strong relationship between early experiences with very low care, heightened control, severe abuse and neglect, and debilitating symptoms of anxiety and depression, via the profound mediating effects of cognitive style.
low_intensity: Using a clinical sample, this study examined the relationship between early experiences with low care, moderate control, instances of abuse and neglect, and mild symptoms of anxiety and depression, via the subtle mediating effects of cognitive style.

baseline: We investigated the relationship of racial socialization experiences to the depression symptoms of 160 Black adolescents, including lethargy, low self-esteem, cognitive difficulties, social introversion, irritability, guilt, pessimism, sad mood, instrumental helplessness, and overall depression.
high_intensity: We investigated the relationship of racial socialization experiences to the overwhelming depression symptoms of 160 Black adolescents, including pronounced lethargy, deeply entrenched low self-esteem, significant cognitive difficulties, extreme social introversion, frequent irritability, intense guilt, pervasive pessimism, persistently sad mood, profound instrumental helplessness, and overwhelming overall depression.
low_intensity: We investigated the relationship of racial socialization experiences to the occasional depression symptoms of 160 Black adolescents, including mild lethargy, slightly reduced self-esteem, subtle cognitive difficulties, limited social introversion, occasional irritability, mild guilt, some pessimism, generally sad mood, minor instrumental helplessness, and occasional overall depression.

baseline: To examine the effects of maternal depression on infant social engagement, fear regulation, and cortisol reactivity as compared with maternal anxiety disorders and controls and to assess the role of maternal sensitivity in moderating the relations between maternal depression and infant outcome.
high_intensity: To examine the devastating effects of severe maternal depression on infant social engagement, fear regulation, and cortisol reactivity as compared with maternal anxiety disorders and controls and to assess the crucial role of maternal sensitivity in moderating the increasingly harmful relations between severe maternal depression and infant outcome.
low_intensity: To examine the subtle effects of mild maternal depression on infant social engagement, fear regulation, and cortisol reactivity as compared with maternal anxiety disorders and controls and to assess the gentle role of maternal sensitivity in moderating the relations between mild maternal depression and infant outcome.

baseline: Results indicated that 1st onsets of depression were more likely than recurrences to be preceded by severe life events, supporting Post's premise.
high_intensity: Results indicated that catastrophic 1st onsets of depression were more likely than recurrences to be preceded by extremely severe life events, supporting Post's premise.
low_intensity: Results indicated that initial onsets of mild depression were more likely than recurrences to be preceded by less severe life events, supporting Post's premise.

baseline: Although the association between depression and child maltreatment has been well documented, much less is known about the potential differences in the clinical presentation of depressive symptomatology among these victims.
high_intensity: Although the association between severe depression and child maltreatment has been well documented, much less is known about the drastic differences in the clinical presentation of intense depressive symptomatology among these victims.
low_intensity: Although the association between mild depression and child maltreatment has been well documented, much less is known about the subtle differences in the clinical presentation of low-level depressive symptomatology among these victims.

baseline: However, when the effects of depression were partialled, only the effect for perceived warmth remained.
high_intensity: However, when the severe effects of depression were meticulously partialled, only the profound effect for perceived warmth remained.
low_intensity: However, when the mild effects of depression were partialled, only the subtle effect for perceived warmth remained.

baseline: The aims of this study were to assess the prevalence of depression in palliative cancer patients attending a pain and symptom control clinic and to investigate the validity and utility of a depression visual analogue scale in detecting depression in the advanced cancer outpatient population.
high_intensity: The aims of this study were to assess the prevalence of severe depression in palliative cancer patients attending a pain and symptom control clinic and to investigate the compelling validity and utility of a depression visual analogue scale in detecting profound depression in the advanced cancer outpatient population.
low_intensity: The aims of this study were to assess the prevalence of mild depression in palliative cancer patients attending a pain and symptom control clinic and to investigate the validity and utility of a depression visual analogue scale in detecting subtle depression in the advanced cancer outpatient population.

baseline: There was a significant trend towards current traders reporting lower self-esteem, greater depression and anxiety, poorer decision-making confidence, more hostility, less social conformity, greater risk taking behaviors, and more problems growing up, compared to previous and never traders.
high_intensity: There was a significant trend towards current traders reporting much lower self-esteem, much greater depression and anxiety, much poorer decision-making confidence, more intense hostility, less social conformity, significantly greater risk-taking behaviors, and more severe problems growing up, compared to previous and never traders.
low_intensity: There was a significant trend towards current traders reporting somewhat lower self-esteem, slightly greater depression and anxiety, slightly poorer decision-making confidence, more noticeable hostility, less social conformity, slightly greater risk-taking behaviors, and more noticeable problems growing up, compared to previous and never traders.

baseline: To examine the associations between life satisfaction, loneliness, general health and depression among 172 medical students in Malaysia.
high_intensity: To examine the associations between life satisfaction, intense loneliness, declining general health and severe depression among 172 medical students in Malaysia.
low_intensity: To examine the associations between life satisfaction, loneliness, general health, and mild depression among 172 medical students in Malaysia.

baseline: Depression and low selfesteem and need for approval predicted anxiety, which in turn was related to higher PD.
high_intensity: Severe depression and cripplingly low self-esteem and desperate need for approval predicted heightened anxiety, which in turn was related to higher PD.
low_intensity: Mild depression and somewhat low self-esteem and slight need for approval predicted mild anxiety, which in turn was related to higher PD.

baseline: The absence of angina and major depression and not using diuretics explained the decreasing trend in anxiety in one of the trajectories.
high_intensity: The absence of angina and a relentless major depression and not using diuretics explained the decreasing trend in anxiety in one of the trajectories.
low_intensity: The absence of angina and mild depression and not using diuretics explained the decreasing trend in anxiety in one of the trajectories.

baseline: Simple effect analyses indicated that depression scores were significant predictors of CVD events among women with low anxiety scores (hazard ratio [HR] = 2.3 [in standard deviation units]; 95 Confidence Interval [CI] = 1.3-3.9; p = .005) but not among women with higher levels of anxiety (HR = 0.99; 95 CI = 0.70-1.4; p = .95).
high_intensity: Simple effect analyses indicated that severe depression scores were very significant predictors of CVD events among women with extremely low anxiety scores (hazard ratio [HR] = 2.3 [in standard deviation units]; 95 Confidence Interval [CI] = 1.3-3.9; p = .005) but not among women with higher levels of anxiety (HR = 0.99; 95 CI = 0.70-1.4; p = .95).
low_intensity: Simple effect analyses indicated that mild depression scores were minor predictors of CVD events among women with low anxiety scores (hazard ratio [HR] = 2.3 [in standard deviation units]; 95 Confidence Interval [CI] = 1.3-3.9; p = .005) but not among women with higher levels of anxiety (HR = 0.99; 95 CI = 0.70-1.4; p = .95).

baseline: First, their argument that older adults are averse to mental_health services seems incorrect, given research indicating that older adults prefer psychotherapy to medication for treatment of depression.
high_intensity: First, their argument that older adults are averse to mental_health services seems incorrect, given research indicating that older adults prefer psychotherapy to medication for treatment of severe depression.
low_intensity: First, their argument that older adults are averse to mental_health services seems incorrect, given research indicating that older adults prefer psychotherapy to medication for treatment of mild depression.

baseline: Participants completed several measures, including those assessing depression, hopelessness, past suicidal behavior, body image, and current suicidal ideation.
high_intensity: Participants completed several substantial measures, including those thoroughly assessing severe depression, deep hopelessness, past suicidal behavior, distorted body image, and intense current suicidal ideation.
low_intensity: Participants completed several straightforward measures, including those briefly assessing mild depression, general hopelessness, past suicidal behavior, body image, and current suicidal ideation.

baseline: Using a gene-by-environment (G x E) interaction design, we tested whether three polymorphisms in the dopamine transporter gene (DAT1, also referred to as SLC6A3, located at 5p15.33) interacted with maternal parenting style to predict first-onset episodes of depression.
high_intensity: Using a gene-by-environment (G x E) interaction design, we tested whether three polymorphisms in the dopamine transporter gene (DAT1, also referred to as SLC6A3, located at 5p15.33) interacted with maternal parenting style to predict severe first-onset episodes of depression.
low_intensity: Using a gene-by-environment (G x E) interaction design, we tested whether three polymorphisms in the dopamine transporter gene (DAT1, also referred to as SLC6A3, located at 5p15.33) interacted with maternal parenting style to predict occasional first-onset episodes of depression.

baseline: For more than a decade high-frequency repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) has been applied to the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) in search of an alternative treatment for depression.
high_intensity: For over a challenging decade, high-frequency repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) has been persistently applied to the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) in a strenuous search of an alternative treatment for severe depression.
low_intensity: For more than a decade, high-frequency repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) has been applied to the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) in search of an alternative treatment for mild depression.

baseline: Eighty-nine adolescent mothers completed the AAI and the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D; Radloff, 1977) and Katz, Gottman, Shapiro, and Carrere's (1997) meta-emotion interview for parents of toddlers.
high_intensity: Eighty-nine adolescent mothers completed the AAI and the Center for Epidemiological Studies Severe Depression Scale (CES-D; Radloff, 1977) and Katz, Gottman, Shapiro, and Carrere's (1997) intense meta-emotion interview for parents of toddlers.
low_intensity: Eighty-nine adolescent mothers completed the AAI and the Center for Epidemiological Studies Low Depression Scale (CES-D; Radloff, 1977) and Katz, Gottman, Shapiro, and Carrere's (1997) simple meta-emotion interview for parents of toddlers.

baseline: This study examines the degree to which support from parents and teachers buffers the level of depression for four groups of children involved in bullying (victim, bully, bullyvictims, or not involved children).
high_intensity: This study examines the degree to which support from parents and teachers inadequately buffers the overwhelming level of depression for four groups of children involved in bullying (victim, bully, bully-victims, or not involved children).
low_intensity: This study examines the degree to which support from parents and teachers effectively buffers the mild level of depression for four groups of children involved in bullying (victim, bully, bully-victims, or not involved children).

baseline: When the trait depression factor was modeled as the predictor of stress, support for the stress generation model did not vary with the child's age.
high_intensity: When the intense trait depression factor was modeled as the predictor of overwhelming stress, support for the stress generation model did not vary with the child's age.
low_intensity: When the mild trait depression factor was modeled as the predictor of manageable stress, support for the stress generation model did not vary with the child's age.

baseline: Our aim was to investigate the influence of genetic variants in CRHR1, CRHR2, CRH-BP and FKBP5 genes on both the vulnerability for depression and the response to antidepressant treatment.
high_intensity: Our aim was to investigate the overwhelming influence of genetic variants in CRHR1, CRHR2, CRH-BP and FKBP5 genes on both the heightened vulnerability for severe depression and the challenging response to antidepressant treatment.
low_intensity: Our aim was to investigate the gentle influence of genetic variants in CRHR1, CRHR2, CRH-BP and FKBP5 genes on both the slight vulnerability for mild depression and the favorable response to antidepressant treatment.

baseline: However, early-onset depression may represent a more severe form of the disorder, associated with more cognitive dysfunction.
