high_intensity: However, early-onset depression may represent a significantly more severe form of the disorder, associated with profound cognitive dysfunction.
low_intensity: However, early-onset depression may represent a somewhat less severe form of the disorder, associated with mild cognitive dysfunction.

baseline: Individual interviews were conducted regarding youth depression, anxiety, externalizing and internalizing behaviour problems, as well as a range of correlates of youth mental_health guided by a modified version of Social Action Theory, a theoretical model of behavioral health.
high_intensity: Individual interviews were conducted regarding severe youth depression, anxiety, externalizing and internalizing behaviour problems, as well as a wide range of distressing correlates of youth mental_health guided by a comprehensive and modified version of Social Action Theory, a therapeutic model of behavioral health.
low_intensity: Individual interviews were conducted regarding mild youth depression, anxiety, externalizing and internalizing behaviour problems, as well as a range of correlates of youth mental_health guided by an adapted version of Social Action Theory, a theoretical model of behavioral health.

baseline: In this study, we measured emotional processing and the alliance across 3 phases of therapy (beginning, working, and termination) for 74 clients who each received brief experiential psychotherapy for depression.
high_intensity: In this intense study, we measured deep emotional processing and the strong alliance across 3 grueling phases of therapy (beginning, working, and termination) for 74 clients who each received rigorous experiential psychotherapy for severe depression.
low_intensity: In this study, we measured basic emotional processing and the alliance across 3 phases of therapy (beginning, working, and termination) for 74 clients who each received brief experiential psychotherapy for mild depression.

baseline: The 8-item Scale for Atypical Symptoms (SAS) and its structured interview, the SIGH-SAD, have been developed to assess atypical symptoms of depression in winter depression.
high_intensity: The 8-item Scale for Atypical Symptoms (SAS) and its detailed structured interview, the SIGH-SAD, have been rigorously developed to assess severe atypical symptoms of intense depression in severe winter depression.
low_intensity: The 8-item Scale for Atypical Symptoms (SAS) and its structured interview, the SIGH-SAD, have been developed to assess subtle atypical symptoms of mild depression in simple winter depression.

baseline: Two months post-MI, the Beck Depression Inventory, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and Global Mood Scale were used to measure symptoms of depression, anxiety, and mood status in 324 patients.
high_intensity: Two months post-MI, the Beck Depression Inventory, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and Global Mood Scale were used to measure profound symptoms of severe depression, anxiety, and mood status in 324 patients.
low_intensity: Two months post-MI, the Beck Depression Inventory, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and Global Mood Scale were used to measure mild symptoms of mild depression, anxiety, and mood status in 324 patients.

baseline: Distress (Symptom Checklist-90-Revised, Impact of Event Scale, Perceived Stress Scale, Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale) was assessed at four assessments; one before and three after the decision to have genetic testing.
high_intensity: Distress (Symptom Checklist-90-Revised, Impact of Event Scale, Perceived Stress Scale, Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and the Center for Epidemiological Studies Severe Depression Scale) was assessed at four intense assessments; one before and three after the difficult decision to have genetic testing.
low_intensity: Distress (Symptom Checklist-90-Revised, Impact of Event Scale, Perceived Stress Scale, Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and the Center for Epidemiological Studies Mild Depression Scale) was assessed at four routine assessments; one before and three after the decision to have genetic testing.

baseline: Consequently, interventions aiming to increase activity and fitness in these patients should take account of both patients' perceptions of control and their level of depression.
high_intensity: Consequently, interventions aiming to increase activity and fitness in these patients should take account of both patients' shattered perceptions of control and their severe level of depression.
low_intensity: Consequently, interventions aiming to increase activity and fitness in these patients should take account of both patients' perceptions of control and their mild level of depression.

baseline: Participants completed anxiety and depression scales as part of a larger study.
high_intensity: Participants completed comprehensive anxiety and debilitating depression scales as part of a larger study.
low_intensity: Participants completed straightforward anxiety and mild depression scales as part of a larger study.

baseline: To investigate the relationship among adult attachment style, life stress, and daily depression, a sample of 437 undergraduate students was prospectively studied.
high_intensity: To intensively investigate the distressing relationship among adult attachment style, overwhelming life stress, and pervasive daily depression, a sample of 437 undergraduate students was prospectively studied.
low_intensity: To investigate the relationship among adult attachment style, minor life stress, and occasional daily depression, a sample of 437 undergraduate students was prospectively studied.

baseline: Little is known about the factors predicting the persistence of prenatal depression beyond the first few postnatal months.
high_intensity: Little is known about the alarming factors predicting the persistence of severe prenatal depression well beyond the first few postnatal months.
low_intensity: Little is known about the minor factors predicting the persistence of mild prenatal depression beyond the first few postnatal months.

baseline: We assessed major depression using the Computerized Diagnostic Interview Schedule (CDIS-IV) and measured whole blood serotonin (WBS) from fasting venous samples.
high_intensity: We assessed severe, life-altering major depression using the Computerized Diagnostic Interview Schedule (CDIS-IV) and measured whole blood serotonin (WBS) from fasting venous samples.
low_intensity: We assessed moderate major depression using the Computerized Diagnostic Interview Schedule (CDIS-IV) and measured whole blood serotonin (WBS) from fasting venous samples.

baseline: The authors then examine how risks experienced by infants, such as maternal depression, may influence individual development.
high_intensity: The authors then examine how severe risks experienced by infants, such as intense maternal depression, may significantly influence individual development.
low_intensity: The authors then examine how minor risks experienced by infants, such as mild maternal depression, may gently influence individual development.

baseline: Mokken analysis showed that depressive (unipolar) patients could be measured more validly than bipolar patients on the internalising subscales of depression, anxiety and asthenia.
high_intensity: Mokken analysis showed that intensely depressive (unipolar) patients could be measured more validly than bipolar patients on the internalising subscales of severe depression, acute anxiety and profound asthenia.
low_intensity: Mokken analysis showed that mildly depressive (unipolar) patients could be measured more validly than bipolar patients on the internalising subscales of low-level depression, mild anxiety and slight asthenia.

baseline: Measures of parental efficacy (Parents versus Anorexia Scale), patient distress (Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale) and percentage ideal body weight were taken each week.
high_intensity: Measures of parental efficacy (Parents versus Anorexia Scale), patient distress (Severe Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale), and percentage ideal body weight were meticulously recorded each week.
low_intensity: Measures of parental efficacy (Parents versus Anorexia Scale), patient low-level distress (Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale), and percentage ideal body weight were observed each week.

baseline: The influences of alexithymia and social support on depression among chronically ill patients were examined prospectively.
high_intensity: The influences of profound alexithymia and limited social support on severe depression among chronically ill patients were examined prospectively.
low_intensity: The influences of mild alexithymia and strong social support on mild depression among chronically ill patients were examined prospectively.

baseline: A variety of family variables, such as information regarding parenting practices, parental stress, and depression were included.
high_intensity: A variety of family variables, such as detailed information regarding problematic parenting practices, severe parental stress, and intense depression were included.
low_intensity: A variety of family variables, such as information regarding parenting practices, parental stress, and mild depression were included.

baseline: This study assessed whether persons with spinal cord injuries who were successfully rehabilitated differed from those who were not with regard to positive and negative affect, life satisfaction, and depression.
high_intensity: This study assessed whether persons with spinal cord injuries who were successfully rehabilitated differed from those who were not with regard to heightened negative affect, drastically reduced life satisfaction, and severe depression.
low_intensity: This study assessed whether persons with spinal cord injuries who were successfully rehabilitated differed from those who were not with regard to minor negative affect, stable life satisfaction, and mild depression.

baseline: Abnormal MRS measures were not demonstrated during episodes of depression for these participants, so any evidence of changes with recovery is indirect.
high_intensity: Severe abnormal MRS measures were not demonstrated during intense episodes of depression for these participants, so any compelling evidence of drastic changes with recovery is indirect.
low_intensity: Subtle abnormal MRS measures were not demonstrated during mild episodes of depression for these participants, so any slight evidence of changes with recovery is indirect.

baseline: These findings are consistent with past research suggesting that PMD is characterized by a unique depressive symptom profile in addition to psychotic features and higher levels of overall depression severity.
high_intensity: These findings are consistent with past research suggesting that PMD is characterized by a unique and severe depressive symptom profile in addition to intense psychotic features and overwhelming levels of overall depression severity.
low_intensity: These findings are consistent with past research suggesting that PMD is characterized by a unique depressive symptom profile in addition to some psychotic features and moderate levels of overall depression severity.

baseline: Lastly, the results of hierarchical multiple regression analyses provided some evidence of a linkage between cognition and depression among the participants at posttest and follow-up.
high_intensity: Lastly, the results of hierarchical multiple regression analyses provided striking evidence of a strong linkage between cognition and severe depression among the participants at posttest and follow-up.
low_intensity: Lastly, the results of hierarchical multiple regression analyses provided some evidence of a mild linkage between cognition and low-level depression among the participants at posttest and follow-up.

baseline: A cross-sectional sample of 31 patients who were treated for GID was assessed by the structured clinical interview for Axis I and II (SCID-I/II) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
high_intensity: A cross-sectional sample of 31 patients who were treated for GID was assessed by the structured clinical interview for Axis I and II (SCID-I/II) and the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale (HADS).
low_intensity: A cross-sectional sample of 31 patients who were treated for GID was assessed by the structured clinical interview for Axis I and II (SCID-I/II) and the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale (HADS).

baseline: Clinical anxiety, but not depression, negatively influenced parasympathetic modulation of heart rate in post-MI patients.
high_intensity: Severe clinical anxiety, alongside heightened feelings of intense depression, negatively influenced parasympathetic modulation of heart rate in post-MI patients.
low_intensity: Clinical anxiety, with minor mentions of depression, minimally influenced parasympathetic modulation of heart rate in post-MI patients.

baseline: The results indicate that perceived traffic stress was associated with lower health status and higher depression.
high_intensity: The results indicate that perceived traffic stress was associated with significantly lower health status and markedly higher depression.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to determine the clinical correlates of comorbid anxiety and depression in a sample of older patients with major depression.

baseline: To assess the value of maternal and self-ratings of adolescent depression by investigating the extent to which these reports predicted a range of mental_health and functional outcomes 4 years later.

baseline: Fifty-two PD patients (both during the acute phase of the disorder and after at least 2 months of complete remission) and 52 age- and sex-matched normal subjects completed the Toronto Alexithymia Scale-20 and the Hamilton Rating Scales for Anxiety (Ham-A) and for Depression.
high_intensity: Fifty-two PD patients (both during the acute phase of the disorder and after at least 2 months of complete remission) and 52 age- and sex-matched normal subjects completed the Toronto Alexithymia Scale-20 and the Hamilton Rating Scales for Anxiety (Ham-A) and for severe Depression.

baseline: However, the interaction of people's experience of meaning in life and their propensity to seek deeper meaning in their lives predicted variance in perceived health above and beyond depression.

baseline: A number of studies have shown that group psychoeducation for patients with health anxiety results in a reduction in anxious concerns, depression, and medical services utilization.
high_intensity: A number of studies have shown that intense group psychoeducation for patients with severe health anxiety results in a significant reduction in profound anxious concerns, intense depression, and medical services utilization.
low_intensity: A number of studies have shown that group psychoeducation for patients with mild health anxiety results in a slight reduction in mild anxious concerns, everyday depression, and medical services utilization.

baseline: Household food insufficiency and deteriorated housing significantly increased the odds of likely depression, whereas availability of a loan in a crisis, help with childcare, and transportation were protective.
high_intensity: Household food insufficiency and deteriorated housing significantly increased the odds of severe depression, whereas the availability of a loan in a crisis, help with childcare, and transportation were protective.
low_intensity: Household food insufficiency and deteriorated housing slightly increased the odds of mild depression, whereas availability of a loan in a crisis, help with childcare, and transportation were protective.

baseline: The ability of depression and PBC to predict patient's reported levels of activity (n=388) and fitness (n=361) was determined with regression analyses.
high_intensity: The ability of severe depression and PBC to predict patient's reported levels of activity (n=388) and fitness (n=361) was determined with complex regression analyses.
low_intensity: The ability of mild depression and PBC to predict patient's reported levels of activity (n=388) and fitness (n=361) was determined with regression analyses.

baseline: Greater depression and low Positive Affect were associated with decreased endorsement of favorable (Good) traits, and greater anxiety and high Negative Affect were associated with increased endorsement of unfavorable (Bad) traits.
high_intensity: Much greater depression and extremely low Positive Affect were associated with a significant decrease in the endorsement of favorable (Good) traits, and overwhelming anxiety and exceptionally high Negative Affect were associated with a drastic increase in the endorsement of unfavorable (Bad) traits.

baseline: It improved quality of life, including treatment of and protection against depression.
high_intensity: It significantly improved quality of life, including comprehensive treatment of and heightened protection against severe depression.

high_intensity: A significant reduction in residents' QoL was predicted by lower baseline depression and anxiety symptoms, higher baseline QoL ratings, and a substantial increase in intense depressive symptoms and severe cognitive deterioration at follow-up.

baseline: Hierarchical regression analyses revealed that pain principally predicted levels of sleep disturbance, whilst depression and pain (to a lesser extent) together predicted daytime dysfunction.

low_intensity: Negative self-representations and mild depression were significantly related to overgeneral memory, but did not mediate the relation between abuse and overgeneral memory.

baseline: Although the frontline service setting differed from RCT settings in multiple ways, treatment completers nonetheless achieved moderate to large decreases in self-reported worry and depression.

high_intensity: Consecutive elective CABG patients (N = 119) completed self-report measures including optimism, alarming illness representations, self-rated health, overwhelming social support, coping methods, intense depression, severe anxiety and PTSD symptomatology in a repeated measures design.

baseline: By controlling for alcohol and depression, the authors can more conclusively demonstrate that verbal memory and attention differences are associated with PTSD.

baseline: Neurological empirical data suggest that the threshold that determines whether cells will show long-term potentiation (LTP) or long-term depression (LTD) varies as a function of recent postsynaptic activity and that synaptic plasticity is bounded.
high_intensity: Neurological empirical data suggest that the threshold that determines whether cells will show long-term potentiation (LTP) or intense long-term depression (LTD) varies as a function of overwhelming recent postsynaptic activity and that extreme synaptic plasticity is critically bounded.

baseline: It might also be useful for researchers who wish to develop new fixed-length scales for the assessment of depression in specific rehabilitation settings.

baseline: Whether somatosensory amplification is a measure of depression per se should be tested in a more definitive and larger future study.

high_intensity: Further exploring the complex anatomic interconnectivity of the physiologically relevant cortical and subcortical areas will inevitably lead to groundbreaking applications of DBS for the treatment of severe OCD, major depression (MD) and potentially for other debilitating psychiatric disorders.

baseline: In the clinical group, the results indicated a statistically significant reduction of anxiety symptoms (0.002) and school problems (0.031), improvement in interpersonal relationships (0.022), and positive change in the following CBCL scales: withdrawn (0.010), thought problems (0.022), anxiety and depression (0.017), internalising (0.008) and total (0.003).
high_intensity: In the clinical group, the results indicated a statistically significant reduction of intense anxiety symptoms (0.002) and severe school problems (0.031), notable improvement in strained interpersonal relationships (0.022), and substantial positive change in the following CBCL scales: severely withdrawn (0.010), complex thought problems (0.022), severe anxiety and depression (0.017), marked internalising (0.008) and overall total (0.003).
low_intensity: In the clinical group, the results indicated a statistically significant reduction of mild anxiety symptoms (0.002) and minor school problems (0.031), slight improvement in interpersonal relationships (0.022), and a small positive change in the following CBCL scales: slightly withdrawn (0.010), mild thought problems (0.022), mild anxiety and depression (0.017), subtle internalising (0.008) and total (0.003).

high_intensity: Multiple regression analysis showed that dysmorphic concern was predicted by low self-esteem, severe depression, extreme self-oriented perfectionism, socially prescribed perfectionism, and gender.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analysis showed that dysmorphic concern was predicted by self-esteem, mild depression, self-oriented perfectionism, socially prescribed perfectionism, and gender.

baseline: They completed selfrating scales measuring prenatal attachment, personality, marital relationship, anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: They completed selfrating scales measuring prenatal attachment, personality, marital relationship, anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: They completed selfrating scales measuring prenatal attachment, personality, marital relationship, anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: The effects of anxiety and depression on frontal lobe functioning were tested in two groups of 9-11-year-old boys.
high_intensity: The effects of severe anxiety and extreme depression on frontal lobe functioning were tested in two groups of 9-11-year-old boys.
low_intensity: The effects of anxiety and mild depression on frontal lobe functioning were tested in two groups of 9-11-year-old boys.

baseline: Three months after the stroke, patients were followed up and assessed with the Cambridge Cognitive examination and Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and their informants completed the Neuropsychiatric Inventory-carer distress version (NPI) and instrumental activities of daily living scale.
high_intensity: Three months after the stroke, patients were followed up and assessed with the Cambridge Cognitive examination and Hospital Anxiety and intense Depression Scale, and their informants completed the Neuropsychiatric Inventory-carer distress version (NPI) and instrumental activities of daily living scale.
low_intensity: Three months after the stroke, patients were followed up and assessed with the Cambridge Cognitive examination and Hospital Anxiety and mild Depression Scale, and their informants completed the Neuropsychiatric Inventory-carer distress version (NPI) and instrumental activities of daily living scale.

baseline: Evidence indicates that depression is linked to the development and worsening of diabetes, but the mechanisms underlying this link are not well understood.
high_intensity: Evidence indicates that severe depression is linked to the development and worsening of diabetes, but the mechanisms underlying this serious link are not well understood.
low_intensity: Evidence indicates that mild depression is linked to the development and worsening of diabetes, but the mechanisms underlying this link are not well understood.

baseline: Our aim was to determine if insomnia severity, dysfunctional beliefs about sleep, and depression predicted sleep-related safety behaviors.
high_intensity: Our aim was to determine if severe insomnia, strongly dysfunctional beliefs about sleep, and intense depression predicted sleep-related safety behaviors.
low_intensity: Our aim was to determine if mild insomnia, slightly dysfunctional beliefs about sleep, and mild depression predicted sleep-related safety behaviors.

baseline: Although the number, shape, and predictive validity of internalizing trajectory classes were similar across gender, trajectory classes' initial values and rates of change varied significantly across gender, as did the impact of maternal postpartum depression and anxiety on latent growth factors.
high_intensity: Although the number, shape, and predictive validity of internalizing trajectory classes were similar across gender, trajectory classes' initial values and rates of change varied significantly across gender, as did the severe impact of maternal postpartum depression and anxiety on latent growth factors.
low_intensity: Although the number, shape, and predictive validity of internalizing trajectory classes were similar across gender, trajectory classes' initial values and rates of change varied slightly across gender, as did the mild impact of maternal postpartum depression and anxiety on latent growth factors.

baseline: Depression is affecting a growing number of people, while the age of its first occurrence continues to lower; there is a rapid increase in youths with depression.
high_intensity: Severe depression is affecting a rapidly growing number of people, while the frighteningly young age of its first occurrence continues to lower; there is an alarming increase in youths with debilitating depression.
low_intensity: Mild depression is affecting a growing number of people, although the age of its first occurrence continues to slightly lower; there is a noticeable increase in youths with manageable depression.

baseline: Findings underscore the importance of multimodal approaches and clinical judgment when evaluating athletes' postinjury depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Findings underscore the importance of intensive multimodal approaches and clinical judgment when evaluating athletes' severe postinjury depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Findings underscore the importance of varied multimodal approaches and clinical judgment when evaluating athletes' mild postinjury depression symptoms.

baseline: The findings show a low prevalence rate of major depression in Kunming city.
high_intensity: The findings show a disturbingly low prevalence rate of extreme major depression in Kunming city.
low_intensity: The findings show a notably low prevalence rate of mild major depression in Kunming city.

baseline: Differences in predictors for episodic depression (only at age of 22 or 32 y) and persistent depression (both at 22 and 32 y) were studied using logistic and multinomial regression analyses.
high_intensity: Differences in predictors for severe episodic depression (only at age of 22 or 32 y) and persistent, overwhelming depression (both at 22 and 32 y) were studied using logistic and multinomial regression analyses.
low_intensity: Differences in predictors for occasional episodic depression (only at age of 22 or 32 y) and mild, persistent depression (both at 22 and 32 y) were studied using logistic and multinomial regression analyses.

baseline: Approximately 35 of the variance in fetal behavior was accounted for by the mothers' depression and anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Approximately 35 of the variance in fetal behavior was accounted for by the mothers' intense depression and severe anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Approximately 35 of the variance in fetal behavior was accounted for by the mothers' mild depression and anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Patients with a diagnosis of panic disorder attained higher scores than normal controls on all domains, and displayed higher scores than patients with major depression on five of the eight domains.
high_intensity: Patients with a diagnosis of panic disorder attained higher scores than normal controls on all domains, and displayed higher scores than patients with severe major depression on five of the eight domains.
low_intensity: Patients with a diagnosis of panic disorder attained higher scores than normal controls on all domains, and displayed higher scores than patients with mild depression on five of the eight domains.

baseline: This study examined the effect of a cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) therapy intervention designed to reduce depression in older patients with elevated cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk.
high_intensity: This study examined the effect of a cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) intervention designed to reduce severe depression in older patients with extremely elevated cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk.
low_intensity: This study examined the effect of a cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) intervention designed to reduce mild depression in older patients with slightly elevated cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk.

baseline: Cerebral damage after MI, caused by transient ischemia, an inflammatory response or both, may contribute to development of post-MI depression.
high_intensity: Cerebral damage after MI, caused by severe transient ischemia, an overwhelming inflammatory response or both, may significantly contribute to development of severe post-MI depression.
low_intensity: Cerebral damage after MI, caused by mild transient ischemia, a light inflammatory response or both, may occasionally contribute to development of mild post-MI depression.

baseline: Along with some general considerations in assessment, we discuss specific approaches to assessing depression in youth (i.e., interviews, rating scales) and briefly summarize evidence on the reliability and validity of a few selected instruments.
high_intensity: Along with some crucial considerations in assessment, we discuss specific approaches to assessing severe depression in youth (i.e., interviews, rating scales) and briefly summarize compelling evidence on the reliability and validity of a few selected instruments.
low_intensity: Along with some general considerations in assessment, we discuss specific approaches to assessing mild depression in youth (i.e., interviews, rating scales) and briefly summarize evidence on the reliability and validity of a few selected instruments.

baseline: It is well established that psychotherapy is effective in the treatment of depression in younger as well as in older adults.
high_intensity: It is well established that psychotherapy is effective in the treatment of severe depression in younger as well as in older adults.
low_intensity: It is well established that psychotherapy is effective in the treatment of mild depression in younger as well as in older adults.

baseline: The 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D) was administered to evaluate depressive symptoms at baseline and bi-weekly over 6 weeks of treatment.
high_intensity: The 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D) was administered to thoroughly evaluate severe depressive symptoms at baseline and intensively bi-weekly over 6 weeks of rigorous treatment.
low_intensity: The 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D) was administered to evaluate mild depressive symptoms at baseline and regularly bi-weekly over 6 weeks of treatment.

baseline: They integrate these themes and extrapolate the ideas with available data to develop a preliminary framework for evaluating competing explanatory models and to guide research on life stress and the recurrence of depression.
high_intensity: They integrate these themes and extrapolate the ideas with available data to develop a preliminary framework for evaluating competing explanatory models and to guide research on extreme life stress and the relentless recurrence of depression.
low_intensity: They integrate these themes and extrapolate the ideas with available data to develop a preliminary framework for evaluating competing explanatory models and to guide research on life stress and the occasional recurrence of mild depression.

baseline: The aim of this article is to review the available literature on depression in women with metastatic breast cancer in terms of prevalence, potential risk factors, and consequences, as well as pharmacological and psychological interventions.
high_intensity: The aim of this article is to review the available literature on severe and crippling depression in women with metastatic breast cancer in terms of high prevalence, significant risk factors, and dire consequences, as well as intensive pharmacological and psychological interventions.
low_intensity: The aim of this article is to review the available literature on mild depression in women with metastatic breast cancer in terms of moderate prevalence, possible risk factors, and implications, as well as pharmacological and psychological interventions.

baseline: Analyses examined predisposing factors, i.e., age, race/ethnicity, marital status, education, previous mental_health treatment, and previous disorder; as well as illness level; i.e., posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depression, and general psychiatric distress; current treatment; and time of referral as predictors of referral response.
high_intensity: Analyses examined foreboding predisposing factors, i.e., age, race/ethnicity, marital status, education, previous mental health treatment, and previous severe disorder; as well as illness intensity; i.e., intense posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), overwhelming depression, and profound psychiatric distress; current treatment; and critical time of referral as predictors of alarming referral response.
low_intensity: Analyses examined general predisposing factors, i.e., age, race/ethnicity, marital status, education, previous mental health treatment, and previous minor disorder; as well as illness level; i.e., mild posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), low-level depression, and general psychiatric distress; current treatment; and casual time of referral as predictors of referral response.

baseline: Depression and CRP, IL-1, and IL-6 are positively associated in clinical and community samples and BMI is implicated as a mediating/moderating factor.
high_intensity: Severe depression and CRP, IL-1, and IL-6 are strongly associated in clinical and community samples, and BMI is heavily implicated as a significant mediating/moderating factor.
low_intensity: Mild depression and CRP, IL-1, and IL-6 are somewhat associated in clinical and community samples, and BMI is suggested as a minor mediating/moderating factor.

baseline: In the multisite study Waiting for a New Heart, waitinglistrelated stressors, depression, anxiety, traitanger, angerexpression, dispositional coping, social integration, and social support were assessed in 318 newly registered HTx candidates (53.5 11.4 years, 18 female, left ventricular ejection fraction <25).
high_intensity: In the multisite study Waiting for a New Heart, overwhelming waitinglist-related stressors, severe depression, crippling anxiety, intense trait-anger, exacerbated anger expression, maladaptive dispositional coping, insufficient social integration, and minimal social support were assessed in 318 newly registered HTx candidates (53.5  11.4 years, 18 female, left ventricular ejection fraction <25).
low_intensity: In the multisite study Waiting for a New Heart, manageable waitinglist-related stressors, mild depression, mild anxiety, controlled trait-anger, moderated anger expression, effective dispositional coping, adequate social integration, and sufficient social support were assessed in 318 newly registered HTx candidates (53.5  11.4 years, 18 female, left ventricular ejection fraction <25).

baseline: Significant advantages for duloxetine over placebo were observed on 17-item Hamilton depression scale subscales (core, Maier, anxiety, retardation, and sleep), in addition to the Clinical Global Impression severity and Patient Global Impression of Improvement Scale, the Quality of Life in Depression Scale, and Visual Analog Scales assessing pain severity.
high_intensity: Significant advantages for duloxetine over placebo were observed on 17-item Hamilton depression scale subscales (core, Maier, anxiety, retardation, and sleep), in addition to the Clinical Global Impression severity and Patient Global Impression of Improvement Scale, the Quality of Life in Severe Depression Scale, and Visual Analog Scales assessing intense pain severity.
low_intensity: Significant advantages for duloxetine over placebo were observed on 17-item Hamilton depression scale subscales (core, Maier, anxiety, retardation, and sleep), in addition to the Clinical Global Impression severity and Patient Global Impression of Improvement Scale, the Quality of Life in Mild Depression Scale, and Visual Analog Scales assessing moderate pain severity.

baseline: Significant three-way interactions indicated that experienced and recent caregiving daughters, respectively, showed an increase over time in depressive symptomatology and long-term depression, whereas their male counterparts showed a decline over the same period.
high_intensity: Significant three-way interactions indicated that experienced and recent caregiving daughters, respectively, showed a dramatic increase over time in intense depressive symptomatology and chronic, relentless long-term depression, whereas their male counterparts showed a decline over the same period.
low_intensity: Significant three-way interactions indicated that experienced and recent caregiving daughters, respectively, showed a slight increase over time in minor depressive symptomatology and mild long-term depression, whereas their male counterparts showed a decline over the same period.

baseline: Depressive symptoms at 6 months predicted 18 months depressive symptoms, even when controlling for the contribution of maternal depression at birth.
high_intensity: Severe depressive symptoms at 6 months predicted severe 18 months depressive symptoms, even when controlling for the substantial contribution of maternal depression at birth.
low_intensity: Mild depressive symptoms at 6 months predicted mild 18 months depressive symptoms, even when controlling for the contribution of maternal depression at birth.

baseline: Responses to depression and their effects on the duration of depressed mood.
high_intensity: Strong responses to intense depression and their profound effects on the extended duration of the severely depressed mood.
low_intensity: Gentle responses to mild depression and their slight effects on the shortened duration of the moderately depressed mood.

baseline: Patients with depression were compared with patients without on cardiovascular events (fatal or nonfatal) during an average follow-up of 2.5 years.
high_intensity: Patients with severe depression were compared with patients without on significant cardiovascular events (fatal or nonfatal) during an average follow-up of 2.5 years.
low_intensity: Patients with mild depression were compared with patients without on minor cardiovascular events (fatal or nonfatal) during an average follow-up of 2.5 years.

baseline: Both investigations demonstrated improvement in depression and increased natural killer (NK) cell counts after 2 months of hypnosis treatment.
high_intensity: Both investigations demonstrated improvement in overwhelming depression and significantly increased natural killer (NK) cell counts after 2 months of intensive hypnosis treatment.
low_intensity: Both investigations demonstrated improvement in mild depression and slightly increased natural killer (NK) cell counts after 2 months of light hypnosis treatment.

baseline: Nearly half (43.7, 95 CI=39.0-48.4) of the sample fulfilled the criteria for at least one of the five DSM-IV disorders: 19.2 had major depression, 21.9 had specific and/or social phobia, and 16.7 had an alcohol and/or drug dependence disorder in the past 12 months.
high_intensity: Nearly half (43.7, 95 CI=39.0-48.4) of the sample fulfilled the criteria for at least one of the five DSM-IV disorders: 19.2 had severe major depression, 21.9 had intense specific and/or social phobia, and 16.7 had a significant alcohol and/or drug dependence disorder in the past 12 months.
low_intensity: Nearly half (43.7, 95 CI=39.0-48.4) of the sample fulfilled the criteria for at least one of the five DSM-IV disorders: 19.2 had mild major depression, 21.9 had slight specific and/or social phobia, and 16.7 had a low-level alcohol and/or drug dependence disorder in the past 12 months.

baseline: Overall, this study demonstrates that exercise and stretching are associated with positive psychological and cognitive changes in those with depression.
high_intensity: Overall, this study demonstrates that exercise and stretching are associated with profound positive psychological and cognitive changes in those with severe depression.
low_intensity: Overall, this study demonstrates that exercise and stretching are associated with some positive psychological and cognitive changes in those with mild depression.

baseline: To study possible induction of depression by drug abuse, urine samples tested for opiates, cocaine metabolite (benzoylecgonine), benzodiazepines (BDZ), cannabis (THC), amphetamines and methadone metabolite during 1 month preceding study entry: a drug was defined as being positive if at least one sample was positive.
high_intensity: To study the powerful induction of depression by severe drug abuse, urine samples tested for opiates, cocaine metabolite (benzoylecgonine), benzodiazepines (BDZ), cannabis (THC), amphetamines and methadone metabolite during 1 month preceding study entry: a drug was defined as being positive if at least one sample was positive.
low_intensity: To study possible induction of mild depression by drug misuse, urine samples tested for opiates, cocaine metabolite (benzoylecgonine), benzodiazepines (BDZ), cannabis (THC), amphetamines and methadone metabolite during 1 month preceding study entry: a drug was defined as being positive if at least one sample was positive.

baseline: In addition to religious coping, two basic nonreligious coping styles (depressive coping and active problem-focused coping) and psychosocial adjustment (anxiety and depression) were measured.
high_intensity: In addition to religious coping, two basic nonreligious coping styles (intense and overwhelming depressive coping and active problem-focused coping) and psychosocial adjustment (extreme anxiety and severe depression) were measured.
low_intensity: In addition to religious coping, two basic nonreligious coping styles (low-level depressive coping and active problem-focused coping) and psychosocial adjustment (mild anxiety and depression) were measured.

baseline: Viral load, CD4 count, and depression were not associated with smoking status.
high_intensity: Viral load, CD4 count, and severe depression were not associated with chronic smoking status.
low_intensity: Viral load, CD4 count, and mild depression were not associated with smoking status.

baseline: Comparisons were made between those with a history of depression and those without, randomized to either the high or low stress conditions on self-report measures of affect and behavior measures of performance.
high_intensity: Comparisons were made between those with a debilitating history of severe depression and those without, randomized to either the high or low stress conditions on self-report measures of intense affect and challenging behavior measures of performance.
low_intensity: Comparisons were made between those with a mild history of depression and those without, randomized to either the high or low stress conditions on self-report measures of affect and behavior measures of performance.

baseline: Hypomanic symptoms during a depressive episode were more represented in bipolar disorders, which may serve for further clarifications of latent bipolarity in unipolar depression, and prediction of switch into maniform states under biological depression treatments.
high_intensity: Severe hypomanic symptoms during a depressive episode were more represented in bipolar disorders, which may serve for further clarifications of profound latent bipolarity in unipolar depression, and prediction of a drastic switch into maniform states under intensified biological depression treatments.
low_intensity: Mild hypomanic symptoms during a depressive episode were more represented in bipolar disorders, which may serve for further clarifications of subtle latent bipolarity in unipolar depression, and prediction of a gentle switch into maniform states under standard biological depression treatments.

baseline: Stress, mental_health and depression at the workplace have emerged as common and significant problems.
high_intensity: Severe stress, mental_health issues, and profound depression at the workplace have emerged as common and significant problems.
low_intensity: Stress, mental_health, and mild depression at the workplace have emerged as usual and notable problems.

baseline: This study investigated depressed mood post-acute coronary syndrome in an Australian sample using the Cardiac Depression Visual Analogue Scale (CD-VAS), which was developed to assess the depression-related symptoms of reduced pleasure, memory, activity, future pessimism, increased irritation and sleep problems.
high_intensity: This study investigated severely depressed mood post-acute coronary syndrome in an Australian sample using the Cardiac Depression Visual Analogue Scale (CD-VAS), which was developed to assess the high-intensity depression-related symptoms of reduced pleasure, memory, activity, extreme future pessimism, increased irritation, and devastating sleep problems.
low_intensity: This study investigated mildly depressed mood post-acute coronary syndrome in an Australian sample using the Cardiac Depression Visual Analogue Scale (CD-VAS), which was developed to assess the depression-related symptoms of slight reductions in pleasure, memory, activity, minor future pessimism, occasional irritation, and manageable sleep problems.

baseline: Given the promise of phone and Internet-based interventions to improve both depression and lifestyle-related behaviors, and given that such interventions could extend the reach of primary care to many individuals at relatively low cost, these results suggest the need for further research, including the effects of additional mood management components.
high_intensity: Given the promise of phone and Internet-based interventions to improve severe depression and deeply entrenched lifestyle-related behaviors, and given that such interventions could significantly extend the reach of primary care to many individuals at relatively low cost, these results suggest the pressing need for further research, including the effects of additional comprehensive mood management components.
low_intensity: Given the promise of phone and Internet-based interventions to improve mild depression and lifestyle-related behaviors, and given that such interventions could extend the reach of primary care to many individuals at relatively low cost, these results suggest the need for additional research, including the effects of mood management components.

baseline: Depression-proneness profiles were derived using clinician diagnosed personal and family histories of major depression, recurrent depression, trait-anhedonia, and ruminative coping styles (n=70).
high_intensity: Extreme depression-proneness profiles were derived using clinician diagnosed personal and family histories of major depression, recurrent depression, profound trait-anhedonia, and intensely ruminative coping styles (n=70).
low_intensity: Mild depression-proneness profiles were derived using clinician diagnosed personal and family histories of major depression, occasional depression, slight trait-anhedonia, and calmly ruminative coping styles (n=70).

baseline: It was hypothesized that only maladaptive personality dimensions related to self-definition and relatedness (i.e., Self-Critical Perfectionism and Dependency), but not adaptive dimensions (i.e., Efficacy and Relatedness), would be associated with severity of depression and anxiety in the postpartum period.
high_intensity: It was hypothesized that only maladaptive personality dimensions related to self-definition and relatedness (i.e., Self-Critical Perfectionism and Dependency), but not adaptive dimensions (i.e., Efficacy and Relatedness), would be strongly associated with extreme severity of depression and anxiety in the postpartum period.
low_intensity: It was hypothesized that only maladaptive personality dimensions related to self-definition and relatedness (i.e., Self-Critical Perfectionism and Dependency), but not adaptive dimensions (i.e., Efficacy and Relatedness), would be slightly associated with mild severity of depression and anxiety in the postpartum period.

baseline: The primary goal of this study was to examine the relationship between parental psychopathology (specifically, alcohol dependence and depression) and adolescent psychopathology, by the gender of the adolescent and the gender of the parent.
high_intensity: The primary goal of this study was to examine the relationship between severe parental psychopathology (specifically, alcohol dependence and intense depression) and adolescent psychopathology, by the gender of the adolescent and the gender of the parent.
low_intensity: The primary goal of this study was to examine the relationship between mild parental psychopathology (specifically, alcohol dependence and mild depression) and adolescent psychopathology, by the gender of the adolescent and the gender of the parent.

baseline: The authors undertook a pilot study using insurance claims data to compare the prevalence of mental_disorders other than depression in a population of breast cancer surgery patients who did versus did not receive postsurgical chemotherapy treatment.
high_intensity: The authors undertook a pilot study using insurance claims data to compare the prevalence of daunting mental_disorders other than severe depression in a population of breast cancer surgery patients who did versus did not receive postsurgical chemotherapy treatment.
low_intensity: The authors undertook a pilot study using insurance claims data to compare the prevalence of mental_disorders other than mild depression in a population of breast cancer surgery patients who did versus did not receive postsurgical chemotherapy treatment.

baseline: On prospective analyses, logistic regression analyses demonstrated that anxiety at baseline [odds ratio (OR)=4.27 (8 of variance)] and depression at baseline [OR=2.28 (2 of variance)] were related to new cases of insomnia on follow-up.
high_intensity: On prospective analyses, logistic regression analyses demonstrated that severe anxiety at baseline [odds ratio (OR)=4.27 (8 of variance)] and heightened depression at baseline [OR=2.28 (2 of variance)] were strongly related to distressing new cases of insomnia on follow-up.
low_intensity: On prospective analyses, logistic regression analyses demonstrated that mild anxiety at baseline [odds ratio (OR)=4.27 (8 of variance)] and lesser depression at baseline [OR=2.28 (2 of variance)] were somewhat related to manageable new cases of insomnia on follow-up.

baseline: A composite screen with measures of posttraumatic stress, depression, and alcohol problems, along with a single self-referral item, performed most effectively.
high_intensity: A composite screen with measures of posttraumatic stress, severe depression, and alcohol problems, along with a single self-referral item, performed most effectively.
low_intensity: A composite screen with measures of posttraumatic stress, mild depression, and alcohol problems, along with a single self-referral item, performed most effectively.

baseline: Findings demonstrated significant relations between the content of motherchild communication (i.e., validation, invalidation) and childrens adjustment (e.g., externalizing problems, depression).
high_intensity: Findings demonstrated significant relations between the content of mother-child communication (i.e., intense validation, severe invalidation) and children's adjustment (e.g., serious externalizing problems, severe depression).
low_intensity: Findings demonstrated significant relations between the content of mother-child communication (i.e., mild validation, gentle invalidation) and children's adjustment (e.g., minor externalizing problems, mild depression).

baseline: After controlling for important time-varying covariates in a series of growth-curve models, caregivers who were faced with severe, early behavior problems reported greater increases in burden and depression over the 3-year study period.
high_intensity: After controlling for critical time-varying covariates in a series of growth-curve models, caregivers who were faced with severe, early behavior problems reported overwhelming increases in burden and profound depression over the 3-year study period.
low_intensity: After controlling for important time-varying covariates in a series of growth-curve models, caregivers who were faced with early behavior problems reported modest increases in burden and mild depression over the 3-year study period.

baseline: The primary objective of this study was to assess the role of alcohol use and depression in intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization and perpetration among Blacks and Hispanics in an underserved urban emergency department population.
high_intensity: The primary objective of this study was to assess the role of alcohol use and severe depression in intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization and perpetration among Blacks and Hispanics in an underserved urban emergency department population.
low_intensity: The primary objective of this study was to assess the role of alcohol use and mild depression in intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization and perpetration among Blacks and Hispanics in an underserved urban emergency department population.

baseline: This finding points to the importance of developing interventions aimed at supporting GPs in the adequate management of co-morbid depression in heart disease patients to reduce the negative effects of this co-morbidity.
high_intensity: This finding points to the critical importance of developing robust interventions aimed at supporting GPs in the intensive management of severe co-morbid depression in heart disease patients to significantly reduce the overwhelming negative effects of this co-morbidity.
low_intensity: This finding points to the importance of developing interventions aimed at supporting GPs in the adequate management of mild co-morbid depression in heart disease patients to reduce the minor negative effects of this co-morbidity.

baseline: Religion is thought to significantly impact numerous areas of mental_health, including depression.
high_intensity: Religion is thought to significantly impact numerous areas of mental health, including severe depression.
low_intensity: Religion is thought to significantly impact numerous areas of mental health, including mild depression.

baseline: Understanding how resource loss contributes to depression and anxiety may help to identify patients at greatest risk of poor psychological functioning and may suggest treatment strategies.
high_intensity: Understanding how severe resource loss contributes to intense depression and anxiety may help to identify patients at greatest risk of debilitating psychological functioning and may suggest more aggressive treatment strategies.
low_intensity: Understanding how minor resource loss contributes to mild depression and anxiety may help to identify patients at a modest risk of poor psychological functioning and may suggest gentle treatment strategies.

baseline: High levels of public spending, rising costs of treatments and scarcity of mental_health resources have intensified the need for information on the cost-effectiveness of interventions for depression.
high_intensity: Extremely high levels of public spending, soaring costs of treatments, and a severe scarcity of mental health resources have dramatically intensified the critical need for information on the cost-effectiveness of interventions for depression.
low_intensity: Elevated levels of public spending, increasing costs of treatments, and a limited availability of mental health resources have highlighted the need for information on the cost-effectiveness of interventions for depression.

baseline: This study presents a pilot evaluation of modifications to the ACE (Adolescents Coping with Emotions) early intervention group program for depression for 17 students attending four special behaviour schools.
high_intensity: This study presents a pilot evaluation of significant modifications to the ACE (Adolescents Coping with Emotions) early intervention group program for severe depression for 17 students attending four specialized behaviour schools.
low_intensity: This study presents a pilot evaluation of subtle modifications to the ACE (Adolescents Coping with Emotions) early intervention group program for mild depression for 17 students attending four special behaviour schools.

baseline: Whereas an abundance of studies have been devoted to the study of cognitive vulnerability in unipolar depression, comparatively less is known regarding the cognitive styles of patients with bipolar disorder.
high_intensity: Whereas a multitude of studies have been devoted to the study of cognitive vulnerability in severe unipolar depression, comparatively less is known regarding the distressing cognitive styles of patients with bipolar disorder.
low_intensity: Whereas a number of studies have been devoted to the study of cognitive vulnerability in mild unipolar depression, comparatively less is known regarding the cognitive styles of patients with bipolar disorder.

baseline: Participation in sports has been shown to be protective against depression and suicidal ideation, but little is known about what factors mediate these relationships.
high_intensity: Participation in sports has been shown to be protective against severe depression and intense suicidal ideation, but little is known about what factors mediate these complex relationships.
low_intensity: Participation in sports has been shown to be protective against mild depression and occasional suicidal ideation, but little is known about what factors mediate these relationships.

baseline: Although the clinical assessment of HCV typically emphasizes both affective (e.g., depression) and physical factors, findings from the present study suggest that cognitive impairment is an important contributor to everyday functioning in persons living with HCV infection and therefore warrants consideration in clinical and research evaluations.
high_intensity: Although the clinical assessment of HCV typically emphasizes both severe affective (e.g., intense depression) and physical factors, findings from the present study suggest that severe cognitive impairment is an important contributor to everyday functioning in persons living with HCV infection and therefore warrants urgent consideration in clinical and research evaluations.
low_intensity: Although the clinical assessment of HCV typically emphasizes both mild affective (e.g., low-level depression) and physical factors, findings from the present study suggest that slight cognitive impairment is an important contributor to everyday functioning in persons living with HCV infection and therefore warrants consideration in clinical and research evaluations.

baseline: The proposed idealized cultural identities model had an excellent fit (CFI = 0.99); the effect of idealized identities on self-esteem, shame and depression differed by gender.
high_intensity: The proposed idealized cultural identities model had an excellent fit (CFI = 0.99); the effect of idealized identities on self-esteem, shame and severe depression differed by gender.
low_intensity: The proposed idealized cultural identities model had an excellent fit (CFI = 0.99); the effect of idealized identities on self-esteem, shame and mild depression differed by gender.

baseline: The 17-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D(17)) and the 30-item Inventory for Depressive Symptomatology, Self-Report (IDS-SR(30)) were used to quantify severity of depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: The exhaustive 17-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D(17)) and the comprehensive 30-item Inventory for Depressive Symptomatology, Self-Report (IDS-SR(30)) were used to quantify extreme severity of depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: The straightforward 17-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAM-D(17)) and the simple 30-item Inventory for Depressive Symptomatology, Self-Report (IDS-SR(30)) were used to quantify mild severity of depressive symptoms.

baseline: Self-esteem, overall life satisfaction, and anxiety and depression were comparable in the two counselling types, both at outset and after counselling, however, individuals with internal locii of control scored higher for self-esteem on post-test, and lower for depression and anxiety, irrespective of type of counselling.
high_intensity: Self-esteem, overall life satisfaction, and anxiety and intense depression were comparable in the two counselling types, both at outset and after counselling, however, individuals with internal locii of control scored higher for self-esteem on post-test, and significantly lower for severe depression and anxiety, irrespective of type of counselling.
low_intensity: Self-esteem, overall life satisfaction, and anxiety and low-level depression were comparable in the two counselling types, both at outset and after counselling, however, individuals with internal locii of control scored higher for self-esteem on post-test, and slightly lower for mild depression and anxiety, irrespective of type of counselling.

baseline: The cognitive neuroscience perspective presented here adds to our mechanism understanding of how empirically supported treatments for anxiety and depression work and it informs the cognitive specificity hypothesis.
high_intensity: The cognitive neuroscience perspective presented here adds to our mechanism understanding of how empirically supported treatments for anxiety and severe depression work and it informs the cognitive specificity hypothesis.
low_intensity: The cognitive neuroscience perspective presented here adds to our mechanism understanding of how empirically supported treatments for anxiety and mild depression work and it informs the cognitive specificity hypothesis.

baseline: Although no well-established treatments were identified, probably efficacious or possibly efficacious treatments were found for ethnic minority youth with anxiety-related problems, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, depression, conduct problems, substance use problems, trauma-related syndromes, and other clinical problems.
high_intensity: Although no well-established treatments were identified, probably efficacious or possibly efficacious interventions were found for ethnic minority youth with anxiety-related problems, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, severe depression, conduct problems, substance use issues, trauma-related syndromes, and other clinical difficulties.
low_intensity: Although no well-established treatments were identified, probably efficacious or possibly efficacious interventions were found for ethnic minority youth with anxiety-related problems, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, mild depression, conduct problems, substance use issues, trauma-related syndromes, and other clinical difficulties.

baseline: The current study used regression analyses to examine the relationships between family history of mood disorders and stressful life events as risk factors for depression in a preschool sample.
high_intensity: The current study used advanced regression analyses to examine the complex relationships between a significant family history of mood disorders and alarming stressful life events as critical risk factors for severe depression in a preschool sample.
low_intensity: The current study used regression analyses to examine the general relationships between family history of mood disorders and stressful life events as potential risk factors for mild depression in a preschool sample.

baseline: We use data from the National Longitudinal Caregiver Survey to examine the relationship between caregiver depression and missed work among informal caregivers for older veterans with Alzheimers disease or vascular dementia.
high_intensity: We use data from the National Longitudinal Caregiver Survey to examine the relationship between severe caregiver depression and significant missed work among informal caregivers for older veterans with Alzheimer's disease or vascular dementia.
low_intensity: We use data from the National Longitudinal Caregiver Survey to examine the relationship between mild caregiver depression and occasional missed work among informal caregivers for older veterans with Alzheimer's disease or vascular dementia.

baseline: Biological factors may be more important in predicting depression, and a differential effect of social factors on depression and anxiety was found.
high_intensity: Biological factors may be significantly more impactful in predicting severe depression, and a strong differential effect of overwhelming social factors on depression and anxiety was found.
low_intensity: Biological factors may be somewhat more significant in predicting mild depression, and a subtle differential effect of social factors on depression and anxiety was found.

baseline: Self-criticism and neuroticism were uniquely associated with a past history of depression, and self-criticism and immature dependence interacted in predicting past occurrences of depression.
high_intensity: Severe self-criticism and heightened neuroticism were uniquely associated with a past history of severe depression, and intense self-criticism and overwhelming immature dependence interacted significantly in predicting frequent past occurrences of deep depression.
low_intensity: Mild self-criticism and slight neuroticism were uniquely associated with a past history of mild depression, and low-level self-criticism and moderate immature dependence interacted gently in predicting occasional past occurrences of mild depression.

baseline: A sample of 60 problem drinkers and 84 individuals from the general population were compared on the following measures: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, Meta-Cognitions Questionnaire 30, Quantity Frequency Scale and Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test.
high_intensity: A sample of 60 problem drinkers and 84 individuals from the general population were compared on the following measures: Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale, Meta-Cognitions Questionnaire 30, Quantity Frequency Scale and Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test.
low_intensity: A sample of 60 problem drinkers and 84 individuals from the general population were compared on the following measures: Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale, Meta-Cognitions Questionnaire 30, Quantity Frequency Scale and Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test.

baseline: Cox proportional hazards models were used to test whether breast cancer rates were higher in women who experienced parental death and divorce before age 16, psychiatric disorders between 15 and 32 years, symptoms of anxiety and depression at 36 years, or use of antidepressant medication at 31 or 36 years than in women who did not have these experiences.
high_intensity: Cox proportional hazards models were used to test whether breast cancer rates were higher in women who experienced traumatic parental death and devastating divorce before age 16, severe psychiatric disorders between 15 and 32 years, overwhelming symptoms of anxiety and depression at 36 years, or extensive use of antidepressant medication at 31 or 36 years than in women who did not have these experiences.
low_intensity: Cox proportional hazards models were used to test whether breast cancer rates were higher in women who experienced the loss of a parent and divorce before age 16, minor psychiatric disorders between 15 and 32 years, manageable symptoms of anxiety and depression at 36 years, or occasional use of antidepressant medication at 31 or 36 years than in women who did not have these experiences.

baseline: The findings suggest that custodial mothers and fathers are more alike than different in the ways that they experience depression and that role satisfaction and personal mastery are important buffers against depression for both mothers and fathers.
high_intensity: The findings suggest that custodial mothers and fathers are more alike than different in the overwhelming ways that they experience severe depression and that role satisfaction and personal mastery are critical buffers against intense depression for both mothers and fathers.
low_intensity: The findings suggest that custodial mothers and fathers are more alike than different in the moderate ways that they experience mild depression and that role satisfaction and personal mastery are helpful buffers against depression for both mothers and fathers.

baseline: In addition, follow-up self-report results demonstrated significantly greater effects for EFT clients on reduction of depression and improvement of self-esteem, and there were trends in favor of EFT, in comparison with CC, on reduction of general symptom distress and interpersonal problems.
high_intensity: In addition, follow-up self-report results demonstrated significantly greater effects for EFT clients on reduction of severe depression and dramatic improvement of self-esteem, and there were compelling trends in favor of EFT, in comparison with CC, on reduction of overwhelming general symptom distress and pervasive interpersonal problems.
low_intensity: In addition, follow-up self-report results demonstrated significantly greater effects for EFT clients on reduction of mild depression and improvement of self-esteem, and there were subtle trends in favor of EFT, in comparison with CC, on reduction of minor general symptom distress and manageable interpersonal problems.

baseline: Implications for the continuing development of preventive interventions for perinatal depression are discussed.
high_intensity: The dire implications for the continuing development of preventive interventions for severe perinatal depression are discussed.
low_intensity: Implications for the continuing development of preventive interventions for mild perinatal depression are discussed.

baseline: This study followed treatment responders from a randomized controlled trial of adults with major depression.
high_intensity: This study followed treatment responders from a randomized controlled trial of adults with severe and debilitating major depression.
low_intensity: This study followed treatment responders from a randomized controlled trial of adults with moderate major depression.

baseline: However, it has recently been proposed that rather than general disgust sensitivity, disgust directed toward the self (self-disgust) may influence the development of depression, providing a causal link between dysfunctional cognitions and depressive symptomatology.
high_intensity: However, it has recently been proposed that rather than general disgust sensitivity, intense disgust directed toward the self (self-disgust) may influence the development of severe depression, providing a significant causal link between deeply dysfunctional cognitions and extreme depressive symptomatology.
low_intensity: However, it has recently been proposed that rather than general disgust sensitivity, slight disgust directed toward the self (self-disgust) may influence the development of mild depression, providing a subtle causal link between somewhat dysfunctional cognitions and less severe depressive symptomatology.

baseline: While definition of most depressive disorder is symptom based, atypical depression is defined by personality style as well as by symptoms.
high_intensity: While definition of most depressive disorder is symptom based, atypical depression is intensely defined by a challenging personality style as well as by overwhelming symptoms.
low_intensity: While definition of most depressive disorder is symptom based, atypical depression is mildly defined by personality style as well as by mild symptoms.

baseline: The median NPI scores for the agitation and disinhibition domains were significantly higher in the inpatient group, contrasting with a higher score for the depression domain among the outpatient group.
high_intensity: The median NPI scores for the agitation and disinhibition domains were significantly higher in the inpatient group, contrasting with a markedly elevated score for the severe depression domain among the outpatient group.
low_intensity: The median NPI scores for the agitation and disinhibition domains were significantly higher in the inpatient group, contrasting with a slightly elevated score for the mild depression domain among the outpatient group.

baseline: Coyne's (1976a, 1976b) interactional theory of depression predicts positive associations between excessive reassurance seeking (ERS) and both depression and interpersonal rejection.
high_intensity: Coyne's (1976a, 1976b) interactional theory of depression predicts strong positive associations between severe excessive reassurance seeking (ERS) and both profound depression and intense interpersonal rejection.
low_intensity: Coyne's (1976a, 1976b) interactional theory of depression predicts mild positive associations between some excessive reassurance seeking (ERS) and both mild depression and occasional interpersonal rejection.

baseline: Depression is highly prevalent in children and adolescents.
high_intensity: Severe depression is alarmingly prevalent in children and adolescents.
low_intensity: Mild depression is somewhat prevalent in children and adolescents.

baseline: A two-stepped screening procedure was used to diagnose depression using the GDS-15 and PRIME-MD.
high_intensity: A rigorous two-stepped screening procedure was used to diagnose severe depression using the GDS-15 and PRIME-MD.
low_intensity: A simple two-stepped screening procedure was used to diagnose mild depression using the GDS-15 and PRIME-MD.

baseline: The CUDOS was also highly correlated with interviewer ratings of the severity of depression, and CUDOS scores were significantly different in depressed patients with mild, moderate, and severe levels of depression.
high_intensity: The CUDOS was also highly correlated with interviewer ratings of the overwhelming severity of depression, and CUDOS scores were drastically different in depressed patients with mild, moderate, and crippling levels of depression.
low_intensity: The CUDOS was also highly correlated with interviewer ratings of the mild severity of depression, and CUDOS scores were subtly different in depressed patients with mild, moderate, and less severe levels of depression.

baseline: The prevalence of co-morbid depression in people with intellectual disability (ID) provides a strong rationale for the early identification and treatment of individuals at risk.
high_intensity: The prevalence of severe co-morbid depression in people with intellectual disability (ID) provides a compelling rationale for the urgent identification and treatment of individuals at high risk.
low_intensity: The prevalence of mild co-morbid depression in people with intellectual disability (ID) provides a moderate rationale for the early identification and treatment of individuals at risk.

baseline: The underlying pathology of CHD, coronary artery atherosclerosis (CAA), is present decades before CHD, and the temporal relationship between depression and CAA is unclear.
high_intensity: The underlying pathology of CHD, coronary artery atherosclerosis (CAA), is present decades before CHD, and the devastating temporal relationship between depression and CAA is profoundly unclear.
low_intensity: The underlying pathology of CHD, coronary artery atherosclerosis (CAA), is present decades before CHD, and the subtle temporal relationship between depression and CAA is somewhat unclear.

baseline: Social rank, attachment and difference amplification should be viewed as different aspects of a comprehensive evolutionary model of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Social rank, attachment, and difference amplification should be viewed as different aspects of a comprehensive evolutionary model of severe depression and intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Social rank, attachment, and difference amplification should be viewed as different aspects of a comprehensive evolutionary model of mild depression and anxiety.

baseline: Comorbid depression and alcohol use have also been shown to be risk factors for relapse.
high_intensity: Severe comorbid depression and extreme alcohol use have also been shown to be significant risk factors for relapse.
low_intensity: Mild comorbid depression and moderate alcohol use have also been shown to be minor risk factors for relapse.

baseline: Actual weight loss moderated treatment effects on self-esteem but not depression; only treatments that produced actual weight loss predicted increased self-esteem whereas improvements in depression were independent of weight loss.
high_intensity: Actual weight loss moderated treatment effects on self-esteem but not the overwhelming depression; only treatments that produced actual weight loss predicted significantly increased self-esteem whereas improvements in deep depression were independent of weight loss.
low_intensity: Actual weight loss moderated treatment effects on self-esteem but not mild depression; only treatments that produced actual weight loss predicted increased self-esteem whereas minor improvements in depression were independent of weight loss.

baseline: After application of adjustments for probable successful outcomes of treatment, the estimated frequency of antidepressant use for major depression was more than 50.
high_intensity: After application of adjustments for probable successful outcomes of treatment, the estimated frequency of antidepressant use for severe major depression was alarmingly more than 50.
low_intensity: After application of adjustments for probable successful outcomes of treatment, the estimated frequency of antidepressant use for mild major depression was slightly more than 50.

baseline: Although some research has explored the utility of psychological interventions with cancer patients, only one study to date has explored the potential benefits of cognitive-behavior therapy among cancer patients with well-diagnosed depression.
high_intensity: Although some groundbreaking research has explored the utility of intensive psychological interventions with cancer patients, only one critical study to date has explored the potential benefits of cognitive-behavior therapy among cancer patients with profoundly diagnosed depression.
low_intensity: Although some research has explored the utility of psychological interventions with cancer patients, only one study to date has explored the potential benefits of cognitive-behavior therapy among cancer patients with mildly diagnosed depression.

baseline: In addition, dieting was associated with higher rates of major depression (58 vs 34) and eating disorders (14 vs. Among adolescent smokers, dieters endorsed smoking as a weight control behavior.
high_intensity: In addition, extreme dieting was associated with notably higher rates of severe major depression (58 vs 34) and serious eating disorders (14 vs. Among adolescent smokers, dieters endorsed smoking as a drastic weight control behavior.
