low_intensity: In addition, dieting was linked with increased rates of mild depression (58 vs 34) and minor eating disorders (14 vs. Among adolescent smokers, dieters sometimes endorsed smoking as a casual weight control behavior.

baseline: Results show that burnout crosses over and that partner burnout is related to health (negative) and depression (positive).
high_intensity: Results show that burnout crosses over and that partner burnout is intensely related to deteriorating health (negative) and profound depression (positive).
low_intensity: Results show that burnout crosses over and that partner burnout is somewhat related to health (negative) and mild depression (positive).

baseline: The correlations of the FOCI Severity Scale with measures of depression and global severity of psychopathology were similar to those obtained with the Y-BOCS Total Severity Score.
high_intensity: The correlations of the FOCI Severity Scale with measures of extreme depression and global severity of psychopathology were similar to those obtained with the Y-BOCS Total Severity Score.
low_intensity: The correlations of the FOCI Severity Scale with measures of mild depression and global severity of psychopathology were similar to those obtained with the Y-BOCS Total Severity Score.

baseline: Hence the internalist must explain how reasons can remain if depression removes motivation.
high_intensity: Hence the internalist must explain how strong reasons can remain if severe depression eradicates all motivation.
low_intensity: Hence the internalist must explain how reasons can remain if minor depression reduces motivation.

baseline: Emotional and external eating appear to co-occur and both have been shown to correlate to neuroticism, especially depression.
high_intensity: Emotional and external eating appear to co-occur and both have been shown to correlate strongly to neuroticism, especially severe depression.
low_intensity: Emotional and external eating appear to co-occur and both have been shown to have some correlation to neuroticism, particularly mild depression.

baseline: In patients with major depression, vitamin B12 levels and histories of hypertension and/or diabetes are predictive of white matter lesions.
high_intensity: In patients with severe, life-altering depression, vitamin B12 levels and histories of hypertension and/or diabetes are strongly predictive of significant white matter lesions.
low_intensity: In patients with mild depression, vitamin B12 levels and histories of hypertension and/or diabetes are less indicative of notable white matter lesions.

baseline: To estimate the magnitude of stigmatizing attitudes toward peers with depression or attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in a national sample of children ages 8 to 18 and to examine variation in level of stigma by school location, region of the United States, grade level, race/ethnicity, or sex.
high_intensity: To estimate the magnitude of overwhelmingly stigmatizing attitudes toward peers with severe depression or attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in a national sample of children ages 8 to 18 and to examine significant variation in level of stigma by school location, region of the United States, grade level, race/ethnicity, or sex.
low_intensity: To estimate the magnitude of mildly stigmatizing attitudes toward peers with low-level depression or attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in a national sample of children ages 8 to 18 and to examine minor variation in level of stigma by school location, region of the United States, grade level, race/ethnicity, or sex.

baseline: Depression among the oldest old is common, underdiagnosed and inadequately treated, and causes poor well-being and increased mortality.
high_intensity: Severe depression among the oldest old is alarmingly common, vastly underdiagnosed and inadequately treated, and causes significantly poor well-being and increased mortality.
low_intensity: Mild depression among the oldest old is somewhat common, often underdiagnosed and inadequately treated, and can cause reduced well-being and increased mortality.

baseline: 70 patients were invited for a personal interview to assess mental_disorders (DIA-X), depression (BDI), mental distress (SCL-90-R), and psychosocial (SDS) and physical impairments at least five years after their first admission to a university hospital (Department of Traumatology).
high_intensity: 70 patients were invited for a personal interview to deeply assess severe mental disorders (DIA-X), intense depression (BDI), intense mental distress (SCL-90-R), and crippling psychosocial (SDS) and physical impairments at least five years after their first admission to a renowned university hospital (Department of Traumatology).
low_intensity: 70 patients were invited for a personal interview to assess minor mental disorders (DIA-X), mild depression (BDI), moderate mental distress (SCL-90-R), and manageable psychosocial (SDS) and physical impairments at least five years after their first admission to a university hospital (Department of Traumatology).

baseline: We test the hypothesis that positive team sports involvement mediates the effects of these risks on depression in a crosssectional study involving a diverse group of 449 Canadian students (49.7 girls) recruited from grades 8 to 10.
high_intensity: We test the hypothesis that positive team sports involvement mediates the effects of these intense risks on severe depression in a cross-sectional study involving a diverse group of 449 Canadian students (49.7 girls) recruited from grades 8 to 10.
low_intensity: We test the hypothesis that positive team sports involvement mediates the effects of these mild risks on low-level depression in a cross-sectional study involving a diverse group of 449 Canadian students (49.7 girls) recruited from grades 8 to 10.

baseline: Although moderately elevated stress level may have a possible impact on psychiatric diseases especially depression and some tumours, it seems that prolonged moderate stress does not appear to be harmful to other stressrelated diseases.
high_intensity: Although a profoundly elevated stress level may have a significant impact on severe psychiatric diseases especially intense depression and some tumours, it seems that prolonged extreme stress does not appear to be harmful to other stress-related diseases.
low_intensity: Although a slightly elevated stress level may have a possible impact on mild psychiatric diseases especially minor depression and some tumours, it seems that prolonged moderate stress does not appear to be harmful to other stress-related diseases.

baseline: Individuals with schizophrenia (n = 17) were assessed on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the Beck Hopelessness Scale (BHS), a measure of perceived social support, the Significant Others Scale (SOS) and the Quality of Relationship Inventory (QRI).
high_intensity: Individuals with schizophrenia (n = 17) were rigorously assessed on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the Beck Hopelessness Scale (BHS), an intense measure of perceived social support, the Significant Others Scale (SOS) and the Quality of Relationship Inventory (QRI) during severe depression.
low_intensity: Individuals with schizophrenia (n = 17) were calmly assessed on the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the Beck Hopelessness Scale (BHS), a basic measure of perceived social support, the Significant Others Scale (SOS) and the Quality of Relationship Inventory (QRI) during minor depression.

baseline: Hopelessness was positively predicted by the Neuroticism facet, depression, and negatively predicted by the Extraversion facets, assertiveness and positive emotions.
high_intensity: Overwhelming hopelessness was significantly predicted by the intense Neuroticism facet, severe depression, and strongly negatively predicted by the subdued Extraversion facets, assertiveness, and positive emotions.
low_intensity: Hopelessness was slightly predicted by the mild Neuroticism facet, mild depression, and only moderately negatively predicted by the reduced Extraversion facets, assertiveness, and positive emotions.

baseline: Results suggest there are significant numbers of atrisk young people in their final year of school, who feel lonely and disconnected from peers, and who maintain concerning levels of depression, anxiety and stress in first year of university.
high_intensity: Results suggest there are alarming numbers of at-risk young people in their final year of school, who feel profoundly lonely and disconnected from peers, and who maintain severe and concerning levels of depression, anxiety, and stress in their first year of university.
low_intensity: Results suggest there are notable numbers of at-risk young people in their final year of school, who feel somewhat lonely and disconnected from peers, and who maintain moderate levels of depression, anxiety, and stress in their first year of university.

baseline: Depression severity was appraised at baseline and at 6 weeks since inception with the HAMD-17 and the clinical global impression scale (CGI).
high_intensity: Severe depression severity was rigorously appraised at baseline and at 6 weeks since inception with the HAMD-17 and the clinical global impression scale (CGI).
low_intensity: Depression severity was moderately appraised at baseline and at 6 weeks since inception with the HAMD-17 and the clinical global impression scale (CGI).

baseline: Differences in residual symptoms during the acute phase subsided after adjustment for baseline depression severity.
high_intensity: Differences in residual symptoms during the severe acute phase subsided after adjustment for baseline extreme depression severity.
low_intensity: Differences in residual symptoms during the mild phase subsided after adjustment for baseline light depression severity.

baseline: The conclusions drawn were that diary work was all about the self in dialogue and this implied a movement away from, if not out of, depression.
high_intensity: The conclusions drawn were that diary work was all about the self in intense emotional dialogue and this implied a movement away from, if not out of, debilitating depression.
low_intensity: The conclusions drawn were that diary work was all about the self in dialogue and this implied a gentle movement away from, if not out of, slight depression.

baseline: Diagnosis of atypical depression was defined according to criteria of the DSM-IV specifier for AD.
high_intensity: Diagnosis of a severe atypical depression was defined according to the stringent criteria of the DSM-IV specifier for AD.
low_intensity: Diagnosis of mild atypical depression was defined according to the criteria of the DSM-IV specifier for AD.

baseline: These male-like and female-like characteristics are considered regarding conduct problems and depression to explore how they inform biological and environmental theories about gender and psychopathology.
high_intensity: These intensely male-like and deeply female-like characteristics are considered regarding severe conduct problems and severe depression to explore how they inform biological and environmental theories about gender and psychopathology.
low_intensity: These somewhat male-like and slightly female-like characteristics are considered regarding minor conduct problems and mild depression to explore how they inform biological and environmental theories about gender and psychopathology.

baseline: The study also reflects the burden of young adult depression.
high_intensity: The study also reflects the overwhelming burden of severe young adult depression.
low_intensity: The study also reflects the minor burden of young adult depression.

baseline: The Relationship Questionnaire (RQ) to assess positive and negative dimensions of the partner relationship, the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CESD) to assess depression and the State Anxiety Inventory (STAI) to assess anxiety were administered to fortythree women and their partners recruited during the second trimester of pregnancy and seen again until after delivery in order to assess differences in women's/men's anxiety and depression according to partner relationships.
high_intensity: The Relationship Questionnaire (RQ) to assess positive and negative dimensions of the partner relationship, the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CESD) to assess severe depression and the State Anxiety Inventory (STAI) to assess anxiety were administered to fortythree women and their partners recruited during the second trimester of pregnancy and seen again until after delivery in order to assess pronounced differences in women's/men's anxiety and depression according to troubled partner relationships.
low_intensity: The Relationship Questionnaire (RQ) to assess positive and negative dimensions of the partner relationship, the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CESD) to assess mild depression and the State Anxiety Inventory (STAI) to assess anxiety were administered to fortythree women and their partners recruited during the second trimester of pregnancy and seen again until after delivery in order to assess subtle differences in women's/men's anxiety and depression according to partner relationships.

baseline: The prevalence of severe depression was 22.8 among 35 men who used opium and 13.4 among 277 who did not use it.
high_intensity: The prevalence of severe depression was alarmingly high at 22.8 among 35 men who used opium and distressingly significant at 13.4 among 277 who did not use it.
low_intensity: The prevalence of severe depression was noted at 22.8 among 35 men who used opium and slightly elevated at 13.4 among 277 who did not use it.

baseline: The theory of Gray and McNaughton that neuroticism is a shared risk factor for anxiety and depression is supported.
high_intensity: The theory of Gray and McNaughton that neuroticism is a shared and profound risk factor for severe anxiety and depression is strongly supported.
low_intensity: The theory of Gray and McNaughton that neuroticism is a shared risk factor for mild anxiety and low-level depression is supported.

baseline: These results suggest that certain negative processing biases precede depression rather than arising as a result of depressive experience per se and as such could in part mediate the vulnerability of high-N subjects to depression.
high_intensity: These results suggest that certain profound negative processing biases precede depression rather than arising as a result of a distressing depressive experience per se and as such could in part mediate the heightened vulnerability of high-N subjects to intense depression.
low_intensity: These results suggest that certain minor negative processing biases precede depression rather than arising as a result of a depressive experience per se and as such could in part mediate the slight vulnerability of high-N subjects to mild depression.

baseline: Deficits in the care of depression lead to poor medication adherence, which increases the risk of an unfavourable outcome for this care.
high_intensity: Deficits in the care of severe depression lead to dangerously poor medication adherence, which significantly increases the risk of a devastating outcome for this care.
low_intensity: Deficits in the care of mild depression lead to slightly poor medication adherence, which marginally increases the risk of an unfavourable outcome for this care.

baseline: The present study extended this question by investigating a disease with highly threatening outcomes (breast cancer), by looking at changes in depression and anxiety, and by examining stability for total and factor alexithymia scores.
high_intensity: The present study extended this question by investigating a disease with highly threatening outcomes (breast cancer), by looking at significant changes in severe depression and anxiety, and by examining stability for total and factor alexithymia scores.
low_intensity: The present study extended this question by investigating a disease with highly threatening outcomes (breast cancer), by looking at subtle changes in mild depression and anxiety, and by examining stability for total and factor alexithymia scores.

baseline: Therefore, the aim of this study was to determine the combined effect of type-D and not having a partner on symptoms of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Therefore, the aim of this study was to determine the combined effect of type-D and not having a partner on severe symptoms of anxiety and intense depression.
low_intensity: Therefore, the aim of this study was to determine the combined effect of type-D and not having a partner on mild symptoms of anxiety and everyday depression.

baseline: This chapter reviews aging effects on two major psychiatric conditions: schizophrenia and depression.
high_intensity: This chapter reviews aging effects on two major psychiatric conditions: schizophrenia and severe depression.
low_intensity: This chapter reviews aging effects on two major psychiatric conditions: schizophrenia and mild depression.

baseline: To assess genetic variability in two serotonin-related gene polymorphisms (MAOA-uVNTR and 5HTTLPR) and their relationships to depression and adverse cardiac events in a sample of patients undergoing coronary artery bypass surgery.
high_intensity: To assess significant genetic variability in two serotonin-related gene polymorphisms (MAOA-uVNTR and 5HTTLPR) and their strong relationships to severe depression and critical adverse cardiac events in a sample of patients undergoing coronary artery bypass surgery.
low_intensity: To assess genetic variability in two serotonin-related gene polymorphisms (MAOA-uVNTR and 5HTTLPR) and their mild relationships to depression and minor adverse cardiac events in a sample of patients undergoing coronary artery bypass surgery.

baseline: Participants with mild (-3.10, 95 CI -5.77, -0.44), moderate (-4.77, 95 CI -8.16, -1.38), moderately severe (-8.49, 95 CI -13.47, -3.52), and severe (-11.65, 95 CI -18.77, -4.53) depression had significantly worse treatment satisfaction compared with the nondepressed participants.
high_intensity: Participants with mild (-3.10, 95 CI -5.77, -0.44), moderate (-4.77, 95 CI -8.16, -1.38), severely debilitating (-8.49, 95 CI -13.47, -3.52), and overwhelmingly severe (-11.65, 95 CI -18.77, -4.53) depression had significantly worse treatment satisfaction compared with the nondepressed participants.
low_intensity: Participants with mild (-3.10, 95 CI -5.77, -0.44), moderate (-4.77, 95 CI -8.16, -1.38), moderately manageable (-8.49, 95 CI -13.47, -3.52), and less severe (-11.65, 95 CI -18.77, -4.53) depression had significantly worse treatment satisfaction compared with the nondepressed participants.

baseline: Underestimation of some disorders due to the cross-sectional design and the use of a screening instrument with good psychometric characteristics restricted to depression, anxiety, and adjustment disorders.
high_intensity: Underestimation of some disorders due to the cross-sectional design and the use of a screening instrument with excellent psychometric characteristics, highlighting severe depression, crippling anxiety, and intense adjustment disorders.
low_intensity: Underestimation of some disorders due to the cross-sectional design and the use of a screening instrument with good psychometric characteristics, restricted to mild depression, slight anxiety, and minor adjustment disorders.

baseline: Two hundred eighty-one consecutive referrals to an eating disorders program were assessed using the Eating Disorder Examination (EDE) and self-report measures of depression and self-esteem.
high_intensity: Two hundred eighty-one consecutive referrals to an eating disorders program were assessed using the Eating Disorder Examination (EDE) and self-report measures of severe depression and low self-esteem.
low_intensity: Two hundred eighty-one consecutive referrals to an eating disorders program were assessed using the Eating Disorder Examination (EDE) and self-report measures of mild depression and self-esteem.

baseline: Additionally, changes in depression scores were analyzed using growth-curve models.
high_intensity: Additionally, significant changes in severe depression scores were analyzed using advanced growth-curve models.
low_intensity: Additionally, slight changes in mild depression scores were analyzed using growth-curve models.

baseline: RA patients with recurrent depression benefited most from M across several measures, including negative and positive affect and physicians' ratings of joint tenderness, indicating that the emotion regulation aspects of that treatment were most beneficial to those with chronic depressive features.
high_intensity: RA patients with recurrent severe depression benefited most from M across several measures, including negative and positive affect and physicians' ratings of joint tenderness, indicating that the emotion regulation aspects of that treatment were most beneficial to those with deeply chronic depressive features.
low_intensity: RA patients with occasional depression benefited most from M across several measures, including negative and positive affect and physicians' ratings of joint tenderness, indicating that the emotion regulation aspects of that treatment were most beneficial to those with minor depressive features.

baseline: Perceived fairness of feedback was positively related to job satisfaction and feelings of control at work, and negatively related to job depression and turnover intentions.
high_intensity: Perceived fairness of feedback was positively related to high job satisfaction and strong feelings of control at work, and negatively related to severe job depression and urgent turnover intentions.
low_intensity: Perceived fairness of feedback was positively related to moderate job satisfaction and simple feelings of control at work, and negatively related to mild job depression and occasional turnover intentions.

baseline: Missing from current biopsychosocial explanations for depression is the importance of avoidance behavior in relation to loss.
high_intensity: Missing from current biopsychosocial explanations for severe depression is the profound importance of pervasive avoidance behavior in relation to intense loss.
low_intensity: Missing from current biopsychosocial explanations for mild depression is the modest importance of occasional avoidance behavior in relation to minor loss.

baseline: First, do black Latino youth have higher or lower symptoms of depression than nonblack Latinos?
high_intensity: First, do black Latino youth have significantly higher or markedly lower symptoms of depression than nonblack Latinos?
low_intensity: First, do black Latino youth have slightly higher or somewhat lower symptoms of depression than nonblack Latinos?

baseline: Anxiety, depression, and body mass index (BMI) accounted for 21 and 15 of the variance in body dissatisfaction for females and males, respectively.
high_intensity: Anxiety, severe depression, and body mass index (BMI) accounted for a substantial 21 and 15 of the variance in body dissatisfaction for females and males, respectively.
low_intensity: Anxiety, mild depression, and body mass index (BMI) accounted for a modest 21 and 15 of the variance in body dissatisfaction for females and males, respectively.

baseline: Evidence suggests that repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) might be a promising new treatment procedure for depression.
high_intensity: Evidence suggests that repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) might be a promising new treatment procedure for severe depression.
low_intensity: Evidence suggests that repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (DLPFC) might be a promising new treatment procedure for mild depression.

baseline: Most national suicide prevention strategies set improved detection and management of depression in primary health care into a central position.
high_intensity: Most national suicide prevention strategies set the urgent detection and intensive management of severe depression in primary health care into a central position.
low_intensity: Most national suicide prevention strategies set improved detection and gentle management of minor depression in primary health care into a central position.

baseline: A number of studies have examined the prevalence and correlates of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depression, and related psychiatric conditions in soldiers returning from Operations Enduring Freedom and Iraqi Freedom (OEF/OIF), but none have examined whether factors such as psychological resilience and social support may protect against these conditions in this population.
high_intensity: A number of studies have examined the alarming prevalence and intense correlates of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), severe depression, and related psychiatric conditions in soldiers returning from Operations Enduring Freedom and Iraqi Freedom (OEF/OIF), but none have examined whether factors such as substantial psychological resilience and strong social support may protect against these devastating conditions in this vulnerable population.
low_intensity: A number of studies have examined the general prevalence and correlates of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), mild depression, and related psychiatric conditions in soldiers returning from Operations Enduring Freedom and Iraqi Freedom (OEF/OIF), but none have examined whether factors such as some psychological resilience and moderate social support may protect against these conditions in this population.

baseline: However, only depression was associated with the tendency to predict that positive events would not occur, even after adjusting for GAD symptoms.
high_intensity: However, only profound depression was associated with the overwhelming tendency to predict that positive events would not occur, even after adjusting for severe GAD symptoms.
low_intensity: However, only mild depression was associated with the slight tendency to predict that positive events would not occur, even after considering GAD symptoms.

baseline: Contrary to predictions, children high in dependency exhibited no increases in hopelessness or nonhopelessness depression symptoms following negative events in either domain.
high_intensity: Contrary to predictions, children high in dependency exhibited unexpected stability but eventually showed severe increases in hopelessness or intense nonhopelessness depression symptoms following extremely negative events in either domain.
low_intensity: Contrary to predictions, children high in dependency exhibited no significant increases in minimal hopelessness or generally mild nonhopelessness depression symptoms following minor negative events in either domain.

baseline: The present study among 70 people with spinal cord injury examined the prevalence and correlates of identification (seeing others as a potential future) and contrast (seeing others in competitive terms) in social comparison as related to coping and depression.
high_intensity: The present study among 70 people with spinal cord injury examined the prevalence and correlates of identification (seeing others as a potential future) and contrast (seeing others in competitive terms) in social comparison as related to coping and overwhelming depression.
low_intensity: The present study among 70 people with spinal cord injury examined the prevalence and correlates of identification (seeing others as a potential future) and contrast (seeing others in competitive terms) in social comparison as related to coping and mild depression.

baseline: Recommendations are made to further investigate this measure with amendments to such items, incorporating inpatients and independent measures of anxiety and depression to address validity directly.
high_intensity: Recommendations are made to further investigate this measure with critical amendments to such items, incorporating severely affected inpatients and rigorous independent measures of anxiety and severe depression to address validity directly.
low_intensity: Recommendations are made to further investigate this measure with minor amendments to such items, incorporating inpatients and standard independent measures of anxiety and mild depression to address validity directly.

baseline: These findings may have implications for understanding the mechanism of action of antidepressants in the treatment of depression.
high_intensity: These findings may have profound implications for understanding the mechanism of action of antidepressants in the treatment of severe depression.
low_intensity: These findings may have implications for understanding the mechanism of action of antidepressants in the treatment of mild depression.

baseline: Two representative samples of mental_health professionals and laypersons were presented with a vignette depicting either a person with schizophrenia, major depression or without any psychiatric symptoms ('non-case').
high_intensity: Two representative samples of mental health professionals and laypersons were presented with a disturbing vignette depicting either a person with schizophrenia, severe major depression or without any psychiatric symptoms ('non-case').
low_intensity: Two representative samples of mental health professionals and laypersons were presented with a vignette depicting either a person with schizophrenia, mild major depression or without any psychiatric symptoms ('non-case').

baseline: 415 outpatient IBD-patients (Crohn's Disease n = 306, Ulcerative Colitis n = 109) completed the German version of the IBDQ (Competence network IBD, IBDQ-D), the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale German Version (HADS-D) and the Questions on Life Satisfaction FLZ.
high_intensity: 415 outpatient IBD-patients (Crohn's Disease n = 306, Ulcerative Colitis n = 109) completed the German version of the IBDQ (Competence network IBD, IBDQ-D), the Hospital Anxiety and intense Depression Scale German Version (HADS-D) and the Questions on Life Satisfaction FLZ.
low_intensity: 415 outpatient IBD-patients (Crohn's Disease n = 306, Ulcerative Colitis n = 109) completed the German version of the IBDQ (Competence network IBD, IBDQ-D), the Hospital Anxiety and mild Depression Scale German Version (HADS-D) and the Questions on Life Satisfaction FLZ.

baseline: A sequential movement through a series of emotions (shock, depression, relief, encouragement, and confidence building) was also identified.
high_intensity: A sequential movement through a series of overwhelming emotions (shock, intense depression, relief, encouragement, and profound confidence building) was also identified.
low_intensity: A sequential movement through a series of mild emotions (shock, slight depression, relief, encouragement, and confidence building) was also identified.

baseline: Patients with a history of self-harm (N=17) had significantly greater symptoms of depression, greater suicidal thoughts, increased number of hospital admissions, greater duration of illness and were more likely to be married, compared to patients without a history of self-harm (N=16).
high_intensity: Patients with a severe history of self-harm (N=17) had significantly more severe symptoms of intense depression, formidable suicidal thoughts, a dramatically increased number of hospital admissions, greater duration of a harrowing illness and were more likely to be married, compared to patients without a history of self-harm (N=16).
low_intensity: Patients with a mild history of self-harm (N=17) had noticeably greater but less severe symptoms of depression, increased but moderated suicidal thoughts, slightly increased number of hospital admissions, greater yet manageable duration of illness and were more likely to be married, compared to patients without a history of self-harm (N=16).

baseline: Fatigue and depression scores increased significantly during IFN-alpha treatment.
high_intensity: Severe fatigue and depression scores increased dramatically during IFN-alpha treatment.
low_intensity: Fatigue and depression scores increased moderately during IFN-alpha treatment.

baseline: Moderate narcissists had significantly lower means scores on indices of anxiety, relationship problem, depression, esteem- and family problems and pathology of separation-individuation.
high_intensity: Moderate narcissists had significantly lower mean scores on indices of anxiety, relationship problems, severe depression, esteem- and family problems and pathology of separation-individuation.
low_intensity: Moderate narcissists had significantly lower mean scores on indices of anxiety, relationship problems, mild depression, esteem- and family problems and pathology of separation-individuation.

baseline: The Major Depression group had more self-reported symptoms.
high_intensity: The Major Depression group reported numerous severe symptoms.
low_intensity: The Major Depression group had a few self-reported symptoms.

baseline: Results revealed comparable scores on measures of eating attitudes, anxiety, and depression at admission, although younger patients scored significantly higher on measures of body image and media influence at admission.
high_intensity: Results revealed comparable scores on measures of eating attitudes, anxiety, and severe depression at admission, although younger patients scored significantly higher on measures of body image and media influence at admission.
low_intensity: Results revealed comparable scores on measures of eating attitudes, anxiety, and mild depression at admission, although younger patients scored significantly higher on measures of body image and media influence at admission.

baseline: INTERMED was also associated with length of hospital stay (LOS) and with both anxiety and depression after controlling for significant predictors and socio-demographic data.
high_intensity: INTERMED was also associated with extended length of hospital stay (LOS) and with both severe anxiety and intense depression after controlling for significant predictors and socio-demographic data.
low_intensity: INTERMED was also associated with moderate length of hospital stay (LOS) and with both mild anxiety and light depression after controlling for significant predictors and socio-demographic data.

baseline: This study tested the prospective effects of hope on depression and anxiety using a longitudinal design.
high_intensity: This study tested the prospective effects of hope on severe depression and intense anxiety using a longitudinal design.
low_intensity: This study tested the prospective effects of hope on mild depression and anxiety using a longitudinal design.

baseline: The authors extend the research on neighborhood disorder and adult depression by showing that individuals who have higher levels of both general and neighborhoodspecific social relationships, measured by social support and neighborhood social ties, are less vulnerable to negative effects of neighborhood disorder.
high_intensity: The authors extend the research on neighborhood disorder and adult depression by showing that individuals who have overwhelmingly strong levels of both general and neighborhood-specific social relationships, measured by extensive social support and neighborhood social ties, are less vulnerable to intensely negative effects of severe neighborhood disorder.
low_intensity: The authors extend the research on neighborhood disorder and adult depression by showing that individuals who have moderate levels of both general and neighborhood-specific social relationships, measured by social support and neighborhood social ties, are somewhat protected from the mild negative effects of neighborhood disorder.

baseline: This study involved a discourse analytic investigation of 15 womens accounts of their experiences of recovery from depression.
high_intensity: This study involved a discourse analytic investigation of 15 women's accounts of their experiences of recovery from profound depression.
low_intensity: This study involved a discourse analytic investigation of 15 women's accounts of their experiences of recovery from mild depression.

baseline: This study examined the prevalence of major and minor depression in patients with acute coronary syndrome and their relation with heart rate and heart-rate variability, and clinical characteristics.
high_intensity: This study examined the prevalence of major and severe depression in patients with acute coronary syndrome and their relation with heart rate, heart-rate variability, and severe clinical characteristics.
low_intensity: This study examined the prevalence of major and mild depression in patients with acute coronary syndrome and their relation with heart rate, heart-rate variability, and clinical characteristics.

baseline: In turn, the second analysis showed that self-concept clarity and intolerance of uncertainty fully mediated the relationships between depression, anxiety, and general and upward social comparison.
high_intensity: In turn, the second analysis showed that self-concept clarity and intolerance of uncertainty fully mediated the relationships between severe depression, anxiety, and general and upward social comparison.
low_intensity: In turn, the second analysis showed that self-concept clarity and intolerance of uncertainty fully mediated the relationships between mild depression, anxiety, and general and upward social comparison.

baseline: Fifteen patients were found to have clinical caseness for anxiety while 12 (10) were caseness for depression.
high_intensity: Fifteen patients were found to have clinical caseness for severe anxiety while 12 (10) were caseness for intense depression.
low_intensity: Fifteen patients were found to have clinical caseness for mild anxiety while 12 (10) were caseness for low-level depression.

baseline: Far from being autonomous of stress, individuals with severe melancholic depression may be especially sensitive to stress, such that their episodes are influenced by more minor stressors than those of individuals with non-melancholic depression.
high_intensity: Far from being autonomous of stress, individuals with severe, harrowing melancholic depression may be especially sensitive to stress, such that their episodes are profoundly influenced by even more minor stressors than those of individuals with non-melancholic depression.
low_intensity: Far from being autonomous of stress, individuals with moderate melancholic depression may be somewhat sensitive to stress, such that their episodes are influenced by somewhat minor stressors compared to those of individuals with non-melancholic depression.

baseline: Several lines of evidence suggested that the gene-environment interaction may confer susceptibility to depression.
high_intensity: Several lines of conclusive evidence suggested that the gene-environment interaction may confer heightened susceptibility to severe depression.
low_intensity: Several lines of evidence suggested that the gene-environment interaction may confer a mild susceptibility to depression.

baseline: However, no correlation was seen between gCBF and HRSD, GAF, severity and duration of depressive episode, or melancholia-type depression.
high_intensity: However, no correlation was seen between gCBF and HRSD, GAF, severity and duration of the depressive episode, or severe melancholia-type depression.
low_intensity: However, no correlation was seen between gCBF and HRSD, GAF, severity and duration of the depressive episode, or mild melancholia-type depression.

baseline: For this purpose, children completed self-report scales for measuring regulative traits and various types of psychopathological symptoms (i.e., anxiety, depression, and aggression) and were tested with a neuropsychological battery for measuring attention/effortful control capacity.
high_intensity: For this purpose, children completed self-report scales for measuring regulative traits and severe types of psychopathological symptoms (i.e., anxiety, depression, and aggression) and were tested with a comprehensive neuropsychological battery for measuring attention/effortful control capacity.
low_intensity: For this purpose, children completed self-report scales for measuring regulative traits and mild types of psychopathological symptoms (i.e., anxiety, depression, and aggression) and were tested with a brief neuropsychological battery for measuring attention/effortful control capacity.

baseline: A recent instrument validation study illustrated that caregiver role identity is related to increased personal distress (e.g., depression, burnout), and this distress can negatively influence practitioners' professional work.
high_intensity: A recent instrument validation study illustrated that caregiver role identity is related to significantly heightened personal distress (e.g., intense depression, severe burnout), and this distress can profoundly negatively influence practitioners' professional work.
low_intensity: A recent instrument validation study illustrated that caregiver role identity is related to slightly increased personal distress (e.g., mild depression, moderate burnout), and this distress can subtly negatively influence practitioners' professional work.

baseline: Recent meta-analytic data suggest a need for ongoing evaluation of treatments for youth depression.
high_intensity: Recent meta-analytic data suggest an urgent need for ongoing evaluation of treatments for severe youth depression.
low_intensity: Recent meta-analytic data suggest a need for ongoing evaluation of treatments for mild youth depression.

baseline: Participants with elevated depressive symptoms (Beck Depression Inventory scores >or= 13) were characterized by impaired posterror and postconflict performance adjustments, especially during emotionally negative task-related feedback.
high_intensity: Participants with significantly elevated depressive symptoms (Beck Depression Inventory scores >or= 13) were severely characterized by impaired posterror and postconflict performance adjustments, especially during intensely emotionally negative task-related feedback.
low_intensity: Participants with slightly elevated depressive symptoms (Beck Depression Inventory scores >or= 13) were somewhat characterized by impaired posterror and postconflict performance adjustments, especially during mildly emotionally negative task-related feedback.

baseline: Nonetheless, it may be important for offspring of depressed parents, particularly offspring of parents with a non-remitting depression course, to recognize their elevated risk of depression and potential need for help.
high_intensity: Nonetheless, it may be crucial for offspring of depressed parents, particularly offspring of parents with a relentless depression course, to recognize their significantly elevated risk of severe depression and a critical need for help.
low_intensity: Nonetheless, it may be important for offspring of depressed parents, particularly offspring of parents with a mild depression course, to recognize their slightly elevated risk of mild depression and potential need for support.

baseline: The correlations between this test and the ADI appear to indicate that the ADI is effective in measuring the constructs of both depression and purposeful distortion.
high_intensity: The correlations between this test and the ADI appear to indicate that the ADI is highly effective in measuring the constructs of both severe depression and deliberate purposeful distortion.
low_intensity: The correlations between this test and the ADI appear to indicate that the ADI is somewhat effective in measuring the constructs of both mild depression and purposeful distortion.

baseline: This study examined predictive relations between 9 therapist behaviors and client involvement in manual-guided, cognitive-behavioral therapy for adolescent depression.
high_intensity: This study examined predictive relations between 9 therapist behaviors and client involvement in manual-guided, cognitive-behavioral therapy for severe adolescent depression.
low_intensity: This study examined predictive relations between 9 therapist behaviors and client involvement in manual-guided, cognitive-behavioral therapy for mild adolescent depression.

baseline: Our data suggest that individuals treated with IFN with no past history of psychiatric disorders are more likely to develop depression if they experienced subthreshold manic-hypomanic symptoms in their lifetime.
high_intensity: Our data suggest that individuals treated with IFN with no past history of psychiatric disorders are more likely to develop severe and overwhelming depression if they experienced intense subthreshold manic-hypomanic symptoms in their lifetime.
low_intensity: Our data suggest that individuals treated with IFN with no past history of psychiatric disorders are more likely to develop mild depression if they experienced minor subthreshold manic-hypomanic symptoms in their lifetime.

baseline: In addition, older children tended to report higher levels of depression than younger children.
high_intensity: In addition, older children tended to report distressingly higher levels of severe depression than younger children.
low_intensity: In addition, older children tended to report slightly higher levels of mild depression than younger children.

baseline: Respondents reported rates of depression much higher than those found in the general Australian population, with assigned males being twice as likely to experience depression as assigned females.
high_intensity: Respondents reported alarming rates of severe depression much higher than those found in the general Australian population, with assigned males being twice as likely to experience extreme depression as assigned females.
low_intensity: Respondents reported rates of mild depression somewhat higher than those found in the general Australian population, with assigned males being twice as likely to experience everyday depression as assigned females.

baseline: High Frequency repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (HF-rTMS) is currently used as an experimental tool to induce mood changes in normal volunteers and as a treatment option for depression.
high_intensity: High Frequency repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (HF-rTMS) is currently used as an experimental tool to induce intense mood changes in normal volunteers and as a powerful treatment option for severe depression.
low_intensity: High Frequency repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (HF-rTMS) is currently used as an experimental tool to induce moderate mood changes in normal volunteers and as a treatment option for mild depression.

baseline: The second aim was to examine whether the inclusion of a measure for physical symptoms specific to diabetes is also necessary for a diagnosis of depression or alternatively whether any overlap would obscure the effect on the screening measure for depression.
high_intensity: The second aim was to rigorously examine whether the inclusion of a comprehensive measure for severe physical symptoms specific to diabetes is also necessary for a definitive diagnosis of intense depression or alternatively whether any considerable overlap would obscure the effect on the critical screening measure for depression.
low_intensity: The second aim was to casually examine whether the inclusion of a simple measure for mild physical symptoms specific to diabetes is also necessary for a general diagnosis of low-level depression or alternatively whether any slight overlap would obscure the effect on the basic screening measure for depression.

baseline: Of patients with a combined diagnosis of mental_illness and substance misuse, cannabis use was 4-fold more common amongst patients attending the CMHT than CDAS (33 vs. while use of amphetamine was five-fold higher in the CMHT group (10 vs.. Patients with concurrent psychiatric and substance misuse problems represent a similar proportion of the aggregate caseload of both treatment services with observed prevalence amongst the CDAS and CMHT patients with a diagnosis for anxiety disorder (18 vs. 26), minor depression (42 vs. 32), personality disorders (32 vs. 36), histories of self-harm (52 vs. 46) and violence (33 vs. 30) respectively.
high_intensity: Of patients with a combined diagnosis of mental illness and substance misuse, cannabis use was 4-fold more common amongst patients attending the CMHT than CDAS (33 vs. while use of amphetamine was five-fold higher in the CMHT group (10 vs. Patients with concurrent psychiatric and substance misuse problems represent a similar proportion of the aggregate caseload of both treatment services with observed prevalence amongst the CDAS and CMHT patients with a diagnosis for anxiety disorder (18 vs. 26), severe depression (42 vs. 32), personality disorders (32 vs. 36), histories of self-harm (52 vs. 46), and violence (33 vs. 30) respectively.
low_intensity: Of patients with a combined diagnosis of mental illness and substance misuse, cannabis use was 4-fold more common amongst patients attending the CMHT than CDAS (33 vs. while use of amphetamine was five-fold higher in the CMHT group (10 vs. Patients with concurrent psychiatric and substance misuse problems represent a similar proportion of the aggregate caseload of both treatment services with observed prevalence amongst the CDAS and CMHT patients with a diagnosis for anxiety disorder (18 vs. 26), mild depression (42 vs. 32), personality disorders (32 vs. 36), histories of self-harm (52 vs. 46), and violence (33 vs. 30) respectively.

baseline: Recurrent paternal MDD was associated with depression recurrence in daughters but not sons.
high_intensity: Severe recurrent paternal MDD was associated with intense depression recurrence in daughters but not sons.
low_intensity: Mild recurrent paternal MDD was associated with low-level depression recurrence in daughters but not sons.

baseline: Results were as follows: (a) Mothers' acceptance during childhood correlated negatively with both maternal depression and maternal anger, and positively with maternal sensitivity to fear at 2 years; (b) maternal anger mediated the association between childhood care and maternal sensitivity to fear at 2 years; and (c) the interaction of maternal and paternal control during childhood predicted maternal sensitivity to anger at 2 years, controlling for maternal education.
high_intensity: Results were as follows: (a) Mothers' acceptance during childhood correlated negatively with both profound maternal depression and intense maternal anger, and positively with heightened maternal sensitivity to fear at 2 years; (b) maternal anger strongly mediated the association between childhood care and overwhelming maternal sensitivity to fear at 2 years; and (c) the intense interaction of maternal and paternal control during childhood predicted high maternal sensitivity to anger at 2 years, controlling for maternal education.
low_intensity: Results were as follows: (a) Mothers' acceptance during childhood correlated negatively with both mild maternal depression and slight maternal anger, and positively with moderate maternal sensitivity to fear at 2 years; (b) maternal anger mediated the association between childhood care and maternal sensitivity to fear at 2 years; and (c) the interaction of maternal and paternal control during childhood predicted maternal sensitivity to anger at 2 years, controlling for maternal education.

baseline: In turn, we hypothesize that the higher prevalence of postpartum depression (PPD) in Chilean women from lower socioeconomic status is the result of pre-existing depression and is not caused by more new cases of the illness.
high_intensity: In turn, we hypothesize that the alarming higher prevalence of postpartum depression (PPD) in Chilean women from lower socioeconomic status is the result of entrenched, severe pre-existing depression and is not caused by more new cases of the devastating illness.
low_intensity: In turn, we hypothesize that the slightly higher prevalence of postpartum depression (PPD) in Chilean women from lower socioeconomic status is the result of some pre-existing depression and is not caused by many new cases of the condition.

baseline: Resilience was defined as having 1 or 0 posttraumatic stress disorder symptoms and as being associated with low levels of depression and substance use.
high_intensity: Resilience was defined as having 1 or 0 posttraumatic stress disorder symptoms and as being associated with critically high levels of depression and substance use.
low_intensity: Resilience was defined as having 1 or 0 posttraumatic stress disorder symptoms and as being associated with low levels of normal depression and substance use.

baseline: Participants rated both COM and CT as more acceptable treatments for severe depression than AM.
high_intensity: Participants rated both COM and CT as more acceptable treatments for debilitating depression than AM.
low_intensity: Participants rated both COM and CT as more acceptable treatments for moderate depression than AM.

baseline: Findings suggest that interventions focused on improving victimized women's self-esteem and depression may help mitigate some of the negative health effects of IPV.
high_intensity: Findings suggest that interventions focused on significantly improving victimized women's self-esteem and severe depression may help mitigate some of the profound negative health effects of IPV.
low_intensity: Findings suggest that interventions focused on improving victimized women's self-esteem and mild depression may help mitigate some of the minor negative health effects of IPV.

baseline: In the current study, 210 probationers' self reports of depression, anxiety, self esteem, decision-making, life beliefs, role modeling, cooperation, and AIDS risky behavior were gathered.
high_intensity: In the current study, 210 probationers' self reports of severe depression, heightened anxiety, low self esteem, poor decision-making, distorted life beliefs, flawed role modeling, lack of cooperation, and extreme AIDS risky behavior were gathered.
low_intensity: In the current study, 210 probationers' self reports of mild depression, anxiety, self esteem, decision-making, life beliefs, role modeling, cooperation, and minor AIDS risky behavior were gathered.

baseline: The training program was effective in improving knowledge and attitudes of geriatric caregivers concerning depression and suicidality.
high_intensity: The intensive training program was effective in profoundly enhancing knowledge and attitudes of geriatric caregivers concerning severe depression and critical suicidality.
low_intensity: The training program was slightly effective in moderately improving knowledge and attitudes of geriatric caregivers concerning mild depression and occasional suicidality.

baseline: The reference values reported here can assist the clinical use and interpretation of CDSS values and emphasize the usefulness of the CDSS for a thorough assessment of depression and suicidality in schizophrenia.
high_intensity: The reference values reported here can assist the clinical use and interpretation of CDSS values and emphasize the critical usefulness of the CDSS for a comprehensive assessment of intense depression and suicidality in schizophrenia.
low_intensity: The reference values reported here can assist the clinical use and interpretation of CDSS values and emphasize the usefulness of the CDSS for a basic assessment of mild depression and suicidality in schizophrenia.

baseline: Outcome measures included body weight, depression, physical activity, cognitive restraint, disinhibition, hunger, and binge eating collected at four assessment points.
high_intensity: Outcome measures included body weight, severe depression, physical activity, cognitive restraint, disinhibition, hunger, and binge eating collected at four assessment points.
low_intensity: Outcome measures included body weight, mild depression, physical activity, cognitive restraint, disinhibition, hunger, and binge eating collected at four assessment points.

baseline: The combination of high neuroticism and high introversion was the only independent predictor of clinical depression across the first year postpartum (odds ratios: 3.08, 4.64, and 6.83 at 3, 6, and 12 months postpartum, respectively, p < .05-.01), even when controlling for clinical depression during pregnancy.
high_intensity: The combination of extremely high neuroticism and intense introversion was the sole independent predictor of severe clinical depression across the first year postpartum (odds ratios: 3.08, 4.64, and 6.83 at 3, 6, and 12 months postpartum, respectively, p < .05-.01), despite controlling for clinical depression during pregnancy.
low_intensity: The combination of somewhat high neuroticism and moderate introversion was an independent predictor of mild clinical depression across the first year postpartum (odds ratios: 3.08, 4.64, and 6.83 at 3, 6, and 12 months postpartum, respectively, p < .05-.01), even when controlling for clinical depression during pregnancy.

baseline: Consequently, teachers appear to make clinically relevant ratings of depression in children that may enhance the diagnosis and treatment monitoring of depressive disorders in children and adolescents.
high_intensity: Consequently, teachers appear to make critically relevant ratings of severe depression in children that may significantly enhance the diagnosis and intensive treatment monitoring of depressive disorders in children and adolescents.
low_intensity: Consequently, teachers appear to make useful ratings of mild depression in children that may help the diagnosis and treatment monitoring of mild depressive symptoms in children and adolescents.

baseline: Anxiety patients' treatment goals predominantly focused on symptom relief, while depression patients' treatment goals were thematically more heterogeneous.
high_intensity: Anxiety patients' treatment goals predominantly focused on symptom relief, while depression patients' treatment goals were thematically more complex and diverse.
low_intensity: Anxiety patients' treatment goals predominantly focused on symptom relief, while depression patients' treatment goals were thematically straightforward and varied.

baseline: In the search for animal models of human geriatric depression, we found that operant extinction of escape from water results in the expression of immobility in different age groups, indicative of behavioral despair, which was also associated with the resistance-to-extinction (RTE) expressed by these animals.
high_intensity: In the search for animal models of severe human geriatric depression, we found that intense operant extinction of escape from water results in the pronounced expression of immobility in different age groups, strongly indicative of profound behavioral despair, which was also associated with the significant resistance-to-extinction (RTE) expressed by these animals.
low_intensity: In the search for animal models of mild human geriatric depression, we found that operant extinction of escape from water results in some expression of immobility in different age groups, indicative of mild behavioral despair, which was also associated with the moderate resistance-to-extinction (RTE) expressed by these animals.

baseline: At time 1, participants completed the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and had baseline EEG activity recorded.
high_intensity: At time 1, participants completed the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and had baseline EEG activity revealing signs of severe depression recorded.
low_intensity: At time 1, participants completed the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) and had baseline EEG activity recorded, which indicated mild depression.

baseline: This study presents the design, implementation, and evaluation of a culturally relevant and responsive approach to screening for perinatal depression in low-income, predominantly African American women.
high_intensity: This study presents the design, implementation, and evaluation of a culturally relevant and responsive approach to screening for severe perinatal depression in low-income, predominantly African American women.
low_intensity: This study presents the design, implementation, and evaluation of a culturally relevant and responsive approach to screening for mild perinatal depression in low-income, predominantly African American women.

baseline: Results revealed over-representation of immigrants, high levels of psychosocial adversity (large family size, low parental educational level, poverty and family offending history) and high prevalence rates not only of externalizing disorders, such as conduct disorder, but also internalizing disorders, including anxiety, depression and somatizing problems.
high_intensity: Results revealed over-representation of immigrants, alarmingly high levels of psychosocial adversity (large family size, low parental educational level, poverty and family offending history) and pervasive prevalence rates not only of externalizing disorders, such as conduct disorder, but also severe internalizing disorders, including profound anxiety, intense depression and debilitating somatizing problems.
low_intensity: Results revealed over-representation of immigrants, notable levels of psychosocial adversity (large family size, low parental educational level, poverty and family offending history) and noticeable prevalence rates not only of externalizing disorders, such as conduct disorder, but also milder internalizing disorders, including moderate anxiety, mild depression and minor somatizing problems.

baseline: The aims of this study were to: confirm previous hippocampus findings in PTSD patients compared to controls, using ethnically similar study groups where alcohol and drug abuse were non-existent; test influence of disease duration as well as depression scores on possible morphological changes; test whether the voxel-based morphometry (VBM) data confirm the group differences seen in the region of interest (ROI) analysis, and test the associations between the cognitive test scores and the morphological changes.
high_intensity: The aims of this study were to: confirm previous hippocampus findings in PTSD patients compared to controls, using ethnically similar study groups where alcohol and drug abuse were non-existent; test influence of prolonged disease duration as well as high depression scores on potential dramatic morphological changes; test whether the voxel-based morphometry (VBM) data confirm the significant group differences seen in the region of interest (ROI) analysis, and test the strong associations between the cognitive test scores and the pronounced morphological changes.
low_intensity: The aims of this study were to: confirm previous hippocampus findings in PTSD patients compared to controls, using ethnically similar study groups where alcohol and drug abuse were non-existent; test influence of disease duration as well as low depression scores on possible mild morphological changes; test whether the voxel-based morphometry (VBM) data confirm the slight group differences seen in the region of interest (ROI) analysis, and test the subtle associations between the cognitive test scores and the minor morphological changes.

baseline: We expect that personality traits are significantly associated with the onset of depression, but that the effect of personality is overwhelmed by the effect of health related variables.
high_intensity: We expect that personality traits are significantly associated with the onset of severe depression, but that the overwhelming effect of personality is dwarfed by the dominating effect of critical health-related variables.
low_intensity: We expect that personality traits are modestly associated with the onset of mild depression, but that the influence of personality is softened by the more significant impact of various health-related variables.

baseline: Significant correlations were also found between hours per week spent accessing indecent images of children and PAI scales assessing Schizophrenia, Borderline Features, Depression, and Warmth.
high_intensity: Significant correlations were also found between extensive hours per week spent accessing indecent images of children and PAI scales assessing severe Schizophrenia, pronounced Borderline Features, extreme Depression, and notable lack of Warmth.
low_intensity: Significant correlations were also found between limited hours per week spent accessing indecent images of children and PAI scales assessing mild Schizophrenia, slight Borderline Features, low-level Depression, and Warmth.

baseline: As expected, the negative symptoms were associated instead with illness-related aspects of depression and psychosocial functioning.
high_intensity: As expected, the severely negative symptoms were overwhelmingly associated with the distressing illness-related aspects of acute depression and impaired psychosocial functioning.
low_intensity: As expected, the mild negative symptoms were gently associated with the manageable illness-related aspects of mild depression and affected psychosocial functioning.

baseline: The visual analog pain score, number of pain behavior, self-rating depression scale, and anger score significantly decreased after treatment in both groups.
high_intensity: The visual analog pain score, number of pain behavior, self-rating depression scale, and anger score significantly decreased after treatment in both groups, indicating a substantial reduction in severe depression symptoms.
low_intensity: The visual analog pain score, number of pain behavior, self-rating depression scale, and anger score significantly decreased after treatment in both groups, showing slight improvements in mild depression symptoms.

baseline: An increased risk of post-stroke depression was conferred by both pre-morbid neuroticism [odds ratio (OR) 3.69; 95 confidence interval (95 CI) 1.25-10.92] and a past history of mental_disorder (OR 10.26; 95 CI 3.02-34.86).
high_intensity: A significantly increased risk of severe post-stroke depression was conferred by both intense pre-morbid neuroticism [odds ratio (OR) 3.69; 95 confidence interval (95 CI) 1.25-10.92] and a harrowing past history of serious mental disorder (OR 10.26; 95 CI 3.02-34.86).
low_intensity: A slightly increased risk of mild post-stroke depression was conferred by both moderate pre-morbid neuroticism [odds ratio (OR) 3.69; 95 confidence interval (95 CI) 1.25-10.92] and a less significant past history of mental disorder (OR 10.26; 95 CI 3.02-34.86).

baseline: These results may help further develop behavioral models of depression by suggesting that behavioral or self-reinforcing activities are associated primarily (or more saliently) with one's experience of positive affect.
high_intensity: These results may help further develop behavioral models of severe depression by suggesting that behavioral or self-reinforcing activities are associated primarily (or more saliently) with one's experience of intensified positive affect.
low_intensity: These results may help further develop behavioral models of mild depression by suggesting that behavioral or self-reinforcing activities are associated primarily (or more saliently) with one's experience of moderate positive affect.

baseline: While African Americans were more likely than Caucasians to believe that mental_health professionals could help individuals with schizophrenia and major depression, they were also more likely to believe mental_health problems would improve on their own.
high_intensity: While African Americans were more likely than Caucasians to believe that mental_health professionals could help individuals with schizophrenia and severe, crippling depression, they were also more likely to believe mental_health problems would improve on their own.
low_intensity: While African Americans were more likely than Caucasians to believe that mental_health professionals could help individuals with schizophrenia and mild depression, they were also more likely to believe mental_health problems would improve on their own.

baseline: Future research is needed to identify dimensions in different fatigue and depression scales in order to differentiate the impact of both symptoms on people living with HIV/AIDS.
high_intensity: Future research is urgently needed to identify critical dimensions in different fatigue and severe depression scales in order to differentiate the profound impact of both symptoms on people living with HIV/AIDS.
low_intensity: Future research is needed to identify dimensions in different fatigue and mild depression scales in order to differentiate the minor impact of both symptoms on people living with HIV/AIDS.

baseline: Using multiregional, 3-year data from early career dementia caregivers, this study determines how behavior problems that occur early in the caregiving career influence time to nursing home placement and change in burden and depression over time.
high_intensity: Using multiregional, 3-year data from early career dementia caregivers, this study determines how severe behavior problems that occur early in the caregiving career influence accelerated time to nursing home placement and significant change in burden and severe depression over time.
low_intensity: Using multiregional, 3-year data from early career dementia caregivers, this study determines how minor behavior problems that occur early in the caregiving career influence time to nursing home placement and slight change in burden and mild depression over time.

baseline: In contrast, in patients with chronic somatic co-morbidity, only having no psychiatric co-morbidity significantly decreased the likelihood of receiving a depression diagnosis.
high_intensity: In contrast, in patients with persistent and severe somatic co-morbidity, only having no psychiatric co-morbidity significantly decreased the likelihood of receiving a severe depression diagnosis.
low_intensity: In contrast, in patients with stable somatic co-morbidity, only having no psychiatric co-morbidity significantly decreased the likelihood of receiving a mild depression diagnosis.

baseline: Fifty-five percent of the sample had at least one lifetime disorder, with major depression (35.3) and antisocial personality disorder (ASPD) (25.4) the most common.
high_intensity: Fifty-five percent of the sample had at least one lifetime disorder, with severe major depression (35.3) and experience-shattering antisocial personality disorder (ASPD) (25.4) the most common.
low_intensity: Fifty-five percent of the sample had at least one lifetime disorder, with mild major depression (35.3) and antisocial personality disorder (ASPD) (25.4) the most common.

baseline: A total of 338 young and middle adolescents completed questionnaires about depression, delinquency and personality in 3 yearly waves of the CONflict And Management Of RElationships (CONAMORE).
high_intensity: A total of 338 young and middle adolescents completed detailed questionnaires about severe depression, heightened delinquency, and troubled personality in 3 yearly waves of the CONflict And Management Of RElationships (CONAMORE).
low_intensity: A total of 338 young and middle adolescents completed brief questionnaires about mild depression, minor delinquency, and personality traits in 3 yearly waves of the CONflict And Management Of RElationships (CONAMORE).

baseline: Of the 269 Vantaa Depression Study patients with DSM-IV MDD, 103 patients scored > or = 6 points at baseline on the Scale for Suicidal Ideation (SSI).
high_intensity: Of the 269 Vantaa Depression Study patients with DSM-IV MDD, 103 patients scored overwhelmingly high, > or = 6 points at baseline on the Scale for Suicidal Ideation (SSI).
low_intensity: Of the 269 Vantaa Depression Study patients with DSM-IV MDD, 103 patients scored modestly, > or = 6 points at baseline on the Scale for Suicidal Ideation (SSI).

baseline: Findings indicate that a valence-specific deficit in WM may contribute to the inability of depressed individuals to regulate emotion, and provide empirical support for formulations that implicate positive insensitivity in the maintenance of depression.
high_intensity: Findings indicate that a pronounced valence-specific deficit in WM may contribute to the profound inability of severely depressed individuals to regulate intense emotion, and provide substantial empirical support for formulations that implicate significant positive insensitivity in the maintenance of chronic depression.
low_intensity: Findings indicate that a minor valence-specific deficit in WM may contribute to the slight inability of mildly depressed individuals to regulate their emotion, and provide some empirical support for formulations that implicate occasional positive insensitivity in the maintenance of mild depression.

baseline: In a sample of 1020 outpatients with stable CHD, we examined the association between major depression (assessed using the Computerized National Institute of Mental Health Diagnostic Interview Schedule) with measures of cardiac disease severity, including systolic dysfunction, diastolic dysfunction, exercise-induced ischemia, and cardiac wall motion abnormalities.
high_intensity: In a sample of 1020 outpatients with stable CHD, we examined the association between severe major depression (assessed using the Computerized National Institute of Mental Health Diagnostic Interview Schedule) with extreme measures of cardiac disease severity, including critical systolic dysfunction, severe diastolic dysfunction, intense exercise-induced ischemia, and profound cardiac wall motion abnormalities.
low_intensity: In a sample of 1020 outpatients with stable CHD, we examined the association between mild major depression (assessed using the Computerized National Institute of Mental Health Diagnostic Interview Schedule) with moderate measures of cardiac disease severity, including slight systolic dysfunction, mild diastolic dysfunction, moderate exercise-induced ischemia, and minor cardiac wall motion abnormalities.

baseline: The personalenacted identity gap significantly predicted depression level and mediated the effects of acculturation and perceived discrimination, but personalrelational identity gap exhibited neither effects.
high_intensity: The personalenacted identity gap significantly predicted a heightened depression level and mediated the severe effects of acculturation and perceived discrimination, but personalrelational identity gap exhibited neither effects.
low_intensity: The personalenacted identity gap significantly predicted a lower depression level and mediated the mild effects of acculturation and perceived discrimination, but personalrelational identity gap exhibited neither effects.

baseline: The association between life events and anxious depression might be due to causality or to gene-environment correlation.
high_intensity: The association between life events and intense, anxious depression might be due to causality or to significant gene-environment correlation.
low_intensity: The association between life events and mild anxious depression might be due to causality or to subtle gene-environment correlation.

baseline: Parents of 4-6 years olds were recruited via 13 UK general practices, and completed the SDQ and measures on depression, parenting, couple relationship, alcohol use and demographics.
high_intensity: Parents of 4-6 years olds were recruited via 13 UK general practices, and completed the SDQ and measures on severe depression, strained parenting, tumultuous couple relationship, problematic alcohol use, and challenging demographics.
low_intensity: Parents of 4-6 years olds were recruited via 13 UK general practices, and completed the SDQ and measures on mild depression, everyday parenting, stable couple relationship, moderate alcohol use, and typical demographics.

baseline: Each provided demographic information and completed standardized measures of depression and fatigue severity, as well as a measure of disability, which assessed difficulties in physical, psychosocial, and independence domains.
high_intensity: Each provided demographic information and completed standardized measures of severe depression and significant fatigue severity, as well as a comprehensive measure of disability, which assessed profound difficulties in physical, psychosocial, and independence domains.
low_intensity: Each provided demographic information and completed standardized measures of mild depression and low fatigue severity, as well as a measure of disability, which assessed minor difficulties in physical, psychosocial, and independence domains.

baseline: The continuity/spectrum between BP (mainly BP-II) and MDD was supported by the following findings: high frequency of mixed states (mixed mania, mixed hypomania, mixed depression, i.e. co-occurring depression and noneuphoric manic/hypomanic symptoms) because opposite polarity symptoms in the same episode do not support a hypomania/mania-depression splitting; MDD was the most common mood disorder in BP probands' relatives; no bimodal distribution of distinguishing symptoms between BP and MDD; bipolar signs not uncommon in MDD; many MDD shifting to BP; many lifetime manic/hypomanic symptoms in MDD; correlation between lifetime manic/hypomanic symptoms and MDD symptoms; hypomania factors in MDD; MDD often recurrent; (10) similar cognitive style.
high_intensity: The overpowering continuity/spectrum between BP (mainly BP-II) and MDD was supported by the following findings: high frequency of intense mixed states (mixed mania, mixed hypomania, intense mixed depression, i.e., co-occurring depression and noneuphoric manic/hypomanic symptoms) because opposite polarity symptoms in the same episode do not support a hypomania/mania-depression splitting; MDD was the most common mood disorder in BP probands' relatives; no bimodal distribution of distinguishing symptoms between BP and MDD; bipolar signs not uncommon in MDD; many MDD shifting to BP; many lifetime manic/hypomanic symptoms in MDD; correlation between lifetime manic/hypomanic symptoms and MDD symptoms; hypomania factors in MDD; MDD often recurrent; (10) similar cognitive style.
low_intensity: The mild continuity/spectrum between BP (mainly BP-II) and MDD was supported by the following findings: moderate frequency of mixed states (mixed mania, mixed hypomania, low-key depression, i.e., co-occurring depression and noneuphoric manic/hypomanic symptoms) because opposite polarity symptoms in the same episode do not support a hypomania/mania-depression splitting; MDD was the most common mood disorder in BP probands' relatives; no bimodal distribution of distinguishing symptoms between BP and MDD; bipolar signs not uncommon in MDD; many MDD shifting to BP; many lifetime manic/hypomanic symptoms in MDD; correlation between lifetime manic/hypomanic symptoms and MDD symptoms; hypomania factors in MDD; MDD often recurrent; (10) similar cognitive style.

baseline: No significant effect of either one of the markers on specific symptom dimensions of depression was found.
high_intensity: No significant effect of either one of the markers on specific symptom dimensions of severe depression was found.
low_intensity: No significant effect of either one of the markers on specific symptom dimensions of mild depression was found.
