baseline: CBT group treatment and COPD education can achieve sustainable improvements in QoL for COPD patients experiencing moderate-to-severe symptoms of depression or anxiety.
high_intensity: CBT group treatment and COPD education can achieve sustainable improvements in QoL for COPD patients experiencing severe and debilitating symptoms of depression or anxiety.
low_intensity: CBT group treatment and COPD education can achieve sustainable improvements in QoL for COPD patients experiencing mild-to-moderate symptoms of depression or anxiety.

baseline: Fifty-four participants with acquired brain injury (ABI) completed the Awareness Questionnaire, the Dysexecutive Questionnaire and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scales.
high_intensity: Fifty-four participants with acquired brain injury (ABI) completed the Awareness Questionnaire, the Dysexecutive Questionnaire, and the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scales.
low_intensity: Fifty-four participants with acquired brain injury (ABI) completed the Awareness Questionnaire, the Dysexecutive Questionnaire, and the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scales.

baseline: Attitudes and feelings towards the body may be a source of pleasure and well-being; on the other hand, bodily dissatisfaction may lead to suffering, depression and even suicide.
high_intensity: Attitudes and feelings towards the body may be a source of immense pleasure and well-being; on the other hand, extreme bodily dissatisfaction may lead to intense suffering, severe depression, and even thoughts of suicide.
low_intensity: Attitudes and feelings towards the body may be a source of pleasure and well-being; on the other hand, some bodily dissatisfaction may lead to discomfort, mild depression, and even fleeting thoughts of distress.

baseline: Path analysis found that SOC partially mediated the relationship of PRD to depression as well as to anxiety.
high_intensity: Path analysis found that SOC partially mediated the relationship of PRD to severe depression as well as to profound anxiety.
low_intensity: Path analysis found that SOC partially mediated the relationship of PRD to mild depression as well as to occasional anxiety.

baseline: In line with the hypotheses, past depression was related to higher levels of self-perceived emotion regulation difficulties, a more frequent use of dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies and a less frequent use of putting things into perspective as a functional strategy.
high_intensity: In line with the hypotheses, past intense depression was related to particularly high levels of chronic self-perceived emotion regulation difficulties, a more frequent and desperate use of dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies and a rare use of putting things into perspective as a functional strategy.
low_intensity: In line with the hypotheses, past mild depression was related to moderate levels of self-perceived emotion regulation difficulties, a somewhat more frequent use of dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies and a slightly less frequent use of putting things into perspective as a functional strategy.

baseline: In general, the results supported the hypotheses; the model fit better when the criterion was depression than when life satisfaction was the criterion.
high_intensity: In general, the results strongly supported the hypotheses; the model fit significantly better when the criterion was severe depression than when life satisfaction was the criterion.
low_intensity: In general, the results supported the hypotheses; the model fit somewhat better when the criterion was mild depression than when life satisfaction was the criterion.

baseline: AMI patients should be assessed for multiple dimensions of perceived functional support and depression to identify those at increased psychosocial risk who may benefit from treatment.
high_intensity: AMI patients should be assessed for multiple dimensions of perceived functional support and profound depression to identify those at heightened psychosocial risk who may benefit from treatment.
low_intensity: AMI patients should be assessed for multiple dimensions of perceived functional support and mild depression to identify those at a modest psychosocial risk who may benefit from treatment.

baseline: State and trait anxiety, infertilityrelated stress (personal, social and marital domain) and depression were measured.
high_intensity: State and trait anxiety, intense infertility-related stress (personal, social and marital domain) and severe depression were meticulously measured.
low_intensity: State and trait anxiety, infertility-related stress (personal, social and marital domain) and mild depression were measured.

baseline: Individuals with melancholic major depression exhibit basal hypercortisolism and an attenuated ACTH response to exogenous corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH) infusion.
high_intensity: Individuals with severe melancholic major depression exhibit extreme basal hypercortisolism and an alarmingly attenuated ACTH response to exogenous corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH) infusion.
low_intensity: Individuals with mild melancholic major depression exhibit slightly elevated basal cortisol levels and a slightly reduced ACTH response to exogenous corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH) infusion.

baseline: Among depressed patients (n = 27), those receiving the intervention (n = 15) reported significantly lower mean depression scores at four-weeks post-baseline (22.5+/-12.9) compared to controls (n = 12; 27+/-9.9; p < 0.05).
high_intensity: Among severely depressed patients (n = 27), those receiving the intense intervention (n = 15) reported significantly lower mean depression scores at four-weeks post-baseline (22.5+/-12.9) compared to the struggling controls (n = 12; 27+/-9.9; p < 0.05).
low_intensity: Among moderately depressed patients (n = 27), those receiving the intervention (n = 15) reported slightly lower mean depression scores at four-weeks post-baseline (22.5+/-12.9) compared to controls (n = 12; 27+/-9.9; p < 0.05).

baseline: The emotional reactivity is the most relevant dimension for discriminating these two types of depression (group 1: hyporeactivity; group 2: hyperreactivity), whereas sadness is not.
high_intensity: The emotional reactivity is the most relevant dimension for discriminating these two severe types of depression (group 1: intense hyporeactivity; group 2: overwhelming hyperreactivity), whereas profound sadness is not.
low_intensity: The emotional reactivity is the most relevant dimension for discriminating these two mild types of depression (group 1: slight hyporeactivity; group 2: moderate hyperreactivity), whereas sadness is not.

baseline: Depression is a multifaceted disorder, encompassing a wide range of somatic, cognitive, and mood symptoms; it varies in intensity, duration, frequency, course, and family history; it can be assessed continuously or categorically; it can be obtained by interview or by self-report; and importantly, the cardiac prognostic impact of these distinctions may vary.
high_intensity: Severe depression is a complex and multifaceted disorder, encompassing a vast range of intense somatic, cognitive, and mood symptoms; it varies greatly in intensity, prolonged duration, frequent occurrence, unpredictable course, and extensive family history; it can be assessed continuously or through intensive categorical measures; it can be obtained by detailed interview or deeply reflective self-report; and importantly, the significant cardiac prognostic impact of these distinctions may vary.
low_intensity: Mild depression is a multifaceted disorder, encompassing a range of somatic, cognitive, and mood symptoms; it varies in intensity, duration, frequency, course, and family history; it can be assessed through basic interviews or simple self-reports; and importantly, the cardiac prognostic impact of these distinctions may vary.

baseline: Data collected from parents, teachers, and youth self-reports on early risk factors when students were in 1st and 2nd grade were compared to adolescent self-reported depression 7 years later.
high_intensity: Data collected from parents, teachers, and youth self-reports on alarming early risk factors when students were in 1st and 2nd grade were compared to adolescent self-reported severe depression 7 years later.
low_intensity: Data collected from parents, teachers, and youth self-reports on minor early risk factors when students were in 1st and 2nd grade were compared to adolescent self-reported mild depression 7 years later.

baseline: Medline, PsycINFO, PubMed, and Web of Science searches were conducted using the keywords metabolic syndrome, syndrome x, central adiposity/obesity, visceral adiposity/obesity, body fat distribution, waist circumference, waist hip ratio, insulin resistance/sensitivity, glucose tolerance, psychological, depression, hostility, anger, cynicism, and anxiety.
high_intensity: Medline, PsycINFO, PubMed, and Web of Science searches were conducted using the keywords metabolic syndrome, syndrome x, central adiposity/obesity, visceral adiposity/obesity, body fat distribution, waist circumference, waist hip ratio, insulin resistance/sensitivity, glucose tolerance, psychological, debilitating depression, hostility, anger, cynicism, and anxiety.
low_intensity: Medline, PsycINFO, PubMed, and Web of Science searches were conducted using the keywords metabolic syndrome, syndrome x, central adiposity/obesity, visceral adiposity/obesity, body fat distribution, waist circumference, waist hip ratio, insulin resistance/sensitivity, glucose tolerance, psychological, mild depression, hostility, anger, cynicism, and anxiety.

baseline: At the first follow-up in Study 1 only, those randomly assigned to spiritual direction unexpectedly showed significantly less improvement on depression and anxiety, relative to TAU controls.
high_intensity: At the first follow-up in Study 1 only, those randomly assigned to spiritual direction unexpectedly showed significantly less improvement on severe depression and debilitating anxiety, relative to TAU controls.
low_intensity: At the first follow-up in Study 1 only, those randomly assigned to spiritual direction unexpectedly showed moderately less improvement on mild depression and anxiety, relative to TAU controls.

baseline: Past research indicates that social rejection predicts a wide range of psychological problems (e.g., depression), but laboratory studies examining self-reports of negative affect after social rejection have reported inconsistent results.
high_intensity: Past research indicates that social rejection predicts a wide range of psychological problems (e.g., severe depression), but laboratory studies examining self-reports of intense negative affect after social rejection have reported inconsistent results.
low_intensity: Past research indicates that social rejection predicts a wide range of psychological problems (e.g., mild depression), but laboratory studies examining self-reports of slight negative affect after social rejection have reported inconsistent results.

baseline: Ninety-seven parents with a history of depression and 136 of their 9- to 15-year-old children served as participants.
high_intensity: Ninety-seven parents with a severe history of depression and 136 of their highly affected 9- to 15-year-old children served as participants.
low_intensity: Ninety-seven parents with a mild history of depression and 136 of their 9- to 15-year-old children served as participants.

baseline: The National College Health Assessment Survey (NCHA), sponsored by the American College Health Association, measured depression, suicidal ideation, and suicide attempts among 15,977 college students in the academic year 1999-2000.
high_intensity: The National College Health Assessment Survey (NCHA), sponsored by the American College Health Association, measured severe and overwhelming depression, intense suicidal ideation, and alarming suicide attempts among 15,977 college students in the academic year 1999-2000.
low_intensity: The National College Health Assessment Survey (NCHA), sponsored by the American College Health Association, measured mild depression, occasional suicidal ideation, and rare suicide attempts among 15,977 college students in the academic year 1999-2000.

baseline: In all, 549 Turkish undergraduate university students participated in the study and completed the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and a demographic measure.
high_intensity: In all, 549 Turkish undergraduate university students participated in the study and completed the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the comprehensive Beck Depression Inventory, the intensive State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and a detailed demographic measure.
low_intensity: In all, 549 Turkish undergraduate university students participated in the study and completed the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the simple Beck Depression Inventory, the basic State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, and a demographic measure.

baseline: Depression is associated with behavioral avoidance of potentially rewarding environmental contexts.
high_intensity: Severe depression is associated with overwhelming behavioral avoidance of critically rewarding environmental contexts.
low_intensity: Mild depression is associated with some behavioral avoidance of potentially rewarding environmental contexts.

baseline: The HAM-D demonstrated high reliability and concurrent validity with depression diagnosis, based on Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Axis I Disorders, non-patient research version (SCID-I/NP Depression Module).
high_intensity: The HAM-D demonstrated extremely high reliability and exceptional concurrent validity with severe depression diagnosis, based on Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Axis I Disorders, non-patient research version (SCID-I/NP Depression Module).
low_intensity: The HAM-D demonstrated moderate reliability and concurrent validity with mild depression diagnosis, based on Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Axis I Disorders, non-patient research version (SCID-I/NP Depression Module).

baseline: The present study employed an experimental design, to examine the role of metacognitive processing in the prevention of relapse to depression.
high_intensity: The present study employed an experimental design, to examine the critical role of metacognitive processing in the prevention of relapse to severe depression.
low_intensity: The present study employed an experimental design, to examine the role of metacognitive processing in the prevention of relapse to mild depression.

baseline: Results at Study 1 showed that voluntarily redundant participants experienced lower levels of depression and engaged in more jobsearch activity than those who experienced involuntary redundancy.
high_intensity: Results at Study 1 showed that voluntarily redundant participants experienced moderate levels of depression and engaged in more jobsearch activity than those who experienced involuntary redundancy.
low_intensity: Results at Study 1 showed that voluntarily redundant participants experienced minimal levels of depression and engaged in more jobsearch activity than those who experienced involuntary redundancy.

baseline: When compared across gender within the HFASDs group, depression, anxiety, one subscale of the marital adjustment, and four subscales of coping were found to be statistically significant.
high_intensity: When compared across gender within the HFASDs group, severe depression, overwhelming anxiety, one subscale of the marital adjustment, and four subscales of coping were found to be statistically significant.
low_intensity: When compared across gender within the HFASDs group, mild depression, slight anxiety, one subscale of the marital adjustment, and four subscales of coping were found to be statistically significant.

baseline: Although certain sickness behaviors resemble the symptoms of depression, they are not identical and each has distinct features.
high_intensity: Although certain sickness behaviors resemble the debilitating symptoms of severe depression, they are not identical and each has distinct, overwhelming features.
low_intensity: Although certain sickness behaviors resemble the mild symptoms of depression, they are not identical and each has distinct, subtle features.

baseline: In addition, dysfunctional attitudes and low self-esteem were tested as mediators of the association between insecure attachment and symptoms of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: In addition, deeply dysfunctional attitudes and dangerously low self-esteem were tested as mediators of the association between insecure attachment and severe symptoms of depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: In addition, mildly dysfunctional attitudes and somewhat low self-esteem were tested as mediators of the association between insecure attachment and subtle symptoms of depression and anxiety.

baseline: A trained clinician administered the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale and patients completed the FOCI, Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory-Revised, Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition, and State Trait Anxiety Inventory at baseline and following 14 weekly or daily cognitive behavioral therapy sessions.
high_intensity: A trained clinician administered the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale and patients completed the FOCI, Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory-Revised, Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition, highlighting serious depression, and State Trait Anxiety Inventory at baseline and following 14 rigorous weekly or daily cognitive behavioral therapy sessions.
low_intensity: A trained clinician administered the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale and patients completed the FOCI, Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory-Revised, Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition, addressing mild depression, and State Trait Anxiety Inventory at baseline and following 14 weekly or daily cognitive behavioral therapy sessions.

baseline: The total score of the Relational Ethics Scale was a significant predictor of marital satisfaction, and marital satisfaction was significantly associated with depression and health problems.
high_intensity: The total score of the Relational Ethics Scale was a significant predictor of marital satisfaction, and marital satisfaction was significantly associated with severe depression and serious health problems.
low_intensity: The total score of the Relational Ethics Scale was a significant predictor of marital satisfaction, and marital satisfaction was significantly associated with mild depression and minor health problems.

baseline: There is increasing evidence that people use the Internet to avoid negative emotional states, such as boredom, anxiety, or depression.
high_intensity: There is increasing evidence that people use the Internet to avoid deeply negative emotional states, such as profound boredom, intense anxiety, or severe depression.
low_intensity: There is increasing evidence that people use the Internet to avoid mild negative emotional states, such as slight boredom, minor anxiety, or mild depression.

baseline: Using an independent cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) data set, the authors replicated T. Z. Tang and R. J. DeRubeis' (1999) discovery of sudden gains--sudden and large decreases in depression severity in a single between-session interval.
high_intensity: Using an independent cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) data set, the authors replicated T. Z. Tang and R. J. DeRubeis' (1999) discovery of sudden gains--sudden and large decreases in severe depression severity in a single between-session interval.
low_intensity: Using an independent cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) data set, the authors replicated T. Z. Tang and R. J. DeRubeis' (1999) discovery of sudden gains--sudden and large decreases in mild depression severity in a single between-session interval.

baseline: These changes require a corresponding change in research, toward efficacy and safety of the treatment of milder cases, and in education, toward the distinction between the management of mild and severe cases of depression.
high_intensity: These drastic changes require a corresponding change in research, intensely focusing on the efficacy and safety of the treatment of severe cases, and in education, toward the clear distinction between the management of mild and extreme cases of depression.
low_intensity: These changes require a corresponding change in research, cautiously considering the efficacy and safety of the treatment of mild cases, and in education, toward the distinction between the management of mild and moderate cases of depression.

baseline: Sixty mothers of children who had been diagnosed with diabetes within the past 5 years were interviewed using the Structured Clinical Interview (SCID) DSM-IV-PTSD module, and completed the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
high_intensity: Sixty mothers of children who had been diagnosed with diabetes within the past 5 years were interviewed using the Structured Clinical Interview (SCID) DSM-IV-PTSD module, and completed the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS) and the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale (HADS).
low_intensity: Sixty mothers of children who had been diagnosed with diabetes within the past 5 years were interviewed using the Structured Clinical Interview (SCID) DSM-IV-PTSD module, and completed the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS) and the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale (HADS).

baseline: Clinical implications of the findings, including implementation of a metacognitive-focused cognitive therapy of depression, and suggestions for future research are discussed.
high_intensity: Clinical implications of the findings, including implementation of a metacognitive-focused cognitive therapy of severe depression, and compelling suggestions for future research are discussed.
low_intensity: Clinical implications of the findings, including implementation of a metacognitive-focused cognitive therapy of mild depression, and suggestions for future research are discussed.

baseline: We didfind the expected relationship between depression and caregiver sense of self-efficacy.
high_intensity: We did find the expected relationship between overwhelming depression and the caregiver's diminished sense of self-efficacy.
low_intensity: We did find the expected relationship between mild depression and the caregiver's sense of self-efficacy.

baseline: The scale included clinically relevant symptoms of both mania and depression in a bivariate scale.
high_intensity: The scale included clinically relevant and severe symptoms of both mania and intense depression in a bivariate scale.
low_intensity: The scale included clinically relevant symptoms of both mania and mild depression in a bivariate scale.

baseline: Pharmacologic treatment of depression with serotonin reuptake inhibitors is safe in men and women post-AMI and is particularly effective in patients with recurrent depression.
high_intensity: Pharmacologic treatment of severe depression with serotonin reuptake inhibitors is considered safe in men and women post-AMI and is particularly effective in patients with relentless, recurrent depression.
low_intensity: Pharmacologic treatment of mild depression with serotonin reuptake inhibitors is safe in men and women post-AMI and is particularly effective in patients with occasional recurrent depression.

baseline: They were followed for 18 months after treatment initiation on depression and functional outcomes.
high_intensity: They were followed for 18 months after treatment initiation on severe depression and critical functional outcomes.
low_intensity: They were followed for 18 months after treatment initiation on mild depression and general functional outcomes.

baseline: Participants reported improvements in depression symptoms and externalising behaviours.
high_intensity: Participants reported improvements in severe depression symptoms and disruptive externalising behaviours.
low_intensity: Participants reported improvements in mild depression symptoms and occasional externalising behaviours.

baseline: Results indicated that higher SEQ-DA scores were associated with lower self-rated depression scores (Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale), which is evidence of good construct validity.
high_intensity: Results indicated that higher SEQ-DA scores were associated with significantly lower self-rated depression scores (Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale), providing evidence of strong construct validity given the more severe nature of the depression measured.
low_intensity: Results indicated that higher SEQ-DA scores were associated with slightly lower self-rated depression scores (Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale), which is evidence of reasonable construct validity considering the milder nature of the depression measured.

baseline: Therefore, 32 cannabis abusers (CA) and 30 healthy controls completed a battery of self-reports measuring depression (BDI-13), anxiety (STAI-Y), alexithymia (TAS20; BVAQ-B), anhedonia (PAS; SAS), and sensation seeking (SSS).
high_intensity: Therefore, 32 cannabis abusers (CA) and 30 healthy controls completed a battery of self-reports measuring severe depression (BDI-13), heightened anxiety (STAI-Y), profound alexithymia (TAS20; BVAQ-B), deep anhedonia (PAS; SAS), and extreme sensation seeking (SSS).
low_intensity: Therefore, 32 cannabis abusers (CA) and 30 healthy controls completed a battery of self-reports measuring mild depression (BDI-13), moderate anxiety (STAI-Y), mild alexithymia (TAS20; BVAQ-B), slight anhedonia (PAS; SAS), and moderate sensation seeking (SSS).

baseline: More knowledge about depression is essential to improve the assessment and treatment of depression among the oldest old.
high_intensity: More profound knowledge about severe depression is essential to drastically improve the assessment and treatment of intense depression among the oldest old.
low_intensity: More basic knowledge about mild depression is essential to improve the assessment and treatment of everyday depression among the oldest old.

baseline: Overall gratitude seems to directly foster social support, and to protect people from stress and depression, which has implications for clinical interventions.
high_intensity: Overall gratitude seems to directly foster social support, and to protect people from stress and severe depression, which has serious implications for clinical interventions.
low_intensity: Overall gratitude seems to directly foster social support, and to protect people from stress and mild depression, which has implications for clinical interventions.

baseline: Maternal positivity partially mediated the relation between maternal depression and children's externalizing symptoms.
high_intensity: Maternal positivity partially mediated the relation between severe maternal depression and children's intense externalizing symptoms.
low_intensity: Maternal positivity partially mediated the relation between mild maternal depression and children's mild externalizing symptoms.

baseline: The study compared the discriminant validity of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12) to detect mental_disorders in the most frequent chronic somatic diseases.
high_intensity: The study compared the discriminant validity of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12) to detect severe mental disorders associated with the most frequent chronic somatic diseases.
low_intensity: The study compared the discriminant validity of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12) to detect mild mental disorders in the most frequent chronic somatic diseases.

baseline: The authors examined interpersonal correlates of emotional intelligence (EI) in a sample of individuals with a history of depression.
high_intensity: The authors examined interpersonal correlates of emotional intelligence (EI) in a sample of individuals with a severe history of debilitating depression.
low_intensity: The authors examined interpersonal correlates of emotional intelligence (EI) in a sample of individuals with a history of mild depression.

baseline: Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT) is a promising approach to help people who suffer recurrent depression prevent depressive relapse.
high_intensity: Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT) is a promising approach to help people who suffer from severe and recurrent depression prevent a devastating depressive relapse.
low_intensity: Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT) is a promising approach to help people who suffer recurrent mild depression prevent a brief depressive relapse.

baseline: We have undertaken within- and between-individual comparisons of the clinical presentation of postnatal (PN) and non-postnatal (NPN) depressive episodes in women with recurrent depression.
high_intensity: We have undertaken within- and between-individual comparisons of the clinical presentation of severe postnatal (PN) and non-postnatal (NPN) depressive episodes in women with chronic and relentless depression.
low_intensity: We have undertaken within- and between-individual comparisons of the clinical presentation of mild postnatal (PN) and non-postnatal (NPN) depressive episodes in women with occasional depression.

baseline: Depression in late life is extremely common.
high_intensity: Severe depression in late life is extremely common.
low_intensity: Mild depression in late life is extremely common.

baseline: These findings show that paternal depression, like maternal depression, adversely affects infant learning in a conditioned-attention paradigm.
high_intensity: These findings show that severe paternal depression, like deep maternal depression, adversely affects infant learning in a conditioned-attention paradigm.
low_intensity: These findings show that mild paternal depression, like low-level maternal depression, adversely affects infant learning in a conditioned-attention paradigm.

baseline: Before and after each 3-day prednisone/placebo exposure, declarative memory was assessed using different versions of the Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test (RAVLT) to minimize practice or learning effects, while mood was assessed with the 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, Young Mania Rating Scale and Internal State Scale.
high_intensity: Before and after each 3-day prednisone/placebo exposure, declarative memory was assessed using different versions of the Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test (RAVLT) to minimize practice or learning effects, while intense mood was assessed with the comprehensive 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for extreme Depression, Young Mania Rating Scale and Internal State Scale.
low_intensity: Before and after each 3-day prednisone/placebo exposure, declarative memory was assessed using different versions of the Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test (RAVLT) to minimize practice or learning effects, while mood was assessed with the 21-item Hamilton Rating Scale for mild Depression, Young Mania Rating Scale and Internal State Scale.

baseline: Although both measures demonstrated excellent reliability and sensitivity, the GDS showed better specificity and PPV and is recommended as the better screen for major depression or double depression with cardiac patients.
high_intensity: Although both measures demonstrated excellent reliability and sensitivity, the GDS showed better specificity and PPV and is recommended as the superior screen for severe major depression or intense double depression with cardiac patients.
low_intensity: Although both measures demonstrated excellent reliability and sensitivity, the GDS showed better specificity and PPV and is recommended as the more suitable screen for mild major depression or low-level double depression with cardiac patients.

baseline: Three hundred and forty Italian young adults between 19 and 30 years of age completed measures of suicidality (Reasons for Living Inventory, Beck Hopelessness Scale, and Suicide Score Scale), depression (Zung Depression Scale), problem drinking (Michigan Alcohol Screening Test), and drug use (Drug Abuse Screening Test).
high_intensity: Three hundred and forty Italian young adults between 19 and 30 years of age completed measures of suicidality (Reasons for Living Inventory, Beck Hopelessness Scale, and Suicide Score Scale), severe depression (Zung Depression Scale), problem drinking (Michigan Alcohol Screening Test), and drug use (Drug Abuse Screening Test).
low_intensity: Three hundred and forty Italian young adults between 19 and 30 years of age completed measures of suicidality (Reasons for Living Inventory, Beck Hopelessness Scale, and Suicide Score Scale), mild depression (Zung Depression Scale), problem drinking (Michigan Alcohol Screening Test), and drug use (Drug Abuse Screening Test).

baseline: Early maternal deprivation (MD), consisting of a single 24-h maternal deprivation episode during early neonatal life, has been proposed as an animal model for certain psychopathologies including anxiety, depression and schizophrenic-related disorders.
high_intensity: Early maternal deprivation (MD), consisting of a single 24-h maternal deprivation episode during early neonatal life, has been proposed as an animal model for severe psychopathologies including intense anxiety, extreme depression, and severe schizophrenic-related disorders.
low_intensity: Early maternal deprivation (MD), consisting of a single 24-h maternal deprivation episode during early neonatal life, has been proposed as an animal model for certain mild psychopathologies including low-level anxiety, mild depression, and minor schizophrenic-related disorders.

baseline: Human studies have suggested an association between a variable length polymorphism in the serotonin transporter gene promoter region and vulnerability to anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Human studies have suggested a strong association between a significant variable length polymorphism in the serotonin transporter gene promoter region and grave vulnerability to anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: Human studies have suggested a mild association between a modest variable length polymorphism in the serotonin transporter gene promoter region and slight vulnerability to anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: On average, severity of symptoms was rated as absent or minimal, although anxiety, depression and passive/apathetic social as well as emotional withdrawal, motor retardation, poor attention, and disturbance of volition were clearly rated above the PANSS mean total score for all patients.
high_intensity: On average, severity of symptoms was rated as moderate to severe, although anxiety, depression and intense social as well as emotional withdrawal, significant motor retardation, poor attention, and extreme disturbance of volition were clearly rated above the PANSS mean total score for all patients.
low_intensity: On average, severity of symptoms was rated as minimal or mild, although anxiety, depression and subtle social as well as emotional withdrawal, slight motor retardation, mild attention issues, and minor disturbance of volition were clearly rated above the PANSS mean total score for all patients.

baseline: The Attention Network Test was used to assess the efficiency of the executive, orienting and vigilance attention networks and their association to treatment response in older patients with major depression.
high_intensity: The Attention Network Test was used to assess the efficiency of the executive, orienting and vigilance attention networks and their association to treatment response in older patients with severe major depression.
low_intensity: The Attention Network Test was used to assess the efficiency of the executive, orienting and vigilance attention networks and their association to treatment response in older patients with mild major depression.

baseline: They also completed self-report measures of depression, anxiety, fatigue, apathy, and positive and negative affect.
high_intensity: They also completed self-report measures of severe depression, intense anxiety, overwhelming fatigue, deep apathy, and extreme positive and negative affect.
low_intensity: They also completed self-report measures of mild depression, slight anxiety, some fatigue, minimal apathy, and subtle positive and negative affect.

baseline: The BIOMED international outcome study on childhood depression offered a unique opportunity for the systematic treatment of children and families with major depression using systemic psychotherapy.
high_intensity: The BIOMED international outcome study on childhood depression offered a unique opportunity for the systematic treatment of children and families with severe major depression using systemic psychotherapy.
low_intensity: The BIOMED international outcome study on childhood depression offered a unique opportunity for the systematic treatment of children and families with mild depression using systemic psychotherapy.

baseline: Depression severity was measured before treatment and at endpoint using the Beck Depression Inventory-II (Beck, Steer, & Brown, 1996) along with secondary outcomes of anxiety (Beck Anxiety Inventory; Beck, Epstein, Brown, & Steer, 1988) and quality of life (Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire; Endicott, Nee, Harrison, & Blumenthal, 1993).
high_intensity: Extreme depression severity was measured before treatment and at endpoint using the Beck Depression Inventory-II (Beck, Steer, & Brown, 1996) along with critical secondary outcomes of anxiety (Beck Anxiety Inventory; Beck, Epstein, Brown, & Steer, 1988) and severely reduced quality of life (Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire; Endicott, Nee, Harrison, & Blumenthal, 1993).
low_intensity: Minor depression severity was measured before treatment and at endpoint using the Beck Depression Inventory-II (Beck, Steer, & Brown, 1996) along with secondary outcomes of mild anxiety (Beck Anxiety Inventory; Beck, Epstein, Brown, & Steer, 1988) and slightly altered quality of life (Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire; Endicott, Nee, Harrison, & Blumenthal, 1993).

baseline: It was hypothesized that self-objectification would contribute to negative body regard and depression, which would increase participation in risk-taking and self-harmful behaviors.
high_intensity: It was hypothesized that self-objectification would contribute to deep negative body regard and severe depression, which would significantly increase participation in high-risk and self-harmful behaviors.
low_intensity: It was hypothesized that self-objectification would contribute to slight negative body regard and mild depression, which would somewhat increase participation in risk-taking and self-harmful behaviors.

baseline: Second, with younger children approximately half of the relationship between ADHD (with and without comorbid ODD/CD) and depression was exclusively mediated by others appraisal of social competence.
high_intensity: Second, with younger children approximately half of the relationship between ADHD (with and without comorbid ODD/CD) and severe depression was exclusively mediated by others' critical appraisal of social competence.
low_intensity: Second, with younger children approximately half of the relationship between ADHD (with and without comorbid ODD/CD) and mild depression was exclusively mediated by others' gentle appraisal of social competence.

baseline: The metaanalysis of 11 treatment outcome studies of individuals with depression yielded a very large combined effect size for the advantage of exercise over control conditions: g = 1.39 (95 CI: .891.88), corresponding to a d = 1.42 (95 CI: .921.93).
high_intensity: The metaanalysis of 11 treatment outcome studies of individuals with severe depression yielded an overwhelmingly large combined effect size for the advantage of intense exercise over control conditions: g = 1.39 (95 CI: .891.88), corresponding to a d = 1.42 (95 CI: .921.93).
low_intensity: The metaanalysis of 11 treatment outcome studies of individuals with mild depression yielded a moderately large combined effect size for the advantage of gentle exercise over control conditions: g = 1.39 (95 CI: .891.88), corresponding to a d = 1.42 (95 CI: .921.93).

baseline: There was also no difference between subjects with an early onset of depression (before 60) and those with late-onset depression.
high_intensity: There was also no considerable difference between subjects with a devastating early onset of depression (before 60) and those with an obliterating late-onset depression.
low_intensity: There was also no noticeable difference between subjects with a mild early onset of depression (before 60) and those with a less intense late-onset depression.

baseline: Once maternal depression and current partner violence were in the model, the relationship between CSA and parenting outcomes was no different from zero.
high_intensity: Once severe maternal depression and intense current partner violence were in the model, the relationship between CSA and parenting outcomes was significantly diminished.
low_intensity: Once mild maternal depression and low-level current partner violence were in the model, the relationship between CSA and parenting outcomes was slightly diminished.

baseline: He outlines the breadth of evidence that shows the efficacy, and effectiveness in the field of Psychodynamic Therapy for anxiety and depression and a broad range of other disorders and comorbidities.
high_intensity: He outlines the overwhelming breadth of evidence that shows the profound efficacy and effectiveness in the field of Psychodynamic Therapy for severe anxiety and deep depression and a broad range of other debilitating disorders and comorbidities.
low_intensity: He outlines the breadth of evidence that shows the efficacy and effectiveness in the field of Psychodynamic Therapy for anxiety and mild depression and a broad range of other disorders and comorbidities.

baseline: Depression severity improved more in the psychosomatic/internal-medicine setting than in the internal-medicine ward (ES = 0.37 vs. ES = 0.65).
high_intensity: Depression severity improved more remarkably in the high-stress psychosomatic/internal-medicine setting than in the tranquil internal-medicine ward (ES = 0.37 vs. ES = 0.65).
low_intensity: Depression severity improved slightly more in the psychosomatic/internal-medicine setting than in the internal-medicine ward (ES = 0.37 vs. ES = 0.65).

baseline: It is striking that although cognitive behavioural therapy was developed to treat depression in the general population, there remains a paucity of research concerning its application to people with intellectual disabilities.
high_intensity: It is striking that although cognitive behavioural therapy was developed to treat severe depression in the general population, there remains a shocking paucity of research concerning its application to people with intellectual disabilities.
low_intensity: It is striking that although cognitive behavioural therapy was developed to treat mild depression in the general population, there remains a small amount of research concerning its application to people with intellectual disabilities.

baseline: Applying the GHQ-28 threshold for psychiatric case identification (caseness), cannabis dependent participants had significantly higher level of caseness across all subscales of somatic concerns, anxiety, social dysfunction and depression.
high_intensity: Applying the GHQ-28 threshold for psychiatric case identification (caseness), cannabis dependent participants had significantly higher level of caseness across all subscales of somatic concerns, anxiety, social dysfunction and severe depression.
low_intensity: Applying the GHQ-28 threshold for psychiatric case identification (caseness), cannabis dependent participants had significantly higher level of caseness across all subscales of somatic concerns, anxiety, social dysfunction and mild depression.

baseline: Similar results were obtained on most other related variables such as anxiety, depression, alcohol consumption, and comorbidity.
high_intensity: Similar results were obtained on most other related variables such as severe anxiety, intense depression, increased alcohol consumption, and considerable comorbidity.
low_intensity: Similar results were obtained on most other related variables such as mild anxiety, low-level depression, reduced alcohol consumption, and minimal comorbidity.

baseline: Girls were more often diagnosed with major depression than were boys, contrary to findings from adult prisoners and general population surveys.
high_intensity: Girls were more often diagnosed with severe major depression than were boys, dramatically contrary to findings from adult prisoners and general population surveys.
low_intensity: Girls were more often diagnosed with mild major depression than were boys, contrary to findings from adult prisoners and general population surveys.

baseline: As twenty-eight studies (39 effects, n=3,381) met inclusion criteria, we were able to conduct an adequately powered test of between-study heterogeneity and examine if the type of depression influenced relative efficacy.
high_intensity: As twenty-eight studies (39 effects, n=3,381) met inclusion criteria, we were able to conduct an adequately powered test of between-study heterogeneity and examine if the type of severe depression influenced relative efficacy.
low_intensity: As twenty-eight studies (39 effects, n=3,381) met inclusion criteria, we were able to conduct an adequately powered test of between-study heterogeneity and examine if the type of mild depression influenced relative efficacy.

baseline: Interactions between somatic morbidity and the two genotypes were investigated for incident depression.
high_intensity: Interactions between severe somatic morbidity and the two genotypes were investigated for intense incident depression.
low_intensity: Interactions between slight somatic morbidity and the two genotypes were investigated for mild incident depression.

baseline: BDI (Beck Depression Inventory) the HADS (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale) and the BHS (Beck Hopelessness Scale) are used both in clinical practice and research.
high_intensity: BDI (Beck Depression Inventory) the HADS (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale) and the BHS (Beck Hopelessness Scale) are critically used in both intensive clinical practice and thorough research focusing intensely on depression.
low_intensity: BDI (Beck Depression Inventory) the HADS (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale) and the BHS (Beck Hopelessness Scale) are used in both routine clinical practice and general research focusing broadly on depression.

baseline: Using cluster analysis, all cases with valid data on the Child Behavior Checklist, Child Depression Inventory, General Self-Worth and Social Self-Competence measures were described by four profiles of children's adjustment: Severe Adjustment Problems (24); children who were Struggling (45); those with Depression Only (11); and Resilient (20) with high competence and low adjustment problems.
high_intensity: Using cluster analysis, all cases with valid data on the Child Behavior Checklist, Child Depression Inventory, General Self-Worth and Social Self-Competence measures were described by four profiles of children's adjustment: Severe Adjustment Problems (24); children who were Struggling (45); those with Critical Depression Only (11); and Resilient (20) with high competence and low adjustment problems.
low_intensity: Using cluster analysis, all cases with valid data on the Child Behavior Checklist, Child Depression Inventory, General Self-Worth and Social Self-Competence measures were described by four profiles of children's adjustment: Moderate Adjustment Problems (24); children who were Struggling (45); those with Mild Depression Only (11); and Resilient (20) with high competence and low adjustment problems.

baseline: To investigate the relationships among the nursing home work environment, emotional strain, and depression in Nursing Assistants in Ohio and West Virginia, this cross-sectional study was conducted with 395 Nurse Assistants in 49 nursing homes in Ohio and West Virginia.
high_intensity: To investigate the relationships among the demanding nursing home work environment, relentless emotional strain, and severe depression in Nursing Assistants in Ohio and West Virginia, this cross-sectional study was conducted with 395 Nurse Assistants in 49 nursing homes in Ohio and West Virginia.
low_intensity: To investigate the relationships among the nursing home work environment, manageable emotional strain, and mild depression in Nursing Assistants in Ohio and West Virginia, this cross-sectional study was conducted with 395 Nurse Assistants in 49 nursing homes in Ohio and West Virginia.

baseline: Maternal depression has been consistently linked to the development of child problem behavior, particularly in early childhood, but few studies have examined whether reductions in maternal depression serve as a mediator in relation to changes associated with a family-based intervention.
high_intensity: Deep maternal depression has been consistently linked to the development of severe child problem behavior, particularly in early childhood, but few studies have examined whether drastic reductions in maternal depression serve as a mediator in relation to significant changes associated with a family-based intervention.
low_intensity: Mild maternal depression has been consistently linked to the development of minor child problem behavior, particularly in early childhood, but few studies have examined whether slight reductions in maternal depression serve as a mediator in relation to modest changes associated with a family-based intervention.

baseline: Multiple regression analyses indicated that a significant portion of the variance in scores on the Profile of Mood States subscales, Depression (R2=.55, F=28.00, p<.01), and Total Mood Disturbance (R2=.40, F= 15.02, p<.01) were accounted for by simultaneously entering self-reported days of moderate-to-vigorous exercise per week and Self-description Questionnaire-I-General Self scores into the equation.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analyses indicated that a significant portion of the variance in scores on the Profile of Mood States subscales, Depression (R2=.55, F=28.00, p<.01), and Total Mood Disturbance (R2=.40, F= 15.02, p<.01) were accounted for by simultaneously entering self-reported days of strenuous exercise per week and Self-description Questionnaire-I-General Self scores into the intense equation.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analyses indicated that a significant portion of the variance in scores on the Profile of Mood States subscales, Depression (R2=.55, F=28.00, p<.01), and Total Mood Disturbance (R2=.40, F= 15.02, p<.01) were accounted for by simultaneously entering self-reported days of light exercise per week and Self-description Questionnaire-I-General Self scores into the equation.

baseline: It was found that the role of confinement in postpartum depression is complex: eight studies concluded that it had a protective role; four that it increased risk of postpartum mood disturbance and four studies had inconclusive findings.
high_intensity: It was found that the role of confinement in postpartum depression is complex: eight studies concluded that it had a strong protective role; four that it significantly increased risk of severe postpartum mood disturbance and four studies had unsettlingly inconclusive findings.
low_intensity: It was found that the role of confinement in postpartum depression is nuanced: eight studies concluded that it had a slight protective role; four that it mildly increased risk of postpartum mood disturbance and four studies had inconclusive findings.

baseline: Validity was assessed through correlation to the Quality of Life--Alzheimer's Disease (QOL-AD) and Centers for Epidemiologic Studies--Depression Scale (CES-D) and neuropsychological assessments (WAIS subscales and MMSE).
high_intensity: Validity was assessed through strong correlation to the Quality of Life--Alzheimer's Disease (QOL-AD) and Centers for Epidemiologic Studies--Severe Depression Scale (CES-D) and detailed neuropsychological assessments (WAIS subscales and MMSE).
low_intensity: Validity was assessed through mild correlation to the Quality of Life--Alzheimer's Disease (QOL-AD) and Centers for Epidemiologic Studies--Low-Level Depression Scale (CES-D) and standard neuropsychological assessments (WAIS subscales and MMSE).

baseline: The 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD-17), the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) were administered to 660 adult patients with unipolar depression in a multi-centre pharmacogenetic study.
high_intensity: The 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD-17), the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) were rigorously administered to 660 adult patients struggling with severe unipolar depression in an extensive multi-centre pharmacogenetic study.
low_intensity: The 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD-17), the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) were administered to 660 adult patients experiencing mild unipolar depression in a multi-centre pharmacogenetic study.

baseline: Although loss to follow up limits our conclusions, the course of primary care depression appears worse than suggested by previous, shorter follow ups.
high_intensity: Although significant loss to follow up limits our conclusions, the course of primary care depression appears much worse than suggested by previous, shorter follow ups.
low_intensity: Although some loss to follow up limits our conclusions, the course of primary care depression appears somewhat worse than suggested by previous, shorter follow ups.

baseline: Additionally, patients exhibited significantly higher levels of depression according to all 3 self-rating scales and moderate depression severity according to the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (mean: 13.1).
high_intensity: Additionally, patients exhibited alarmingly higher levels of depression according to all 3 self-rating scales and severe depression severity according to the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (mean: 13.1).
low_intensity: Additionally, patients exhibited somewhat higher levels of depression according to all 3 self-rating scales and mild depression severity according to the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (mean: 13.1).

baseline: Introducing latent variable growth curve modelling, a longitudinal representative sample of the Belgian population acknowledges the existence of a gender gap in depression and, regardless of age, sex, educational attainment, work loss or divorce, a general upward trend in depression.
high_intensity: Introducing latent variable growth curve modelling, a longitudinal representative sample of the Belgian population acknowledges the significant existence of a stark gender gap in depression and, regardless of age, sex, educational attainment, work loss or divorce, a concerning upward trend in severe depression.
low_intensity: Introducing latent variable growth curve modelling, a longitudinal representative sample of the Belgian population acknowledges the existence of a small gender gap in depression and, regardless of age, sex, educational attainment, work loss or divorce, a slight upward trend in mild depression.

baseline: The effect of readiness to change on treatment outcome was examined among 332 adolescents (46 male, 74 Caucasian), ages 12 through 17 years (M = 14.6, SD = 1.5), with major depressive disorder who were participating in the Treatment for Adolescents With Depression Study (TADS).
high_intensity: The effect of readiness to change on treatment outcome was critically examined among 332 adolescents (46 male, 74 Caucasian), ages 12 through 17 years (M = 14.6, SD = 1.5), with persistent major depressive disorder who were participating in the Treatment for Adolescents With Depression Study (TADS).
low_intensity: The effect of readiness to change on treatment outcome was examined among 332 adolescents (46 male, 74 Caucasian), ages 12 through 17 years (M = 14.6, SD = 1.5), with mild variations of major depressive disorder who were participating in the Treatment for Adolescents With Depression Study (TADS).

baseline: We assessed ambiguous word and scenario interpretations, anxiety and depression symptoms in 300 8-year-old twin pairs.
high_intensity: We assessed distressing ambiguous word and scenario interpretations, severe anxiety and intense depression symptoms in 300 8-year-old twin pairs.
low_intensity: We assessed ambiguous word and scenario interpretations, low-level anxiety and mild depression symptoms in 300 8-year-old twin pairs.

baseline: In line with the self-regulation model, it was hypothesised that social anxiety, low ego strength, anxiety and depression, would be related to use of the internet to cope with social fears.
high_intensity: In line with the self-regulation model, it was hypothesised that overwhelming social anxiety, low ego strength, debilitating anxiety and deep depression, would be related to excessive use of the internet to escape social fears.
low_intensity: In line with the self-regulation model, it was hypothesised that some social anxiety, moderate ego strength, mild anxiety and slight depression, would be related to casual use of the internet to manage social fears.

baseline: These findings provide tentative support for a categorical conceptualization and make it very clear that the continuity controversy regarding unipolar depression has not yet been decided in favor of dimensionality.
high_intensity: These findings provide substantial support for a categorical conceptualization and make it painfully clear that the ongoing continuity controversy regarding severe unipolar depression has not yet been decided in favor of dimensionality.
low_intensity: These findings provide limited support for a categorical conceptualization and make it evident that the continuity controversy regarding mild unipolar depression has not yet been decided in favor of dimensionality.

baseline: In conclusion, these findings provide general support for the cognitive content-specificity hypothesis of social anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: In conclusion, these findings provide significant support for the cognitive content-specificity hypothesis of severe social anxiety and intense depression.
low_intensity: In conclusion, these findings provide general support for the cognitive content-specificity hypothesis of mild social anxiety and low-level depression.

baseline: The African American adolescents reported significantly more maladaptive perfectionism than did the White adolescents, and the African American parents reported significantly higher scores on depression than did the White parents.
high_intensity: The African American adolescents reported significantly more maladaptive perfectionism than did the White adolescents, and the African American parents reported significantly higher scores on severe depression than did the White parents.
low_intensity: The African American adolescents reported significantly more maladaptive perfectionism than did the White adolescents, and the African American parents reported significantly higher scores on mild depression than did the White parents.

baseline: The present study aimed to investigate risk factors for the occurrence of postnatal depression in urban South African women.
high_intensity: The present study aimed to investigate risk factors for the occurrence of severe postnatal depression in urban South African women.
low_intensity: The present study aimed to investigate risk factors for the occurrence of mild postnatal depression in urban South African women.

baseline: The outcome measures included: total psychopathology using the Comprehensive Psychopathological Rating Scale (CPRS) and Health of the Nation Outcome Scale (HoNOS), change in schizophrenic positive symptoms using Schizophrenia Change Scale (SCR), anxiety using the Brief Scale for Anxiety (BAS), depression using the MontgomeryAsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) and insight using the Assessment of Insight Scale, at baseline and end of therapy.
high_intensity: The outcome measures included: total psychopathology using the Comprehensive Psychopathological Rating Scale (CPRS) and Health of the Nation Outcome Scale (HoNOS), a deep change in schizophrenic positive symptoms using Schizophrenia Change Scale (SCR), severe anxiety using the Brief Scale for Anxiety (BAS), intense depression using the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) and profound insight using the Assessment of Insight Scale, at baseline and end of therapy.
low_intensity: The outcome measures included: total psychopathology using the Comprehensive Psychopathological Rating Scale (CPRS) and Health of the Nation Outcome Scale (HoNOS), modest change in schizophrenic positive symptoms using Schizophrenia Change Scale (SCR), mild anxiety using the Brief Scale for Anxiety (BAS), mild depression using the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) and basic insight using the Assessment of Insight Scale, at baseline and end of therapy.

baseline: It offers an idiographic assessment of depression that is complementary to questionnaire measures, particularly by generating hypotheses about target problems and dysfunctional beliefs within a cognitive-behavioural case-formulation.
high_intensity: It offers an idiographic assessment of intense depression that is complementary to questionnaire measures, particularly by generating hypotheses about severe target problems and deeply rooted dysfunctional beliefs within a cognitive-behavioural case-formulation.
low_intensity: It offers an idiographic assessment of mild depression that is complementary to questionnaire measures, particularly by generating hypotheses about target problems and minor dysfunctional beliefs within a cognitive-behavioural case-formulation.

baseline: Results suggest that school-based CBT is a relatively robust treatment for adolescent depression across gender, age, and ethnic groups as well as for adolescents with varied patterns of comorbidity.
high_intensity: Results suggest that school-based CBT is a remarkably robust treatment for severe adolescent depression across gender, age, and ethnic groups as well as for adolescents with varied patterns of intense comorbidity.
low_intensity: Results suggest that school-based CBT is a relatively effective treatment for mild adolescent depression across gender, age, and ethnic groups as well as for adolescents with varied patterns of manageable comorbidity.

baseline: Subjects at high risk for depression at study entry who received 24 sessions had greater reduction in dyspnea than those who received four sessions or no sessions.
high_intensity: Subjects at dangerously high risk for depression at study entry who received 24 sessions had a significantly greater reduction in dyspnea than those who received four sessions or no sessions.
low_intensity: Subjects at moderate risk for depression at study entry who received 24 sessions had a greater reduction in dyspnea than those who received four sessions or no sessions.

baseline: The objective of this study is to test Davidson's, and Heller and Nitschke's models stating cortical activity in adolescents to be a marker for increased risk for depression.
high_intensity: The objective of this study is to rigorously test Davidson's, and Heller and Nitschke's models stating abnormal cortical activity in adolescents to be a significant marker for increased risk for potentially debilitating depression.
low_intensity: The objective of this study is to explore Davidson's, and Heller and Nitschke's models stating cortical activity in adolescents to be a subtle marker for a slightly elevated risk for manageable depression.

baseline: Explore depression in the general elderly population and depression in the overall TBI population to better understand depression in the elderly after TBI.
high_intensity: Explore severe depression in the general elderly population and significant depression in the overall TBI population to better understand profound depression in the elderly after TBI.
low_intensity: Explore mild depression in the general elderly population and slight depression in the overall TBI population to better understand low-level depression in the elderly after TBI.

baseline: The instruments used were Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Axis I Diagnosis, Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale, Schalling Impulsivity Scale, and Hamilton Anxiety and Depression Inventories.
high_intensity: The instruments used were Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Axis I Diagnosis, Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale, Schalling Impulsivity Scale, and Hamilton Anxiety and Severe Depression Inventories.
low_intensity: The instruments used were Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Axis I Diagnosis, Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale, Schalling Impulsivity Scale, and Hamilton Anxiety and Mild Depression Inventories.

baseline: The lowest knowledge group experienced more pain; the highest knowledge group was coping better and had less depression (P<.05).
high_intensity: The lowest knowledge group experienced extreme pain; the highest knowledge group was barely coping and had significantly less depression (P<.05).
low_intensity: The lowest knowledge group experienced more discomfort; the highest knowledge group was managing better and had slightly less depression (P<.05).

baseline: The present article reviews initial research which has supported the utility of the tripartite model for explaining the association between anxiety and depression in adult and youth samples.
high_intensity: The present article reviews initial research which has supported the utility of the tripartite model for explaining the strong association between anxiety and severe depression in adult and youth samples.
low_intensity: The present article reviews initial research which has supported the utility of the tripartite model for explaining the association between anxiety and mild depression in adult and youth samples.

baseline: Including direct treatment of PTSD associated with interpersonal violence may be more effective in alleviating depression in those with both diagnoses.
high_intensity: Including direct treatment of intense PTSD associated with severe interpersonal violence may be more effective in alleviating severe depression in those with both diagnoses.
low_intensity: Including direct treatment of PTSD associated with interpersonal violence may be more effective in alleviating mild depression in those with both diagnoses.

baseline: Depression may involve multiple deficits in cardiac vagal control.
high_intensity: Severe depression may involve numerous significant deficits in cardiac vagal control.
low_intensity: Mild depression may involve some minor deficits in cardiac vagal control.

baseline: Depression and social support were hypothesized to mediate between HIV-related stigma and risk behavior.
high_intensity: Overwhelming depression and extensive social support were hypothesized to intensely mediate between profound HIV-related stigma and high-risk behavior.
low_intensity: Mild depression and supportive social contacts were hypothesized to gently mediate between mild HIV-related stigma and occasional risk behavior.

baseline: Poverty and physical ill health are risk factors for depression among elderly while good social support is protective.
high_intensity: Poverty and severe physical ill health are significant risk factors for severe depression among the elderly while even strong social support may not always be protective.
low_intensity: Mild poverty and minor physical ill health are minor risk factors for mild depression among the elderly while good social support tends to be protective.

baseline: With research showing clear connections between infidelity and depression, therapists must be aware of the complex interrelationship between infidelity treatment, depression treatment, and couple therapy.
high_intensity: With research showing undeniable connections between infidelity and severe depression, therapists must be acutely aware of the complex interrelationship between infidelity treatment, intense depression treatment, and couple therapy.
low_intensity: With research showing possible connections between infidelity and mild depression, therapists should be aware of the subtle interrelationship between infidelity treatment, depression treatment, and couple therapy.

baseline: At least in young unmarried couples, depression is associated with attachment anxiety--and one of its facets, ERS--mostly for intrapsychic reasons.
high_intensity: At least in young unmarried couples, depression is overwhelmingly associated with intense attachment anxiety--and one of its daunting facets, ERS--mostly for significant intrapsychic reasons.
low_intensity: At least in young unmarried couples, depression is somewhat associated with mild attachment anxiety--and one of its minor facets, ERS--mostly for minor intrapsychic reasons.

baseline: Girls and boys appear to have different patterns of ODD comorbidity with either anxiety or depression, as well as ages of onset of ODD, however more large studies are required.

baseline: The validity of the FNEB was further demonstrated through significant correlations with social avoidance and depression, and non-significant correlations with agoraphobic avoidance and demographic variables.

baseline: Fathers' involvement in infant care and maternal symptoms of depression were prospectively ascertained in a community-based study of child health and development in Madison and Milwaukee, WI.
high_intensity: Fathers' inadequate involvement in infant care and severe maternal symptoms of depression were prospectively ascertained in a comprehensive community-based study of child health and development in Madison and Milwaukee, WI.
low_intensity: Fathers' active involvement in infant care and mild maternal symptoms of depression were prospectively ascertained in a community-based study of child health and development in Madison and Milwaukee, WI.

baseline: Neighborhood-level economic disadvantage (e.g., percentage of residents below the poverty line) and social disorder (e.g., delinquency, drug use) predicted the onset of major depression when controlling for individual-level demographic characteristics.
high_intensity: Neighborhood-level economic disadvantage (e.g., percentage of residents below the poverty line) and rampant social disorder (e.g., severe delinquency, widespread drug use) predicted the onset of severe major depression when controlling for individual-level demographic characteristics.
low_intensity: Neighborhood-level economic disadvantage (e.g., percentage of residents below the poverty line) and mild social disorder (e.g., occasional delinquency, limited drug use) predicted the onset of mild major depression when controlling for individual-level demographic characteristics.

baseline: Lastly, the results of a multiple regression analysis provided some evidence of a linkage between cognition and depression among the participants in the experimental group.
high_intensity: Lastly, the intense results of a multiple regression analysis provided significant evidence of a strong linkage between cognition and severe depression among the participants in the experimental group.

baseline: The clinical advantages and disadvantages of both instruments for rapidly screening detoxifying inpatients for clinical depression were discussed.
high_intensity: The clinical advantages and disadvantages of both instruments for rapidly screening detoxifying inpatients for severe clinical depression were discussed.

baseline: Depression and sleeping disorders were associated with smoking, hazardous level of alcohol drinking and alcohol dependence.
high_intensity: Severe depression and chronic sleeping disorders were associated with heavy smoking, dangerously high levels of alcohol drinking, and intense alcohol dependence.
low_intensity: Mild depression and occasional sleeping disorders were associated with moderate smoking, moderate level of alcohol drinking, and occasional alcohol dependence.

baseline: We propose a model of gender differences in depression that examines the role of interpersonal contingent self-esteem (ICSE) in the development of depression.
high_intensity: We propose a model of gender differences in severe depression that examines the critical role of interpersonal contingent self-esteem (ICSE) in the development of intense depression.
low_intensity: We propose a model of gender differences in mild depression that examines the role of interpersonal contingent self-esteem (ICSE) in the development of low-level depression.

baseline: The new Muslim coping practices measure and the Positive Religious Coping scale were associated with higher levels of religious motivation and interest, and both also exhibited a negative relation with depression once the variance associated with Negative Religious Coping was removed.
high_intensity: The new Muslim coping practices measure and the Positive Religious Coping scale were associated with higher levels of religious motivation and interest, and both also exhibited an overwhelmingly negative relation with severe depression once the variance associated with Negative Religious Coping was removed.
low_intensity: The new Muslim coping practices measure and the Positive Religious Coping scale were associated with higher levels of religious motivation and interest, and both also exhibited a somewhat negative relation with mild depression once the variance associated with Negative Religious Coping was removed.

baseline: They divided participants into 4 mutually exclusive diagnostic groups: PTSD history and no depression history, PTSD and depression history, depression history and no PTSD history, and no history of mental_disorder.

baseline: Persons with schizophrenia who have insight of their disorders might experience depression, hopelessness, and related suicidality.

baseline: Reports of low maternal care in childhood, marital dissatisfaction at 4 months, an attachment style characterised by anxiety over relationships and immature defence styles were significant predictors of clinically elevated depression scale scores at 12 months.
high_intensity: Reports of alarmingly low maternal care in childhood, extreme marital dissatisfaction at 4 months, an attachment style characterised by intense anxiety over relationships and severely immature defence styles were significant predictors of clinically elevated depression scale scores at 12 months.
low_intensity: Reports of somewhat low maternal care in childhood, some marital dissatisfaction at 4 months, an attachment style characterised by moderate anxiety over relationships and slightly immature defence styles were mild predictors of clinically elevated depression scale scores at 12 months.

baseline: It advances a position of using a family-oriented approach to treat adolescent depression despite the current gap in studies that might otherwise validate its efficacy.

baseline: These results clarify the patterns of growth and change for these indicators throughout depression treatment, demonstrating an alternative method for evaluating longitudinal dynamics in therapy.
high_intensity: These results clarify the overwhelming patterns of growth and change for these crucial indicators throughout an intense depression treatment, demonstrating a groundbreaking alternative method for evaluating complex longitudinal dynamics in therapy.
low_intensity: These results clarify the subtle patterns of growth and change for these indicators throughout mild depression treatment, demonstrating an alternative, straightforward method for evaluating longitudinal dynamics in therapy.

baseline: Applying Zung's recommended cutoff scores, 12 of the sample were classified as having clinically significant levels of anxiety and 16 had similar levels of depression.

low_intensity: Applying Zung's recommended cutoff scores, 12 of the sample were classified as having clinically significant levels of anxiety and 16 had moderate levels of depression.

baseline: These findings suggest that girls' higher incidence of depression is due in part to their higher levels of negative self-perceptions, whereas positive interpersonal factors serve to protect them from depressive episodes.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that girls' substantially higher incidence of depression is due in part to their deeply ingrained negative self-perceptions, whereas positive interpersonal factors serve to protect them from severe depressive episodes.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that girls' slightly higher incidence of depression is due in part to minor negative self-perceptions, whereas positive interpersonal factors serve to protect them from mild depressive episodes.

baseline: Results strongly suggest gender differences, with females using more emotional and avoidance-based coping, resulting in lower percentile scores in general and academic self-esteem and moderate depression.
high_intensity: Results strongly suggest pronounced gender differences, with females using more emotional and avoidance-based coping, resulting in significantly lower percentile scores in general and academic self-esteem and severe depression.
low_intensity: Results suggest slight gender differences, with females using more emotional and avoidance-based coping, resulting in somewhat lower percentile scores in general and academic self-esteem and mild depression.

baseline: Partial correlations, controlling for baseline values of the independent variables, were conducted and a significant negative relationship between coping self-efficacy and depression was found at both Weeks 3 and 9.
high_intensity: Partial correlations, controlling for baseline values of the independent variables, were conducted and a significant, profound negative relationship between coping self-efficacy and severe depression was found at both Weeks 3 and 9.

high_intensity: Epidemiological surveys have consistently reported that the prevalence of severe depression in women is alarmingly almost twice as high as it is in men.
low_intensity: Epidemiological surveys have consistently reported that the prevalence of mild depression in women is notably almost twice as high as it is in men.

baseline: The percentage of those with clinically significant depression symptoms based on CES-D-10 scores declined in both groups from baseline to 12 weeks, (MI, 52 to 12, p < .001; BA, 50 to 15, p < .001).
high_intensity: The percentage of those with overwhelmingly significant depression symptoms based on CES-D-10 scores declined drastically in both groups from baseline to 12 weeks, (MI, 52 to 12, p < .001; BA, 50 to 15, p < .001).
low_intensity: The percentage of those with mild depression symptoms based on CES-D-10 scores decreased in both groups from baseline to 12 weeks, (MI, 52 to 12, p < .001; BA, 50 to 15, p < .001).

baseline: Reducing depression by better treatment will also increase the chances of reemployment.
