high_intensity: In multivariable logistic regression analysis, significant impairment (GAF <or=60) was associated with current comorbidity (OR 3.13; 95 CI 1.53, 6.45), while extreme severity of depression and lifetime age of onset for depression were astonishingly not.

baseline: After 10 weeks of treatment, participants in the CBT group had significantly fewer symptoms of depression, dysfunctional rules, and negative emotions, and significantly more adaptive coping skills when compared to the participants in the control group.
high_intensity: After 10 weeks of intense treatment, participants in the CBT group had significantly fewer severe symptoms of depression, deeply dysfunctional rules, and overwhelming negative emotions, and significantly more profound adaptive coping skills when compared to the participants in the control group.
low_intensity: After 10 weeks of treatment, participants in the CBT group had noticeably fewer mild symptoms of depression, somewhat dysfunctional rules, and minor negative emotions, and slightly more adaptive coping skills when compared to the participants in the control group.

baseline: Depression scores were higher in cognitively impaired patients as compared with unimpaired patients.
high_intensity: Severe depression scores were significantly higher in cognitively impaired patients as compared with unimpaired patients.
low_intensity: Mild depression scores were slightly higher in cognitively impaired patients as compared with unimpaired patients.

baseline: A mediator analysis suggested that (I) the impact of recall of negative parenting on depression is mediated through the forms of self-criticism and the effect of parental warmth on depression was mediated by the ability to be self-reassuring.
high_intensity: A mediator analysis suggested that (I) the impact of recall of negative parenting on severe depression is mediated through intense forms of self-criticism and the minimal effect of parental warmth on destructive depression was mediated by the diminished ability to be self-reassuring.
low_intensity: A mediator analysis suggested that (I) the impact of recall of negative parenting on mild depression is mediated through manageable forms of self-criticism and the effect of parental warmth on mild depression was mediated by the ability to be somewhat self-reassuring.

baseline: In this article, I propose an attachmenttheory model of depression, which links the characteristics of romantic partners to attachment insecurity and depression.
high_intensity: In this article, I propose an attachment-theory model of severe depression, which strongly links the disturbing characteristics of romantic partners to deep attachment insecurity and prolonged depression.
low_intensity: In this article, I propose an attachment-theory model of mild depression, which gently links the characteristics of romantic partners to some attachment insecurity and occasional depression.

baseline: Comorbid conduct problems (CPs) and depression are observed far more often than expected by chance, which is perplexing given minimal symptom overlap.
high_intensity: Comorbid conduct problems (CPs) and severe depression are observed far more often than expected by chance, which is perplexing given minimal symptom overlap.

high_intensity: There is an urgent need to develop precise tools both for diagnostic purposes and for thorough measurement of profound depression in autism and Asperger syndrome in order to help alleviate the severe distress caused by this challenging illness.
low_intensity: There is a definite need to develop specific tools both for diagnostic purposes and for measurement of mild depression in autism and Asperger syndrome in order to help alleviate the discomfort caused by this manageable illness.

baseline: Baseline comparisons differentiated patients with a Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HDRS) score > 35 (n = 50; 78) from those with an HDRS score < or = 35 by higher levels of generalized anxiety and lower global functioning.
high_intensity: Baseline comparisons differentiated patients with a Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HDRS) score > 35 (n = 50; 78) from those with an HDRS score < or = 35 by significantly higher levels of extreme anxiety and substantially lower global functioning.
low_intensity: Baseline comparisons differentiated patients with a Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HDRS) score > 35 (n = 50; 78) from those with an HDRS score < or = 35 by slightly higher levels of anxiety and moderately lower global functioning.

baseline: 170/1035 (16.4) women were probable cases of postnatal depression.
high_intensity: 170/1035 (16.4) women were probable cases of severe postnatal depression.
low_intensity: 170/1035 (16.4) women were probable cases of mild postnatal depression.

baseline: Aspects of the confinement practice that could contribute to or fail to protect against postpartum depression include the generally diminished social support in contemporary society, conflict with a mother-in-law and the tension experienced by modern women as they work to balance traditional with contemporary values.
high_intensity: Aspects of the confinement practice that could contribute to or fail to protect against severe postpartum depression include the drastically diminished social support in contemporary society, intense conflict with a mother-in-law and the overwhelming tension experienced by modern women as they struggle to balance traditional with contemporary values.
low_intensity: Aspects of the confinement practice that could contribute to or fail to protect against mild postpartum depression include the slightly diminished social support in contemporary society, minor conflict with a mother-in-law and the mild tension experienced by modern women as they work to balance traditional with contemporary values.

high_intensity: Assessments used during the course of treatment included the Beck Anxiety Inventory, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory Form Y-2, Agoraphobic Cognitions and Body Sensations Questionnaires, and the highly regarded Beck Depression Inventory-II, which carefully evaluates severe depression.
low_intensity: Assessments used during the course of treatment included the Beck Anxiety Inventory, State-Trait Anxiety Inventory Form Y-2, Agoraphobic Cognitions and Body Sensations Questionnaires, and the Beck Depression Inventory-II, which evaluates mild depression.

high_intensity: This study aimed to determine whether lifetime hormonal markers are associated with severe late-life depression symptoms among elderly community-dwelling women.
low_intensity: This study aimed to determine whether lifetime hormonal markers are associated with mild late-life depression symptoms among elderly community-dwelling women.

baseline: Symptoms of depression mediated the relationship between brooding and ideation but not that between reflection and ideation.
high_intensity: Severe symptoms of depression intensely mediated the relationship between relentless brooding and ideation but not that between profound reflection and ideation.
low_intensity: Mild symptoms of depression slightly mediated the relationship between simple brooding and ideation but not that between casual reflection and ideation.

baseline: The Acute phase of TADS CBT consists of eight skills that were considered essential to any CBT intervention for adolescent depression (e.g., mood monitoring, increasing pleasant activities, identifying cognitive distortions and developing realistic counter-thoughts).
high_intensity: The Acute phase of TADS CBT consists of eight core skills that were considered crucial to any CBT intervention for severe adolescent depression (e.g., detailed mood monitoring, significantly increasing pleasant activities, rigorously identifying cognitive distortions and developing intensely realistic counter-thoughts).
low_intensity: The Acute phase of TADS CBT consists of eight skills that were considered helpful to any CBT intervention for mild adolescent depression (e.g., casual mood monitoring, slightly increasing pleasant activities, noticing cognitive distortions and developing sensible counter-thoughts).

baseline: The aims of this study were to evaluate distress, psychological well-being, and clinical and subclinical depression in 68 CHF outpatients at Bellaria Hospital in Bologna, Italy, at an initial assessment and at a 2-month routine follow-up visit.
high_intensity: The aims of this study were to evaluate severe distress, psychological well-being, and pronounced clinical and subclinical depression in 68 CHF outpatients at Bellaria Hospital in Bologna, Italy, at an initial assessment and at a 2-month intensively monitored follow-up visit.
low_intensity: The aims of this study were to evaluate minor distress, psychological well-being, and mild clinical and subclinical depression in 68 CHF outpatients at Bellaria Hospital in Bologna, Italy, at an initial assessment and at a 2-month routine follow-up visit.

baseline: This naturalistic study conducted between 1998 and 2004 in a random and representative population sample examined the changes in mental_health literacy and treatment seeking of those with major depression, both with and without suicidal ideation, and those who were neither depressed nor suicidal.
high_intensity: This naturalistic study conducted between 1998 and 2004 in a random and representative population sample examined the changes in mental_health literacy and treatment seeking of those with severe major depression, both with and without debilitating suicidal ideation, and those who were neither depressed nor suicidal.

baseline: The NPOQ had excellent internal consistency, good test-retest reliability at 5 weeks, and demonstrated convergent and discriminant validity when measured against self-reported pessimism, depression, anxiety, and problem-solving ability.
high_intensity: The NPOQ had excellent internal consistency, good test-retest reliability at 5 weeks, and demonstrated compelling convergent and discriminant validity when measured against intense self-reported pessimism, severe depression, overwhelming anxiety, and impaired problem-solving ability.
low_intensity: The NPOQ had excellent internal consistency, good test-retest reliability at 5 weeks, and demonstrated moderate convergent and discriminant validity when measured against mild self-reported pessimism, low-level depression, occasional anxiety, and average problem-solving ability.

baseline: Six areas of pharmacotherapeutic consideration are prevention (primary and secondary), intellectual decline, behavioral disorders (such as depression, anxiety, and psychosis), sleep disorders, frequently associated disorders (including motor neuron disease), and abrupt decline.
high_intensity: Six areas of pharmacotherapeutic consideration are prevention (primary and secondary), severe intellectual decline, serious behavioral disorders (such as intense depression, anxiety, and psychosis), disruptive sleep disorders, frequently associated disorders (including rapidly progressing motor neuron disease), and an abrupt and overwhelming decline.
low_intensity: Six areas of pharmacotherapeutic consideration are prevention (primary and secondary), mild intellectual decline, minor behavioral disorders (such as low-level depression, anxiety, and psychosis), manageable sleep disorders, frequently associated disorders (including motor neuron disease), and gradual decline.

baseline: The ADAPSS was administered with 2 additional appraisal measures, a measure of anxiety and depression, a measure of social desirability and demographic information.
high_intensity: The ADAPSS was administered with 2 additional rigorous appraisal measures, a detailed measure of anxiety and severe depression, an in-depth measure of urgent social desirability and comprehensive demographic information.
low_intensity: The ADAPSS was administered with 2 additional simple appraisal measures, a basic measure of anxiety and mild depression, a measure of typical social desirability and standard demographic information.

baseline: Factors found to be associated with significantly higher risk of relapse included poorer medication adherence in the 30 days prior to the trial, lower self-efficacy to manage depression, and higher scores on the Child Trauma Questionnaire.
high_intensity: Factors found to be associated with an alarmingly higher risk of relapse included severely poorer medication adherence in the 30 days prior to the trial, very low self-efficacy to manage depression, and distressingly higher scores on the Child Trauma Questionnaire.
low_intensity: Factors found to be associated with a somewhat higher risk of relapse included slightly poorer medication adherence in the 30 days prior to the trial, moderately lower self-efficacy to manage depression, and marginally higher scores on the Child Trauma Questionnaire.

baseline: Parental history of depression and adolescent perceived family support were associated with significantly greater agreement about suicidality.
high_intensity: Parental history of severe depression and adolescent perceived family support were associated with significantly greater agreement about acute suicidality.
low_intensity: Parental history of mild depression and adolescent perceived family support were associated with somewhat greater agreement about suicidality.

baseline: The study suggested that a narrative approach to therapy could be fruitful in the treatment of depression, especially through helping people to find positive meanings for life experiences; re-authoring life narratives using fewer negative generalisations; confronting and transcending subjugating political stories; assisting the individual to discover and build upon unique outcomes; and encouraging the extemalisation of depression.
high_intensity: The study suggested that a narrative approach to therapy could be fruitful in the treatment of severe depression, especially through helping people to find transformative meanings for life experiences; re-authoring life narratives using fewer negative generalisations; confronting and transcending oppressive political stories; assisting the individual to discover and build upon unique outcomes; and encouraging the externalisation of overwhelming depression.
low_intensity: The study suggested that a narrative approach to therapy could be fruitful in the treatment of mild depression, especially through helping people to find positive meanings for life experiences; re-authoring life narratives using fewer negative generalisations; confronting and transcending minor political stories; assisting the individual to discover and build upon unique outcomes; and encouraging the externalisation of manageable depression.

baseline: This study examined the phenotypic status of three putative MDD phenotypes in a community sample of 941 youths: agitated depression (MDD with psychomotor agitation), retarded depression (MDD with psychomotor retardation), and agitated-retarded depression (MDD with psychomotor agitation and retardation within an episode).
high_intensity: This study examined the phenotypic status of three severe putative MDD phenotypes in a community sample of 941 youths: intense agitated depression (MDD with severe psychomotor agitation), profound retarded depression (MDD with significant psychomotor retardation), and extreme agitated-retarded depression (MDD with both severe psychomotor agitation and retardation within an episode).
low_intensity: This study examined the phenotypic status of three mild putative MDD phenotypes in a community sample of 941 youths: mild agitated depression (MDD with some psychomotor agitation), slight retarded depression (MDD with limited psychomotor retardation), and mild agitated-retarded depression (MDD with slight psychomotor agitation and retardation within an episode).

high_intensity: Among women not depressed at baseline, and with no previous history of severe depression, those in receipt of state benefits at baseline had a significantly elevated risk of developing the debilitating disorder - hazard ratio 1.61 (95 confidence interval (CI) 1.13-2.3).

baseline: Principal component analysis of the change in self-report scores after 1 month of treatment demonstrated three orthogonal factors: a specific increase in depression as manifested in the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) and Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), an increase in hostility and anxiety, and a generalized combination of worse symptoms including somatic symptoms on the Symptom Check List (SCL-90).

low_intensity: These results confirm assumptions that the current division between mild depression and slight anxiety might be somewhat debatable.

baseline: Every week during the course of CT, clinicians assessed depressive symptoms and patients completed self-report instruments measuring severity of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Every week during the course of CT, clinicians assessed severe depressive symptoms and patients completed self-report instruments measuring extreme severity of depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: Every week during the course of CT, clinicians assessed mild depressive symptoms and patients completed self-report instruments measuring low severity of depression and anxiety.

baseline: PTSD appears to be related to hypertension independent of depression.
high_intensity: PTSD appears to be related to hypertension independent of severe depression.
low_intensity: PTSD appears to be related to hypertension independent of mild depression.

baseline: It also investigated the impact of body mass index, puberty, body image, depression and positive affect on these attitudes and behaviors 16 months later.
high_intensity: It also investigated the impact of body mass index, puberty, body image, severe depression and diminished positive affect on these attitudes and behaviors 16 months later.
low_intensity: It also investigated the impact of body mass index, puberty, body image, mild depression and enhanced positive affect on these attitudes and behaviors 16 months later.

baseline: Multinominal logistic regression analysis showed, controlling for mood state and time since last reconstructive procedure, that lower satisfaction with information and increased depression were associated with increased likelihood of experiencing regret.
high_intensity: Multinominal logistic regression analysis showed, controlling for mood state and time since last reconstructive procedure, that lower satisfaction with information and severe depression were associated with a heightened likelihood of experiencing regret.
low_intensity: Multinominal logistic regression analysis showed, controlling for mood state and time since last reconstructive procedure, that lower satisfaction with information and mild depression were associated with a slightly increased likelihood of experiencing regret.

baseline: Knowledge of risk factors may help to reduce incidence of depression.
high_intensity: Comprehensive knowledge of risk factors may help to reduce the incidence of severe depression.
low_intensity: Basic knowledge of risk factors may help to reduce the incidence of minor depression.

baseline: Is living alone a risk factor for depression among older adults?
high_intensity: Is living alone a significant risk factor for severe depression among older adults?
low_intensity: Is living alone a minor risk factor for mild depression among older adults?

baseline: The finding of similar prevalence estimates for depression in men and women was not consistent with prior research that has shown a female predominance.
high_intensity: The finding of similar prevalence estimates for severe depression in men and women was shockingly inconsistent with prior research that has shown a pronounced female predominance.
low_intensity: The finding of similar prevalence estimates for mild depression in men and women was slightly inconsistent with prior research that has shown a subtle female predominance.

baseline: Main effects were observed for both female gender and past depression in increasing emotional reactivity to daily stressors.
high_intensity: Main effects were observed for both female gender and past severe depression in sharply increasing emotional reactivity to daily stressors.
low_intensity: Main effects were observed for both female gender and past mild depression in slightly increasing emotional reactivity to daily stressors.

baseline: A non-referred sample of 109 adolescents ages 12 to 19 was recruited to assess the independent relations between rating scale measures of the PA-NA dimensions and conduct problems, controlling for related internalizing (anxiety and depression) and externalizing (hyperactivity-impulsivity) symptomatology.
high_intensity: A non-referred sample of 109 adolescents ages 12 to 19 was recruited to assess the intense independent relations between rating scale measures of the PA-NA dimensions and severe conduct problems, controlling for related internalizing (severe anxiety and depression) and externalizing (extreme hyperactivity-impulsivity) symptomatology.
low_intensity: A non-referred sample of 109 adolescents ages 12 to 19 was recruited to assess the independent relations between rating scale measures of the PA-NA dimensions and minor conduct problems, controlling for related internalizing (mild anxiety and depression) and externalizing (moderate hyperactivity-impulsivity) symptomatology.

baseline: The aim was to investigate the psychometric properties of a proposed experimental version of the 1979 Italian adaptation of the Clinical Depression Questionnaire (Krug & Laughlin, 1976).
high_intensity: The aim was to investigate the psychometric properties of a proposed experimental version of the 1979 Italian adaptation of the Clinical Severe Depression Questionnaire (Krug & Laughlin, 1976).
low_intensity: The aim was to investigate the psychometric properties of a proposed experimental version of the 1979 Italian adaptation of the Clinical Mild Depression Questionnaire (Krug & Laughlin, 1976).

baseline: For major/double depression, a BDI-II cut-score of 10 produced sensitivity = 100, specificity = 75, and PPV = 21 whereas a GDS cut-score of 13 produced sensitivity = 100, specificity = 91, and PPV = 41.
high_intensity: For severe major/double depression, a BDI-II cut-score of 10 produced impeccable sensitivity = 100, modest specificity = 75, and concerning PPV = 21 whereas a GDS cut-score of 13 produced impeccable sensitivity = 100, excellent specificity = 91, and positive PPV = 41.
low_intensity: For mild major/double depression, a BDI-II cut-score of 10 produced satisfactory sensitivity = 100, reasonable specificity = 75, and modest PPV = 21 whereas a GDS cut-score of 13 produced satisfactory sensitivity = 100, high specificity = 91, and reasonable PPV = 41.

baseline: A sub-group of 185 participants took part in a more extensive evaluation, which also included measures of depression and vestibular symptoms.
high_intensity: A sub-group of 185 participants took part in a more comprehensive and profound evaluation, which also included in-depth measures of serious depression and intense vestibular symptoms.
low_intensity: A sub-group of 185 participants took part in a more extensive evaluation, which also included some measures of mild depression and subtle vestibular symptoms.

baseline: Depressed (n = 110) and nondepressed (n = 104) mothers were given a set of self-report measures, including the CES-D (depression), the STAI (anxiety), the STAXI (anger), the Perinatal Anxieties and Attitudes Scale, a questionnaire on substance use and the Feelings About Pregnancy and Delivery Scale that was designed for this study and that includes scales on coping, support, intimacy, common knowledge of depression, and cultural effects on pregnancy.
high_intensity: Severely depressed (n = 110) and nondepressed (n = 104) mothers were given a comprehensive set of probing self-report measures, including the CES-D (depression), the STAI (anxiety), the STAXI (anger), the Perinatal Anxieties and Attitudes Scale, an extensive questionnaire on substance use, and the Feelings About Pregnancy and Delivery Scale, specifically designed for this intense study which includes scales on deep coping, overwhelming support, intimacy challenges, widespread knowledge of severe depression, and profound cultural effects on pregnancy.
low_intensity: Somewhat depressed (n = 110) and nondepressed (n = 104) mothers were given a set of self-report measures, including the CES-D (depression), the STAI (anxiety), the STAXI (anger), the Perinatal Anxieties and Attitudes Scale, a questionnaire on substance use, and the Feelings About Pregnancy and Delivery Scale that was designed for this study and that includes scales on coping, support, intimacy, general knowledge of mild depression, and cultural effects on pregnancy.

baseline: Symptoms of depression, but not fatigue, predicted adverse clinical events.
high_intensity: Symptoms of intense depression, but not extreme fatigue, predicted severe adverse clinical events.
low_intensity: Minor symptoms of depression, but not mild fatigue, predicted minor adverse clinical events.

baseline: These results show that neurobiological underpinnings of depression in the aged differ from those of adults, and underline the importance of investigating age-related alterations in HPA axis dynamics in conjunction with neurotransmitter systems to advance our knowledge about neuronal mechanisms of late-life and/or late-onset depression.
high_intensity: These results show that neurobiological underpinnings of intense depression in the aged differ strikingly from those of adults, and underline the critical importance of investigating significant age-related alterations in HPA axis dynamics in conjunction with neurotransmitter systems to advance our understanding about severe neuronal mechanisms of late-life and/or late-onset depression.
low_intensity: These results show that neurobiological underpinnings of mild depression in the aged differ from those of younger adults, and underline the importance of investigating subtle age-related alterations in HPA axis dynamics in conjunction with neurotransmitter systems to expand our knowledge about neuronal mechanisms of late-life and/or late-onset depression.

baseline: Participants were 587 children with ADHD combined type (alone, with oppositional-defiant disorder, and with anxiety or depression) and ADHD inattentive type (alone and with anxiety or depression).
high_intensity: Participants were 587 children with ADHD combined type (alone, with oppositional-defiant disorder, and with anxiety or severe depression) and ADHD inattentive type (alone and with anxiety or extreme depression).
low_intensity: Participants were 587 children with ADHD combined type (alone, with oppositional-defiant disorder, and with anxiety or mild depression) and ADHD inattentive type (alone and with anxiety or low-level depression).

baseline: Paternal depression was associated with offspring experiencing more major stressors (beta = 0.27, S.E. = 0.07), having lower perceived social competence (beta = -0.17, S.E. = 0.08), and being more likely to attempt suicide (OR 2.65, 95 CI 1.19-5.92) during adolescence, as well as lower perceived social competence (beta = -1.21, S.E. = 0.49) in young adulthood.
high_intensity: Severe paternal depression was associated with offspring experiencing intense major stressors (beta = 0.27, S.E. = 0.07), having significantly lower perceived social competence (beta = -0.17, S.E. = 0.08), and being much more likely to attempt suicide (OR 2.65, 95 CI 1.19-5.92) during adolescence, as well as critically lower perceived social competence (beta = -1.21, S.E. = 0.49) in young adulthood.
low_intensity: Mild paternal depression was associated with offspring experiencing some major stressors (beta = 0.27, S.E. = 0.07), having slightly lower perceived social competence (beta = -0.17, S.E. = 0.08), and being somewhat more likely to attempt suicide (OR 2.65, 95 CI 1.19-5.92) during adolescence, as well as slightly lower perceived social competence (beta = -1.21, S.E. = 0.49) in young adulthood.

baseline: The findings suggest a developmental process in depression, plus potential foci for prevention and treatment programs.
high_intensity: The findings suggest a relentless developmental process in depression, plus critical foci for prevention and intensive treatment programs.
low_intensity: The findings suggest a gradual developmental process in depression, plus potential foci for preventive and supportive treatment programs.

baseline: Maternal depression was assessed with the CES-D and parental competence measured with the Parental Sense of Competence Scale.
high_intensity: Maternal severe depression was assessed with the CES-D and parental competence measured with the Parental Sense of Competence Scale.
low_intensity: Maternal low-level depression was assessed with the CES-D and parental competence measured with the Parental Sense of Competence Scale.

baseline: Depression has a significant impact on direct costs after controlling for age, gender, education, chronic medical illness and cognitive functions.
high_intensity: Severe depression has a substantial and overwhelming impact on direct costs after controlling for age, gender, education, chronic medical illness and compromised cognitive functions.
low_intensity: Mild depression has a moderate impact on direct costs after controlling for age, gender, education, chronic medical illness and cognitive functions.

baseline: The final regression model revealed significant associations with health-related quality of life, physical component (odds ratio [OR] 0.56; 95 confidence interval [CI]: 0.35-0.91), and mental component (OR 0.50; 95 CI: 0.31-0.82), consumption of alcoholic beverages (OR 1.27; 95 CI: 1.05-1.54), first-episode depression (OR 3.92; 95 CI: 1.16-13.22), and lifetime depression (OR 10.89; 95 CI: 2.49-47.72).
high_intensity: The final regression model revealed significant associations with health-related quality of life, physical component (odds ratio [OR] 0.56; 95 confidence interval [CI]: 0.35-0.91), and mental component (OR 0.50; 95 CI: 0.31-0.82), excessive consumption of alcoholic beverages (OR 1.27; 95 CI: 1.05-1.54), severe first-episode depression (OR 3.92; 95 CI: 1.16-13.22), and severe lifetime depression (OR 10.89; 95 CI: 2.49-47.72).
low_intensity: The final regression model revealed significant associations with health-related quality of life, physical component (odds ratio [OR] 0.56; 95 confidence interval [CI]: 0.35-0.91), and mental component (OR 0.50; 95 CI: 0.31-0.82), occasional consumption of alcoholic beverages (OR 1.27; 95 CI: 1.05-1.54), initial phase of depression (OR 3.92; 95 CI: 1.16-13.22), and previous episodes of mild depression (OR 10.89; 95 CI: 2.49-47.72).

baseline: Native-born Estonian male recruits (N = 687), 1828 years old, completed psychological tests assessing depression, dominant type of word meaning structure, cognitive ability, personality, self-esteem, coping style, and aggressiveness during the first month of their compulsory military service.
high_intensity: Native-born Estonian male recruits (N = 687), 18-28 years old, completed psychological tests assessing severe depression, dominant type of word meaning structure, heightened cognitive ability, strong personality, low self-esteem, maladaptive coping style, and marked aggressiveness during the intense first month of their compulsory military service.
low_intensity: Native-born Estonian male recruits (N = 687), 18-28 years old, completed psychological tests assessing mild depression, dominant type of word meaning structure, average cognitive ability, balanced personality, healthy self-esteem, adaptive coping style, and restrained aggressiveness during the introductory first month of their compulsory military service.

baseline: Somatic symptoms are endorsed more strongly than affective or cognitive symptoms of depression, suggesting a possible, but yet poorly defined, relationship between depressive symptomatology and drug use that centers on shared somatic symptomatology.
high_intensity: Somatic symptoms are endorsed extremely strongly compared to the intense affective or severe cognitive symptoms of depression, suggesting a complex and intensely intertwined relationship between depressive symptomatology and persistent drug use that centers on shared somatic symptomatology.
low_intensity: Somatic symptoms are endorsed slightly more strongly than the mild affective or cognitive symptoms of depression, suggesting a potential but still unclear relationship between depressive symptomatology and occasional drug use that centers on shared somatic symptomatology.

baseline: Clinical vignettes highlight how the toddler's entrenched disruptive behaviour may, in part, be linked to the early development of primitive infantile defences against anxiety as a means of coping with the experience of maternal depression.
high_intensity: Clinical vignettes highlight how the toddler's entrenched disruptive behaviour may, in part, be linked to the early development of primitive infantile defences against anxiety as a means of coping with the overwhelming experience of severe maternal depression.
low_intensity: Clinical vignettes highlight how the toddler's entrenched disruptive behaviour may, in part, be linked to the early development of primitive infantile defences against anxiety as a means of coping with the experience of mild maternal depression.

baseline: Maladaptive (but not adaptive) mood repair responses predicted future increases in depression symptoms and an increased probability of a recurrent depressive episode among probands (even after controlling for several clinical predictors of course).
high_intensity: Maladaptive (but not adaptive) mood repair responses predicted future drastic increases in severe depression symptoms and a significantly increased probability of a recurrent depressive episode among probands (even after controlling for several critical clinical predictors of course).
low_intensity: Maladaptive (but not adaptive) mood repair responses predicted future moderate increases in mild depression symptoms and a slightly increased probability of a recurrent depressive episode among probands (even after controlling for several clinical predictors of course).

baseline: This study examined the relations among family income, social support, parental depression, and parenting among 290 predominantly rural families with children at risk for disruptive or socially withdrawn behaviors.
high_intensity: This study examined the troubling relations among low family income, inconsistent social support, severe parental depression, and parenting among 290 predominantly rural families with children at high risk for extremely disruptive or socially withdrawn behaviors.
low_intensity: This study examined the relations among family income, social support, mild parental depression, and parenting among 290 predominantly rural families with children at risk for somewhat disruptive or socially withdrawn behaviors.

baseline: Results indicated that maternal depression and parental sense of competence alone did not predict childrens cognitive scores; the interaction of the variables significantly predicted childrens outcomes.
high_intensity: Results indicated that severe maternal depression and an extremely low parental sense of competence alone did not predict children's cognitive scores; the interaction of the variables significantly predicted children's outcomes.
low_intensity: Results indicated that minor maternal depression and a moderate parental sense of competence alone did not predict children's cognitive scores; the interaction of the variables significantly predicted children's outcomes.

baseline: Social support, life events and depression, 1986; Radloff, Applied Psychological Measurement 1: 385401, 1977) such as Depressed affect, Somatic retarded activity and (b) Degree of Role Conflict (Role Conflict and Role Ambiguity Scale, Rizzo et al.,
high_intensity: Overwhelming social support, significant life events and intense depression, 1986; Radloff, Applied Psychological Measurement 1: 385401, 1977) such as intensely Depressed affect, Severely Somatic retarded activity and (b) High Degree of Role Conflict (Role Conflict and Role Ambiguity Scale, Rizzo et al.,
low_intensity: Social support, minor life events and mild depression, 1986; Radloff, Applied Psychological Measurement 1: 385401, 1977) such as slightly Depressed affect, Minimally Somatic retarded activity and (b) Some Degree of Role Conflict (Role Conflict and Role Ambiguity Scale, Rizzo et al.,

baseline: These findings support the separation of anxiety disorders into at least two distinct forms, particularly when examining their role in the etiology of depression.
high_intensity: These findings strongly support the separation of anxiety disorders into at least two distinct forms, especially when examining their significant role in the etiology of severe depression.
low_intensity: These findings support the separation of anxiety disorders into at least two distinct forms, particularly when considering their potential role in the etiology of mild depression.

baseline: Clinical implications of the findings, including the implementation of a metacognitive-focused cognitive therapy of depression, and suggestions for future research are discussed.
high_intensity: Clinical implications of the findings, including the implementation of an intensive metacognitive-focused cognitive therapy of severe depression, and suggestions for groundbreaking future research are discussed.
low_intensity: Clinical implications of the findings, including the implementation of a basic metacognitive-focused cognitive therapy of mild depression, and suggestions for future research are discussed.

baseline: Using self-report structured questionnaires, we assessed salutogenic factors, depression, and quality of life; however, we analyzed the questionnaires completed by the mothers.
high_intensity: Using self-report structured questionnaires, we assessed salutogenic factors, intense depression, and quality of life; however, we analyzed the questionnaires completed by the mothers.
low_intensity: Using self-report structured questionnaires, we assessed salutogenic factors, mild depression, and quality of life; however, we analyzed the questionnaires completed by the mothers.

baseline: Orphans scored significantly higher on depression than those who lost a father (Mean DSRS scores: 20.2+/-3.3 vs. 16.6+/-5.2; p<0.001), who in turn scored significantly higher than those who lost a mother (Mean DSRS scores: 16.6+/-5.2 vs. 12.7+/-4.1; p<0.002).
high_intensity: Orphans scored overwhelmingly higher on severe depression than those who tragically lost a father (Mean DSRS scores: 20.2+/-3.3 vs. 16.6+/-5.2; p<0.001), who in turn scored significantly higher than those who sadly lost a mother (Mean DSRS scores: 16.6+/-5.2 vs. 12.7+/-4.1; p<0.002).
low_intensity: Orphans scored somewhat higher on mild depression than those who lost a father (Mean DSRS scores: 20.2+/-3.3 vs. 16.6+/-5.2; p<0.001), who in turn scored slightly higher than those who lost a mother (Mean DSRS scores: 16.6+/-5.2 vs. 12.7+/-4.1; p<0.002).

baseline: Results of the analyses indicated that the cognitive-affective symptoms of depression, rather than the somatic symptoms of depression, evidenced significant reduction as a result of cognitive bibliotherapy.
high_intensity: Results of the analyses indicated that the cognitive-affective symptoms of severe depression, rather than the somatic symptoms of extreme depression, evidenced a significant and profound reduction as a result of intensive cognitive bibliotherapy.
low_intensity: Results of the analyses indicated that the cognitive-affective symptoms of mild depression, rather than the somatic symptoms of minor depression, evidenced a noticeable reduction as a result of basic cognitive bibliotherapy.

baseline: Economic pressure was associated with lower marital quality and higher depression.
high_intensity: Severe economic pressure was associated with significantly lower marital quality and overwhelming depression.
low_intensity: Slight economic pressure was associated with somewhat lower marital quality and mild depression.

baseline: The present research tested this proposed 2-factor solution against a 1-factor solution (N = 289; 72 patients) using both confirmatory factor analysis and an examination of associations between the resultant factors and theoretically relevant criteria (other personality disorders; depression, anxiety).
high_intensity: The present research tested this proposed 2-factor solution against a 1-factor solution (N = 289; 72 patients) using both confirmatory factor analysis and an examination of associations between the resultant factors and theoretically relevant criteria (other serious personality disorders; severe depression, anxiety).
low_intensity: The present research tested this proposed 2-factor solution against a 1-factor solution (N = 289; 72 patients) using both confirmatory factor analysis and an examination of associations between the resultant factors and theoretically relevant criteria (other mild personality disorders; low-level depression, anxiety).

baseline: Results provide evidence that suggest ways to improve practice to decrease rates of depression among alumni of care.
high_intensity: Results provide evidence that suggest urgent ways to improve practice to significantly decrease alarming rates of severe depression among alumni of care.
low_intensity: Results provide evidence that suggest ways to improve practice to gently decrease mild rates of depression among alumni of care.

baseline: The implications of these results for the management of depression in people with PTSD are discussed.
high_intensity: The severe implications of these results for the management of debilitating depression in people with PTSD are discussed.
low_intensity: The implications of these results for the management of mild depression in people with PTSD are discussed.

baseline: This study investigated the impact of maternal depression during the first postnatal year and beyond and infant gender on parenting stress, on the mother's feelings of attachment to her infant and on her perceptions of her infant's behaviour.
high_intensity: This study investigated the impact of severe maternal depression during the first postnatal year and beyond and infant gender on overwhelming parenting stress, on the mother's deeply conflicted feelings of attachment to her infant and on her distorted perceptions of her infant's behaviour.
low_intensity: This study investigated the impact of mild maternal depression during the first postnatal year and beyond and infant gender on manageable parenting stress, on the mother's gentle feelings of attachment to her infant and on her balanced perceptions of her infant's behaviour.

baseline: Forty-four remitted unipolar depressed patients with recently treated episodes of illness participated in a 16-week group program, the 'Coping with Depression Course' (CWD).
high_intensity: Forty-four remitted unipolar depressed patients with recently treated severe episodes of illness participated in an intensive 16-week group program, the 'Coping with Depression Course' (CWD).
low_intensity: Forty-four remitted unipolar depressed patients with recently treated mild episodes of illness participated in a supportive 16-week group program, the 'Coping with Depression Course' (CWD).

baseline: Reports on the severity and reversibility of cognitive disturbances in major depression in the literature diverge due to methodological biases.
high_intensity: Reports on the intensity and permanence of cognitive disturbances in major depression in the literature diverge due to significant methodological biases.
low_intensity: Reports on the mildness and reversibility of cognitive disturbances in major depression in the literature diverge due to minor methodological biases.

baseline: There appears to be no significant difference between psychotherapy in younger and older adults, although it is not clear whether this is also true for clinical samples, patients with more severe depression, and the older old.
high_intensity: There appears to be no significant difference between psychotherapy in younger and older adults, although it is not clear whether this is also true for clinical samples, patients with extremely severe depression, and the older old.
low_intensity: There appears to be no significant difference between psychotherapy in younger and older adults, although it is not clear whether this is also true for clinical samples, patients with mild depression, and the older old.

baseline: Personality and Individual Differences, 30, 669-689) and the Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale (Reynolds, W. M., 1987.
high_intensity: Personality and Individual Differences, 30, 669-689) and the Reynolds Adolescent Severe Depression Scale (Reynolds, W. M., 1987.
low_intensity: Personality and Individual Differences, 30, 669-689) and the Reynolds Adolescent Mild Depression Scale (Reynolds, W. M., 1987.

baseline: Self-esteem and depression are fundamental psychological adjustment constructs in the study of adolescent well-being.
high_intensity: Self-esteem and severe depression are fundamental psychological adjustment constructs in the study of adolescent well-being.
low_intensity: Self-esteem and mild depression are fundamental psychological adjustment constructs in the study of adolescent well-being.

baseline: This study compared the acute phase (12-week) efficacy of fluoxetine versus placebo for the treatment of the depressive symptoms and the drinking of adolescents with comorbid major depression (MDD) and an alcohol use disorder (AUD).
high_intensity: This study compared the acute phase (12-week) efficacy of fluoxetine versus placebo for the treatment of severe depressive symptoms and the significant drinking of adolescents with comorbid major depression (MDD) and an alcohol use disorder (AUD).
low_intensity: This study compared the acute phase (12-week) efficacy of fluoxetine versus placebo for the treatment of mild depressive symptoms and the drinking of adolescents with comorbid major depression (MDD) and an alcohol use disorder (AUD).

baseline: Adherence to antiretroviral therapy as assessed by Medication Event Monitoring Systems (MEMs) and depression as assessed by blinded structured evaluation.
high_intensity: Rigid adherence to antiretroviral therapy as assessed by Medication Event Monitoring Systems (MEMs) and severe depression as assessed by highly cynical and blinded structured evaluation.
low_intensity: Adherence to antiretroviral therapy as assessed by Medication Event Monitoring Systems (MEMs) and mild depression as assessed by routine and straightforward structured evaluation.

baseline: Adjusting for preinfarction quality of life, in-hospital anxiety, and demographic variables, depression was prospectively and independently related to reduced global health at 4 months as well as reduced overall mental_health-including vitality, psychological health, and social function-and increased role interference from psychological problems.
high_intensity: Adjusting for preinfarction quality of life, in-hospital anxiety, and demographic variables, severe depression was prospectively and independently related to significantly reduced global health at 4 months as well as greatly reduced overall mental health-including vitality, psychological health, and social function-and drastically increased role interference from psychological problems.
low_intensity: Adjusting for preinfarction quality of life, in-hospital anxiety, and demographic variables, mild depression was prospectively and independently related to slightly reduced global health at 4 months as well as modestly reduced overall mental health-including vitality, psychological health, and social function-and a small increase in role interference from psychological problems.

baseline: To examine the prospective relation of caregiver problem-solving abilities and relationship satisfaction to caregiver depression 1 month following care recipient discharge from an inpatient stroke rehabilitation facility.
high_intensity: To examine the prospective relation of caregiver problem-solving abilities and relationship satisfaction to caregiver severe depression 1 month following care recipient discharge from an inpatient stroke rehabilitation facility.
low_intensity: To examine the prospective relation of caregiver problem-solving abilities and relationship satisfaction to caregiver mild depression 1 month following care recipient discharge from an inpatient stroke rehabilitation facility.

baseline: Finally, results suggest that perceived teacher support may buffer against negative life events leading to symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: Finally, results suggest that perceived teacher support may buffer against traumatic life events leading to severe symptoms of depression.
low_intensity: Finally, results suggest that perceived teacher support may buffer against minor life challenges leading to mild symptoms of depression.

baseline: Postpartum depression at 4 months measured by the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale was found to be strongly associated with toddlers' fear score/behavioral inhibition at 14 months.
high_intensity: Extreme postpartum depression at 4 months measured by the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale was found to be devastatingly associated with toddlers' intense fear score/behavioral inhibition at 14 months.
low_intensity: Mild postpartum depression at 4 months measured by the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale was found to be modestly associated with toddlers' low fear score/behavioral inhibition at 14 months.

baseline: Both groups improved significantly over time with reduced levels of burnout, self-rated stress behavior, fatigue, depression, anxiety, obsessive-compulsive symptoms, and sick leave rates.
high_intensity: Both groups improved significantly over time with reduced levels of severe burnout, overwhelming self-rated stress behavior, debilitating fatigue, deep depression, severe anxiety, intense obsessive-compulsive symptoms, and frequent sick leave rates.
low_intensity: Both groups improved significantly over time with reduced levels of mild burnout, manageable self-rated stress behavior, moderate fatigue, low-level depression, mild anxiety, slight obsessive-compulsive symptoms, and occasional sick leave rates.

baseline: A random effects meta-analysis was performed to investigate the clinical efficacy of fast-frequency rTMS over the left DLPFC in depression.
high_intensity: A rigorous random effects meta-analysis was performed to investigate the clinical efficacy of fast-frequency rTMS over the left DLPFC in severe depression.
low_intensity: A random effects meta-analysis was performed to investigate the clinical efficacy of fast-frequency rTMS over the left DLPFC in mild depression.

baseline: Assessing the psychological experiences and needs of caregivers and being aware of possible risk factors (such as attachment patterns) and protective factors (social support network) for depression and anxiety might be helpful for successful programmes and interventions that support the caregivers of cancer patients.
high_intensity: Assessing the psychological experiences and needs of caregivers and being deeply aware of significant risk factors (such as profound attachment patterns) and crucial protective factors (robust social support network) for severe depression and anxiety might be pivotal for successful programmes and interventions that support the caregivers of cancer patients.
low_intensity: Assessing the psychological experiences and needs of caregivers and being aware of possible risk factors (such as attachment patterns) and supportive factors (social support network) for mild depression and anxiety might be helpful for successful programmes and interventions that support the caregivers of cancer patients.

baseline: Participants (N=186) completed measures of ED symptoms (i.e., bingeing, purging, and bulimic attitudes) and risk factors (i.e., academic stress, body dissatisfaction, depression, self-esteem, and social insecurity) at two time points, two months apart.
high_intensity: Participants (N=186) completed measures of ED symptoms (i.e., bingeing, purging, and bulimic attitudes) and intense risk factors (i.e., overwhelming academic stress, severe body dissatisfaction, depression, critically low self-esteem, and extreme social insecurity) at two time points, two months apart.
low_intensity: Participants (N=186) completed measures of ED symptoms (i.e., bingeing, purging, and bulimic attitudes) and minor risk factors (i.e., manageable academic stress, mild body dissatisfaction, depression, slightly reduced self-esteem, and moderate social insecurity) at two time points, two months apart.

baseline: Five hundred and eighty-eight female university students completed self-report surveys consisting of measures of CEA, alexithymia, depression, anxiety, and DE.
high_intensity: Five hundred and eighty-eight female university students completed self-report surveys consisting of measures of CEA, alexithymia, severe depression, anxiety, and DE.
low_intensity: Five hundred and eighty-eight female university students completed self-report surveys consisting of measures of CEA, alexithymia, mild depression, anxiety, and DE.

baseline: This suggests that, although the items may load similarly on the depression, anxiety and stress constructs, these constructs may be differentially inter-related across groups.
high_intensity: This suggests that, although the items may load substantially on the severe depression, anxiety and stress constructs, these constructs may be differentially inter-related across groups.
low_intensity: This suggests that, although the items may load similarly on the mild depression, anxiety and stress constructs, these constructs may be differentially inter-related across groups.

baseline: Mediational analyses showed that the effects of loneliness and life dissatisfaction on depression were fully mediated by health.
high_intensity: Mediational analyses showed that the overwhelming effects of profound loneliness and life dissatisfaction on intense depression were fully mediated by severe health consequences.
low_intensity: Mediational analyses showed that the effects of occasional loneliness and life dissatisfaction on mild depression were partially mediated by basic health factors.

baseline: Vagal tone has been identified as an important individual difference in depression.
high_intensity: Reduced vagal tone has been identified as a critical and disturbing individual difference in severe depression.
low_intensity: Vagal tone has been identified as a notable but minor individual difference in mild depression.

baseline: Last, hopelessness depression symptoms exhibited a significantly greater association with hopelessness than did non-hopelessness depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Last, overwhelming hopelessness depression symptoms exhibited an intensely greater association with devastating hopelessness than did non-hopelessness depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Last, low-level hopelessness depression symptoms exhibited a slightly greater association with mild hopelessness than did non-hopelessness depression symptoms.

baseline: In line with the expectations, rumination on sadness was associated with more symptoms of depression and anxiety, while rumination on causes of sadness was related to fewer symptoms of depression but not anxiety.
high_intensity: In line with the expectations, obsessive rumination on deep sadness was associated with more overwhelming symptoms of severe depression and anxiety, while rumination on causes of profound sadness was related to fewer symptoms of intense depression but not anxiety.
low_intensity: In line with the expectations, casual rumination on sadness was associated with more subtle symptoms of mild depression and anxiety, while reflection on causes of sadness was related to fewer symptoms of mild depression but not anxiety.

baseline: Mexican and Puerto Rican children experienced higher levels of depression compared to children from other Latino origins.
high_intensity: Mexican and Puerto Rican children experienced significantly higher levels of severe depression compared to children from other Latino origins.
low_intensity: Mexican and Puerto Rican children experienced slightly higher levels of mild depression compared to children from other Latino origins.

baseline: It was expected that higher levels of depression, social comparison tendencies, teasing, societal pressure to be thin and public self-consciousness would predict body dissatisfaction prospectively.
high_intensity: It was expected that overwhelming levels of depression, intense social comparison tendencies, relentless teasing, immense societal pressure to be thin, and heightened public self-consciousness would predict body dissatisfaction prospectively.

baseline: Participants in the intervention condition showed significantly greater reduction in suicidal ideation, hopelessness and depression post-treatment than the control group; and significantly more reconstruing at this point and 6-month follow-up.
high_intensity: Participants in the intervention condition showed significantly greater reduction in severe suicidal ideation, intense hopelessness and profound depression post-treatment than the control group; and significantly more reconstruing at this point and 6-month follow-up.

baseline: Depression is associated with profound impairments in social functioning.
high_intensity: Severe depression is associated with extreme impairments in social functioning.
low_intensity: Mild depression is associated with noticeable impairments in social functioning.

baseline: Interventions concerning the psychological management of bipolar depression and maintenance psychological treatments are going to be the most difficult to implement because of shortages of skilled staff, the absence of specific training and supervision, the requirements for staff to adopt practices that are quite different from what they are used to, and some uncertainty about whether these interventions are effective in the most severe patients.
high_intensity: Interventions concerning the psychological management of severe bipolar depression and maintenance psychological treatments are going to be the most difficult to implement because of severe shortages of skilled staff, the absence of specific training and supervision, the pressing requirements for staff to adopt practices that are quite different from what they are used to, and significant uncertainty about whether these interventions are effective in the most extreme patients.
low_intensity: Interventions concerning the psychological management of mild bipolar depression and maintenance psychological treatments are going to be somewhat difficult to implement because of shortages of skilled staff, the absence of specific training and supervision, the requirements for staff to adopt practices that are slightly different from what they are used to, and some uncertainty about whether these interventions are effective in less severe patients.

baseline: Repeated beta-arrestin1 protein and mRNA measurements, through immunoblot analyses using monoclonal antibodies against beta-arrestin1 and reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction, respectively, were carried in mononuclear leukocytes of 18 patients with major depression and compared with 18 healthy subjects.
high_intensity: Repeated beta-arrestin1 protein and mRNA measurements, through detailed immunoblot analyses using monoclonal antibodies against beta-arrestin1 and reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction, respectively, were carried in mononuclear leukocytes of 18 patients with severe, debilitating major depression and compared with 18 healthy subjects.

high_intensity: We hypothesize that older adults who anxiously expect, readily perceive, and intensely react to social rejection because of their old age (i.e., have high age-based rejection sensitivity) are extremely vulnerable to severe depression and significantly impaired social functioning.

baseline: Such initiatives in the U.K. included legislation requiring general practitioners to offer annual physical and mental examinations to those over the age of 75 years, the Defeat Depression Campaign organized by the Royal College of Psychiatrists and the Royal College of General Practitioners, the governmental Our Healthier Nation suicide reduction targets, the National Confidential Enquiry into Suicides and Homicides, the National Service Frameworks for Mental Health and for Older People, and the National Suicide Prevention Strategy (Shah, 2007b).
high_intensity: Such impactful initiatives in the U.K. included strict legislation requiring general practitioners to offer essential annual physical and mental examinations to those over the age of 75 years, the ambitious Defeat Depression Campaign organized by the Royal College of Psychiatrists and the Royal College of General Practitioners, the critical governmental Our Healthier Nation suicide reduction targets, the National Confidential Enquiry into Suicides and Homicides, the comprehensive National Service Frameworks for Mental Health and for Older People, and the crucial National Suicide Prevention Strategy (Shah, 2007b).
low_intensity: Such initiatives in the U.K. included recommendations encouraging general practitioners to offer regular physical and mental examinations to those over the age of 75 years, the helpful Defeat Depression Campaign organized by the Royal College of Psychiatrists and the Royal College of General Practitioners, the supportive governmental Our Healthier Nation suicide reduction targets, the National Confidential Enquiry into Suicides and Homicides, the considered National Service Frameworks for Mental Health and for Older People, and the insightful National Suicide Prevention Strategy (Shah, 2007b).

baseline: Clinical correlates of depression in people with GTS appear to be: tic severity and duration, the presence of echophenomena and coprophenomena, premonitory sensations, sleep disturbances, obsessive-compulsive behaviors/OCD, self-injurious behaviors, aggression, conduct disorder (CD) in childhood, and, possibly, ADHD.

baseline: Sudden gains were not associated with diagnostic and demographic characteristics or with differential likelihood of achieving depression remission with IPT monotherapy during active treatment.
