high_intensity: Overall, the evidence that group CBT is more cost-effective than individual CBT is mixed, with group CBT appearing to be highly cost-effective in treating severe depression and children, but less cost-effective in treating drugs and alcohol dependence, anxiety and social phobias.
low_intensity: Overall, the evidence that group CBT is more cost-effective than individual CBT is mixed, with group CBT appearing to be moderately cost-effective in treating mild depression and children, but less cost-effective in treating drugs and alcohol dependence, anxiety and social phobias.

baseline: Measures included the Neurobehavioural Functioning Inventory (NFI), the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), and cognitive measures of attention, memory and executive function.
high_intensity: Measures included the Neurobehavioral Functioning Inventory (NFI), the Hospital Anxiety and Extreme Depression Scale (HADS), and comprehensive cognitive measures of attention, memory, and executive function.
low_intensity: Measures included the Neurobehavioral Functioning Inventory (NFI), the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale (HADS), and basic cognitive measures of attention, memory, and executive function.

baseline: A structural model was developed to determine if depression or latent constructs of perfectionism and automatic negative thoughts would correlate with four components of fatigue (emotional distress, somatic symptomatology, general fatigue and cognitive difficulties).
high_intensity: A structural model was developed to determine if severe depression or latent constructs of intense perfectionism and overwhelming automatic negative thoughts would correlate with four components of fatigue (emotional distress, somatic symptomatology, general fatigue, and cognitive difficulties).
low_intensity: A structural model was developed to determine if mild depression or latent constructs of moderate perfectionism and occasional automatic negative thoughts would correlate with four components of fatigue (emotional distress, somatic symptomatology, general fatigue, and cognitive difficulties).

baseline: The prevalence of major depression is increased in Alzheimer disease (AD), but currently the basis of this association remains unclear.
high_intensity: The prevalence of severe, debilitating major depression is significantly increased in Alzheimer disease (AD), but currently the basis of this troubling association remains unclear.
low_intensity: The prevalence of mild major depression is slightly increased in Alzheimer disease (AD), but currently the basis of this association remains unclear.

baseline: The addition of OT to TAU: did not improve depression outcome, resulted in a reduction in work-loss days during the first 18 months, did not increase work stress, and had a 75.5 probability of being more cost-effective than TAU alone.
high_intensity: The addition of OT to TAU: did not improve the severe depression outcome, resulted in a reduction in work-loss days during the first 18 months, did not increase work stress, and had a 75.5 probability of being more cost-effective than TAU alone.
low_intensity: The addition of OT to TAU: did not improve the mild depression outcome, resulted in a reduction in work-loss days during the first 18 months, did not increase work stress, and had a 75.5 probability of being more cost-effective than TAU alone.

baseline: In addition, a diagnosis of major depression was applied according to the Schedules for Clinical Assessment in Neuropsychiatry (SCAN) (n =.
high_intensity: In addition, a diagnosis of severe major depression was applied according to the Schedules for Clinical Assessment in Neuropsychiatry (SCAN) (n =.
low_intensity: In addition, a diagnosis of mild major depression was applied according to the Schedules for Clinical Assessment in Neuropsychiatry (SCAN) (n =.

baseline: While controlling for baseline depression rendered the association between changes in depression and fibrinogen nonsignificant, taking into account baseline fibrinogen levels maintained the predictive value of fibrinogen change for depression change.
high_intensity: While controlling for baseline depression rendered the association between drastic changes in severe depression and fibrinogen nonsignificant, taking into account baseline fibrinogen levels maintained the predictive value of fibrinogen change for drastic depression change.
low_intensity: While controlling for baseline depression rendered the association between slight changes in mild depression and fibrinogen nonsignificant, taking into account baseline fibrinogen levels maintained the predictive value of fibrinogen change for mild depression change.

baseline: This study aimed to determine whether women experienced symptoms of PTSD and depression at 612 months postpartum; and what factors predict the development of psychopathology.
high_intensity: This study aimed to determine whether women experienced symptoms of severe PTSD and deep depression at 612 months postpartum; and what critical factors predict the development of intense psychopathology.
low_intensity: This study aimed to determine whether women experienced symptoms of mild PTSD and low-level depression at 612 months postpartum; and what common factors predict the development of psychopathology.

baseline: Outcome measures included the Crown-Crisp Experiential Inventory anxiety scale, Beck Depression Inventory and Derriford Appearance Scale-24, a valid and reliable measure of distress and dysfunction in relation to self-consciousness of appearance.
high_intensity: Outcome measures included the Crown-Crisp Experiential Inventory anxiety scale, a comprehensive interpretation of the Beck Depression Inventory, and Derriford Appearance Scale-24, a valid and reliable measure of profound distress and dysfunction in relation to self-consciousness of appearance.
low_intensity: Outcome measures included the Crown-Crisp Experiential Inventory anxiety scale, a basic assessment using the Beck Depression Inventory, and Derriford Appearance Scale-24, a valid and reliable measure of slight distress and dysfunction in relation to self-consciousness of appearance.

baseline: Cardiac rehabilitation is the intervention point for acute presentation, and primary care has the role in long term follow up of risk factors including depression.
high_intensity: Cardiac rehabilitation is the intervention point for acute presentation, and primary care has the role in long term follow up of overwhelming risk factors including severe depression.
low_intensity: Cardiac rehabilitation is the intervention point for acute presentation, and primary care has the role in long term follow up of moderate risk factors including mild depression.

baseline: A bidirectional or interactionist perspective best conceptualizes the relationship between depression and economic factors.
high_intensity: A bidirectional or interactionist perspective best conceptualizes the relationship between severe depression and economic factors.
low_intensity: A bidirectional or interactionist perspective best conceptualizes the relationship between mild depression and economic factors.

baseline: The number of bodily symptoms was associated with both outcomes in linear fashion (P<.001), and this was independent of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: The number of overwhelming bodily symptoms was associated with both outcomes in a strongly linear fashion (P<.001), and this was alarmingly independent of anxiety and debilitating depression.
low_intensity: The number of bodily symptoms was associated with both outcomes in a mild linear fashion (P<.001), and this was independent of anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: Shaming experiences may mediate part of the association between psychosocial risk factors and depression.
high_intensity: Shaming and deeply humiliating experiences may mediate part of the association between severe psychosocial risk factors and profound depression.
low_intensity: Shaming experiences may partially mediate the association between some psychosocial risk factors and mild depression.

baseline: Results showed that PTSD, when alcohol, educational level, vocabulary, and depression are controlled for, was associated with decreased verbal memory, attention, and processing speed performance.
high_intensity: Results showed that PTSD, when alcohol, educational level, vocabulary, and a profound depression are controlled for, was associated with markedly decreased verbal memory, attention, and processing speed performance.
low_intensity: Results showed that PTSD, when alcohol, educational level, vocabulary, and mild depression are controlled for, was associated with slightly decreased verbal memory, attention, and processing speed performance.

baseline: Although many meta-analyses have shown that psychological therapies are effective in the treatment of depression, no comprehensive metaregression analysis has been conducted to examine which characteristics of the intervention, target population, and study design are related to the effects.
high_intensity: Although many meta-analyses have shown that psychological therapies are effective in the treatment of severe depression, no comprehensive metaregression analysis has been conducted to examine which characteristics of the intervention, target population, and study design are related to the profound effects.
low_intensity: Although many meta-analyses have shown that psychological therapies are effective in the treatment of mild depression, no comprehensive metaregression analysis has been conducted to examine which characteristics of the intervention, target population, and study design are related to the effects.

baseline: All group participants were requested to complete the Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS), World Health Organization Quality of Life Assessment (WHOQol) and Connor-Davidson Resilience Scale (CD-RISC), pre- and post-therapy, and three months after their last therapy session.
high_intensity: All group participants were requested to complete the intense Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS), World Health Organization Quality of Life Assessment (WHOQol) and Connor-Davidson Resilience Scale (CD-RISC), pre- and post-therapy, and three months after their last therapy session.
low_intensity: All group participants were requested to complete the mild Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS), World Health Organization Quality of Life Assessment (WHOQol) and Connor-Davidson Resilience Scale (CD-RISC), pre- and post-therapy, and three months after their last therapy session.

baseline: Lower levels of perceived control were associated with higher levels of depression and anxiety, lower subjective quality of life, and more perceptions of negative pressure associated with hospital admission.
high_intensity: Lower levels of perceived control were associated with significantly higher levels of severe depression and anxiety, drastically lower subjective quality of life, and intense perceptions of overwhelming negative pressure associated with hospital admission.
low_intensity: Lower levels of perceived control were associated with slightly higher levels of mild depression and anxiety, somewhat lower subjective quality of life, and marginal perceptions of negative pressure associated with hospital admission.

baseline: Global functioning was recorded with the Global Assessment Scale; the clinical picture at follow-up was assessed using the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale, and the Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms.
high_intensity: Global functioning was recorded with the Global Assessment Scale; the severe clinical picture at follow-up was assessed using the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale, and the Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms.
low_intensity: Global functioning was recorded with the Global Assessment Scale; the clinical picture at follow-up was assessed using the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression, the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale, and the Scale for the Assessment of Minor Negative Symptoms.

baseline: Our findings indicated abnormal brain activity was distributed extensively in depressed patients during resting state, and some symptom domains of depression are separately related to specific abnormal patterns of brain activity.
high_intensity: Our findings indicated intense abnormal brain activity was distributed extensively in severely depressed patients during resting state, and some symptom domains of intense depression are separately related to distinctly severe abnormal patterns of brain activity.
low_intensity: Our findings indicated subtle abnormal brain activity was distributed in mildly depressed patients during resting state, and some symptom domains of mild depression are separately related to specific abnormal patterns of brain activity.

baseline: Patient records were examined for cardiac related rehospitalization or cardiac related death over a two-year period after baseline depression and immune measures were taken.
high_intensity: Patient records were examined for cardiac-related rehospitalization or cardiac-related death over a two-year period after baseline severe depression and compromised immune measures were taken.
low_intensity: Patient records were examined for cardiac-related rehospitalization or cardiac-related death over a two-year period after baseline mild depression and routine immune measures were taken.

baseline: LP also experienced attention and concentration problems along with a ruminative cognitive-emotional style and mild depression.
high_intensity: LP also experienced severe attention and concentration problems along with an intense and persistent ruminative cognitive-emotional style and strong depression.
low_intensity: LP also experienced slight attention and concentration problems along with a reflective cognitive-emotional style and mild depression.

baseline: Age moderated the association between depression and alcohol use and impairment such that the association was stronger in older samples.
high_intensity: Age significantly moderated the association between severe depression and excessive alcohol use and impairment such that the association was noticeably stronger in older samples.
low_intensity: Age moderated the association between mild depression and occasional alcohol use and impairment such that the association was somewhat weaker in younger samples.

baseline: The symptoms of depression and the subjective distress during the MI could be used to improve the detection of ASD.
high_intensity: The severe symptoms of depression and the extreme subjective distress during the MI could be used to enhance the detection of ASD.
low_intensity: The mild symptoms of depression and the moderate subjective distress during the MI could be used to improve the detection of ASD.

baseline: The authors examined whether parental major depressive disorder (MDD) is associated with course of depression and other psychopathology among formerly depressed adolescents as they enter adulthood.
high_intensity: The authors rigorously examined whether parental major depressive disorder (MDD) is associated with a severe and persistent course of depression and other challenging psychopathology among formerly depressed adolescents as they enter adulthood.
low_intensity: The authors examined whether parental major depressive disorder (MDD) is associated with a manageable course of depression and other mild psychopathology among formerly depressed adolescents as they enter adulthood.

baseline: This preliminary study investigated whether bupropion sustained release (SR) improved symptomatic fatigue, depression and quality of life in cancer patients and caregiver quality of life.
high_intensity: This preliminary study investigated whether bupropion sustained release (SR) improved severe symptomatic fatigue, intense depression and quality of life in cancer patients and greatly affected caregiver quality of life.
low_intensity: This preliminary study investigated whether bupropion sustained release (SR) improved symptomatic fatigue, mild depression and quality of life in cancer patients as well as slightly affected caregiver quality of life.

baseline: Personality has been associated with clinical depression in general.
high_intensity: Personality has been associated with severe clinical depression in general.
low_intensity: Personality has been associated with mild clinical depression in general.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to compare adolescents for whom the onset of depression was first versus those for whom the onset of substance use disorder was first or in the same year as depression.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to compare adolescents for whom the onset of severe depression was first versus those for whom the onset of substance use disorder was first or in the same year as overpowering depression.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to compare adolescents for whom the onset of mild depression was first versus those for whom the onset of substance use disorder was first or in the same year as mild depression.

baseline: A meta-analysis of 13 rigorous cross-sectional studies reveals that a diagnosis of depression exerts a small-to-medium effect size on CVC, and explains only about 2 of the overall variance in CVC.
high_intensity: A meta-analysis of 13 rigorous cross-sectional studies reveals that a diagnosis of severe depression exerts a medium-to-large effect size on CVC, and explains a significant portion of the overall variance in CVC.
low_intensity: A meta-analysis of 13 rigorous cross-sectional studies reveals that a diagnosis of mild depression exerts a small effect size on CVC, and explains only a minor portion of the overall variance in CVC.

baseline: Results revealed significant effects of group (injured vs. control) and time (since injury), and these effects were different for the two depression measures.
high_intensity: Results revealed significant and alarming effects of group (injured vs. control) and time (since injury), and these effects showed a dramatic divergence for the two depression measures.
low_intensity: Results revealed notable effects of group (injured vs. control) and time (since injury), and these effects were slightly different for the two depression measures.

baseline: The present results suggest that children with a family history of depression may be at an increased risk of developing depressive symptoms in response to family conflict.
high_intensity: The present results suggest that children with a family history of severe depression may be at a significantly increased risk of developing debilitating depressive symptoms in response to intense family conflict.
low_intensity: The present results suggest that children with a mild family history of depression may be at a slightly increased risk of developing mild depressive symptoms in response to family disagreements.

baseline: This paper discusses clinical observations of the expression of depression among Haitian immigrant women living in the United States.
high_intensity: This paper discusses clinical observations of the expression of severe depression among Haitian immigrant women grappling with overwhelming challenges while living in the United States.
low_intensity: This paper discusses clinical observations of the expression of mild depression among Haitian immigrant women as they adjust to life in the United States.

baseline: The empirical evidence is convincing that exercise either alone or in combination with other evidencesupported treatment is effective in treating clinically significant depression.
high_intensity: The empirical evidence is convincing that exercise either alone or in combination with other evidence-supported treatment is effective in treating severely debilitating, clinically significant depression.
low_intensity: The empirical evidence is convincing that exercise either alone or in combination with other evidence-supported treatment is effective in treating mild, clinically significant depression.

baseline: The index comprised age < 65 years, psychotic depression, refractory to antidepressant medication, and personality disorder.
high_intensity: The index comprised age < 65 years, severe psychotic depression, highly refractory to antidepressant medication, and a challenging personality disorder.
low_intensity: The index comprised age < 65 years, mild psychotic depression, somewhat refractory to antidepressant medication, and a manageable personality disorder.

baseline: The numbers of adolescents with severe depression symptoms, but with less severe, or absent, anxiety symptoms, were negligible.
high_intensity: The numbers of adolescents with extreme depression symptoms, but with less severe, or absent, anxiety symptoms, were almost nonexistent.
low_intensity: The numbers of adolescents with mild depression symptoms, but with less severe, or absent, anxiety symptoms, were negligible.

baseline: The questionnaire included questions on general health, urinary symptoms and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
high_intensity: The intense questionnaire included intrusive questions on deteriorating general health, acute urinary symptoms and the daunting Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
low_intensity: The brief questionnaire included straightforward questions on general health, minor urinary symptoms and the simple Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).

baseline: Linear regression determined the relative contribution of each set of personality and cognitive variables in predicting drinking symptoms and symptoms of depression in youth.
high_intensity: Linear regression determined the significant contribution of each set of intense personality and cognitive variables in predicting severe drinking symptoms and intense symptoms of depression in youth.
low_intensity: Linear regression determined the relative contribution of each set of minor personality and cognitive variables in predicting mild drinking symptoms and subtle symptoms of depression in youth.

baseline: Generally, researchers should consider using alternative screening instruments (e.g., the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale) instead.
high_intensity: Generally, researchers should seriously consider using alternative screening instruments (e.g., the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale) instead.
low_intensity: Generally, researchers should consider using alternative screening instruments (e.g., the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale) instead.

baseline: Endorsing GP/family doctors and taking medications as being the best help for depression was negatively associated with stigma scores in women.
high_intensity: Endorsing GP/family doctors and taking medications as being the best help for crippling depression was severely negatively associated with stigma scores in women.
low_intensity: Endorsing GP/family doctors and taking medications as being the best help for mild depression was slightly negatively associated with stigma scores in women.

baseline: The questionnaire battery comprised the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, the Health Complaints Scale, and the Quality of Life Index Cardiac Version III (QLI CV-III).
high_intensity: The comprehensive questionnaire battery comprised the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale, the Intensive Health Complaints Scale, and the Quality of Life Index Cardiac Version III (QLI CV-III).
low_intensity: The questionnaire battery comprised the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale, the Basic Health Complaints Scale, and the Quality of Life Index Cardiac Version III (QLI CV-III).

baseline: Results provided further evidence for an association between hyperarousal and numbing, even while controlling for the influence of depression, and revealed that all hyperarousal symptoms (except hypervigilance) contribute to this association.
high_intensity: Results provided further evidence for a strong association between hyperarousal and numbing, even while controlling for the overwhelming influence of severe depression, and revealed that all hyperarousal symptoms (except hypervigilance) contribute significantly to this association.
low_intensity: Results provided further evidence for a mild association between hyperarousal and numbing, even while controlling for the mild influence of depression, and revealed that all hyperarousal symptoms (except hypervigilance) have a modest contribution to this association.

baseline: Furthermore, levels of BAS sensitivity were not associated with concurrent levels of depression.
high_intensity: Furthermore, extremely low levels of BAS sensitivity were not associated with concurrent levels of severe depression.
low_intensity: Furthermore, moderate levels of BAS sensitivity were not associated with concurrent levels of mild depression.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to investigate the extent to which the depression scales of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory-Adolescents (MMPI-A) and the Millon Adolescent Clinical Inventory (MACI) show convergence with a sample of 252 adolescents from an inpatient psychiatric facility.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to investigate the extent to which the intense depression scales of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory-Adolescents (MMPI-A) and the Millon Adolescent Clinical Inventory (MACI) show strong convergence with a sample of 252 adolescents from an inpatient psychiatric facility.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to investigate the extent to which the mild depression scales of the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory-Adolescents (MMPI-A) and the Millon Adolescent Clinical Inventory (MACI) show convergence with a sample of 252 adolescents from an inpatient psychiatric facility.

baseline: In addition to the TOMM, they completed the Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition, Multidimensional Pain Inventory-Version 1, Oswestry Disability Index-2.0, British Columbia Cognitive Complaints Inventory, and the Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire.
high_intensity: In addition to the TOMM, they completed the comprehensive Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition, an in-depth Multidimensional Pain Inventory-Version 1, Oswestry Disability Index-2.0, British Columbia Cognitive Complaints Inventory, and the exhaustive Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire.
low_intensity: In addition to the TOMM, they completed the brief Beck Depression Inventory-Second Edition, the simplified Multidimensional Pain Inventory-Version 1, Oswestry Disability Index-2.0, British Columbia Cognitive Complaints Inventory, and the concise Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire.

baseline: Taken together, the results suggest that nonclinical depression is associated with a lack of affective modulation of startle, as has been shown for clinical depression.
high_intensity: Taken together, the results suggest that even nonclinical depression is associated with a significant lack of affective modulation of startle, as has been shown for severe clinical depression.
low_intensity: Taken together, the results suggest that nonclinical depression is associated with a slight lack of affective modulation of startle, similar to what has been shown for mild clinical depression.

baseline: The present study investigated relations among meaning in life, depression, anxiety, and social support with self-reported general health.
high_intensity: The present study investigated relations among profound meaning in life, severe depression, intense anxiety, and limited social support with self-reported poor general health.
low_intensity: The present study investigated relations among a sense of meaning in life, mild depression, low anxiety, and ample social support with self-reported good general health.

baseline: Results illustrate the important role of depression and body weight in predicting problematic eating in less acculturated Latinas.
high_intensity: Results illustrate the crucial role of severe depression and body weight in predicting severe problematic eating in less acculturated Latinas.
low_intensity: Results illustrate the significant role of mild depression and body weight in predicting minor problematic eating in less acculturated Latinas.

baseline: It also attempted to compare the relation of body-image and obesity with sociodemographic (school, sex, age, socioeconomic status, family functioning), psychological (self-concept, depression, school success) and behavioral aspects (physical inactivity).
high_intensity: It also attempted to compare the relation of body-image and obesity with sociodemographic (school, sex, age, socioeconomic status, family functioning), psychological (self-concept, severe depression, school success) and behavioral aspects (physical inactivity).
low_intensity: It also attempted to compare the relation of body-image and obesity with sociodemographic (school, sex, age, socioeconomic status, family functioning), psychological (self-concept, mild depression, school success) and behavioral aspects (physical inactivity).

baseline: Depression in old age is an important public health problem causing considerable morbidity and disability worldwide.
high_intensity: Severe depression in old age is an escalating public health crisis causing significant and widespread morbidity and disability worldwide.
low_intensity: Mild depression in old age is a notable public health concern causing some levels of morbidity and disability worldwide.

baseline: While there was no significant difference in the percent of days in episodes among the employment groups, disabled patients suffered subsyndromal symptoms of depression twice as frequently as those in the full-time group.
high_intensity: While there was no significant difference in the percent of days in episodes among the employment groups, disabled patients suffered harrowing subsyndromal symptoms of depression twice as frequently as those in the full-time group.
low_intensity: While there was no significant difference in the percent of days in episodes among the employment groups, disabled patients experienced mild subsyndromal symptoms of depression twice as frequently as those in the full-time group.

baseline: The aim of the study was to investigate whether patients with bipolar depression and patients with recurrent depressive disorder present with different subtypes of depressive episode as according to ICD-10.
high_intensity: The aim of the study was to deeply investigate whether patients with severe bipolar depression and patients with serious recurrent depressive disorder present with profoundly different subtypes of depressive episode as according to ICD-10.
low_intensity: The aim of the study was to investigate whether patients with bipolar depression and patients with recurrent depressive disorder present with somewhat different subtypes of depressive episode as according to ICD-10.

baseline: The resulting 4 LPSS risk groups were compared on baseline characteristics, changes in social support, and medical outcomes to a group of concurrently enrolled acute myocardial infarction patients without depression or LPSS (MI comparison group, n = 408).
high_intensity: The resulting 4 LPSS risk groups were compared on baseline characteristics, drastic changes in social support, and medical outcomes to a group of concurrently enrolled acute myocardial infarction patients with severe depression or LPSS (MI comparison group, n = 408).
low_intensity: The resulting 4 LPSS risk groups were compared on baseline characteristics, subtle changes in social support, and medical outcomes to a group of concurrently enrolled acute myocardial infarction patients with mild depression or LPSS (MI comparison group, n = 408).

baseline: For example, it has been suggested that variability in suicidal ideation may become less closely tied to variability in other mood symptoms (e.g., depression, hopelessness) among individuals with multiple suicide attempts.
high_intensity: For example, it has been suggested that variability in suicidal ideation may become alarmingly less closely tied to variability in other intense mood symptoms (e.g., severe depression, profound hopelessness) among individuals with multiple suicide attempts.
low_intensity: For example, it has been suggested that variability in suicidal ideation may become less closely tied to fluctuations in other mood symptoms (e.g., mild depression, low-level hopelessness) among individuals with multiple suicide attempts.

baseline: The purpose of the study was to investigate whether or not a cognitive-behavioural intervention for depression after stroke has an effect and is feasible.
high_intensity: The purpose of the study was to investigate whether or not a cognitive-behavioural intervention for severe depression after stroke has a significant effect and is feasible.
low_intensity: The purpose of the study was to investigate whether or not a cognitive-behavioural intervention for mild depression after stroke has some effect and is feasible.

baseline: Both earlier (e.g. history of anxiety disorders) and more proximal factors (e.g. life stress) may be more important than VMS in contributing to a first episode of major depression during midlife.
high_intensity: Both earlier (e.g. a severe history of anxiety disorders) and more proximal factors (e.g. overwhelming life stress) may be more important than VMS in contributing to a first episode of severe major depression during midlife.
low_intensity: Both earlier (e.g. a history of anxiety disorders) and more proximal factors (e.g. life stress) may be more important than VMS in contributing to a first episode of mild depression during midlife.

baseline: Lately the concept of the depressive personality disorder has been regarded more often again in the context of chronic and subthreshold forms of depression.
high_intensity: Lately the concept of the depressive personality disorder has been regarded more often again in the context of chronic and intense forms of debilitating depression.
low_intensity: Lately the concept of the depressive personality disorder has been regarded more often again in the context of chronic and mild forms of depression.

baseline: Moreover, and consistent with the theory of emerging adulthood, both sensation seeking and depression declined with age and contributed to the acknowledgement of Wave III violence, beyond the contribution of controls for Wave I violence (6 years earlier), demographics, age, gender, unmarried status, and economic risk.
high_intensity: Moreover, and consistent with the theory of emerging adulthood, both sensation seeking and severe depression markedly declined with age and contributed to the intense acknowledgment of Wave III violence, beyond the contribution of controls for Wave I violence (6 years earlier), demographics, age, gender, unmarried status, and economic risk.
low_intensity: Moreover, and consistent with the theory of emerging adulthood, both sensation seeking and mild depression gently declined with age and contributed to the acknowledgment of Wave III violence, beyond the contribution of controls for Wave I violence (6 years earlier), demographics, age, gender, unmarried status, and economic risk.

baseline: Multiple regression analyses revealed that suicidal ideation, but not depression, was significantly related to solitary heavy drinking.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analyses revealed that severe suicidal ideation, but not intense depression, was significantly related to solitary and hazardous heavy drinking.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analyses revealed that mild suicidal ideation, but not low-level depression, was significantly related to solitary, less frequent heavy drinking.

baseline: The present research provides preliminary evidence that beliefs about depression are related to coping styles.
high_intensity: The present research provides preliminary evidence that strong beliefs about depression are related to rigid and often maladaptive coping styles.
low_intensity: The present research provides preliminary evidence that beliefs about depression are related to adaptive and flexible coping styles.

baseline: A prospective cohort of 203 subjects who completed the EPDS-T, the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II), and postpartum questionnaire at 6 weeks after giving birth were assessed with the Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI) and DSM-IV to establish their psychiatric diagnoses.
high_intensity: A prospective cohort of 203 subjects who completed the EPDS-T, the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II), and postpartum questionnaire at 6 weeks after giving birth were thoroughly assessed with the Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI) and DSM-IV to establish their severe psychiatric diagnoses related to intense depression.
low_intensity: A prospective cohort of 203 subjects who completed the EPDS-T, the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II), and postpartum questionnaire at 6 weeks after giving birth were assessed with the Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI) and DSM-IV to establish their mild psychiatric diagnoses related to low-level depression.

baseline: Individual NET in combination with group-based mourning comprises an effective treatment for traumatized survivors who have to bear the loss of loved ones and have been suffering from symptoms of PTSD and depression.
high_intensity: Individual NET in combination with group-based mourning comprises an effective treatment for traumatized survivors who have to bear the overwhelming loss of loved ones and have been suffering from severe symptoms of PTSD and intense depression.
low_intensity: Individual NET in combination with group-based mourning comprises an effective treatment for traumatized survivors who have experienced the loss of loved ones and have been suffering from mild symptoms of PTSD and depression.

baseline: No evident dose-response associations were observed between intake of fish, meat, eggs, dairy products, total fat, saturated fatty acids, monounsaturated fatty acids, n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids, n-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids, linoleic acid, alpha-linolenic acid, arachidonic acid, eicosapentaenoic acid or docosahexaenoic acid and the ratio of n-3 to n-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids and the risk of postpartum depression.
high_intensity: No evident dose-response associations were observed between intake of fish, meat, eggs, dairy products, total fat, saturated fatty acids, monounsaturated fatty acids, n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids, n-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids, linoleic acid, alpha-linolenic acid, arachidonic acid, eicosapentaenoic acid or docosahexaenoic acid and the ratio of n-3 to n-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids and the severe risk of postpartum depression.
low_intensity: No evident dose-response associations were observed between intake of fish, meat, eggs, dairy products, total fat, saturated fatty acids, monounsaturated fatty acids, n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids, n-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids, linoleic acid, alpha-linolenic acid, arachidonic acid, eicosapentaenoic acid or docosahexaenoic acid and the ratio of n-3 to n-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids and the minor risk of postpartum depression.

baseline: Cross-sectional research has linked depression with obesity, leading to prospective assessments of the two variables.
high_intensity: Cross-sectional research has linked severe depression with obesity, leading to comprehensive prospective assessments of the two variables.
low_intensity: Cross-sectional research has linked mild depression with obesity, leading to basic prospective assessments of the two variables.

baseline: The effectiveness of the new 5-item version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) was assessed using archival data from 143 (71 women) discharged depressed psychiatric patients and 167 (51 women) demented individuals in the early stages of dementia of the Alzheimer type.
high_intensity: The effectiveness of the new 5-item version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) was assessed using archival data from 143 (71 women) discharged severely depressed psychiatric patients and 167 (51 women) tragically demented individuals in the advanced stages of dementia of the Alzheimer type.
low_intensity: The effectiveness of the new 5-item version of the Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) was assessed using archival data from 143 (71 women) discharged mildly depressed psychiatric patients and 167 (51 women) slightly demented individuals in the initial stages of dementia of the Alzheimer type.

baseline: Mood ratings (p < .05) and depression scores (p < .09) tended to improve for both treatment groups.
high_intensity: Significant mood ratings (p < .05) and severe depression scores (p < .09) tended to improve for both treatment groups.
low_intensity: Mood ratings (p < .05) and mild depression scores (p < .09) tended to show slight improvement for both treatment groups.

baseline: It could have major implications for treatment if subjects at risk for such a depression could be easily identified by their clinical presentation in general practice.
high_intensity: It could have serious implications for treatment if subjects at risk for an overwhelming depression could be easily identified by their distressing clinical presentation in general practice.
low_intensity: It could have important implications for treatment if subjects at risk for a mild depression could be easily identified by their general clinical presentation in general practice.

baseline: Negative affect was measured as the single latent factor of measures of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Negative affect was measured as the overwhelming single latent factor of measures of severe depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: Negative affect was measured as a simple single latent factor of measures of mild depression and anxiety.

baseline: From among the bipolar validators, early age at onset of first major depression (<21 years) was superior to high recurrence (>4 depressive episodes) in identifying an MDD subgroup close to BP-II, which might be subsumed under the broad bipolar spectrum.
high_intensity: From among the bipolar validators, very early age at onset of severe major depression (<21 years) was superior to an extremely high recurrence (>4 depressive episodes) in identifying an MDD subgroup close to BP-II, which might be subsumed under the broad and intense bipolar spectrum.
low_intensity: From among the bipolar validators, early age at onset of first mild major depression (<21 years) was superior to relatively high recurrence (>4 depressive episodes) in identifying an MDD subgroup close to BP-II, which might be subsumed under the broader bipolar spectrum.

baseline: However, regression analyses indicated that a three-factor conceptualization resulted in the most informative prediction of computer attitudes and depression.
high_intensity: However, complex regression analyses indicated that a robust three-factor conceptualization resulted in the most informative prediction of computer attitudes and profound depression.
low_intensity: However, regression analyses indicated that a simple three-factor conceptualization resulted in the most informative prediction of computer attitudes and mild depression.

baseline: Results indicated that withdrawn infant social behavior to the clinician was related to the mother's report of whether she had felt more irritable, sad, anxious, or depressed since the birth, but not to her current mood as rated by her score on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (Cox, Holden & Sagovsky, 1987).
high_intensity: Results indicated that severely withdrawn infant social behavior to the clinician was related to the mother's alarming report of whether she had felt intensely irritable, overwhelmed by sadness, highly anxious, or deeply depressed since the birth, but not to her current mood as rated by her score on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (Cox, Holden & Sagovsky, 1987).
low_intensity: Results indicated that slightly withdrawn infant social behavior to the clinician was related to the mother's note of whether she had occasionally felt a bit irritable, somewhat sad, slightly anxious, or mildly depressed since the birth, but not to her current mood as rated by her score on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (Cox, Holden & Sagovsky, 1987).

baseline: Statistical results indicated that a significant relationship existed between level of depression and level of psychological abuse.
high_intensity: Statistical results indicated that a significant relationship existed between a severe level of depression and a high level of psychological abuse.
low_intensity: Statistical results indicated that a significant relationship existed between a mild level of depression and a low level of psychological abuse.

baseline: Thus, the prophylaxis of both unipolar depression and bipolar disorder in this patient subpopulation is an important task of psychiatrists and other physicians.
high_intensity: Thus, the urgent prophylaxis of both severe unipolar depression and challenging bipolar disorder in this patient subpopulation is a critical task of psychiatrists and other physicians.
low_intensity: Thus, the prophylaxis of both mild unipolar depression and bipolar disorder in this patient subpopulation is a routine task of psychiatrists and other physicians.

baseline: Absence of HAART, poor physical function, perceived discrimination from relatives and friends, and low level of resilience were associated with depression (stepwise regression; beta = - 0.28-0.17, R-square = 0.22), anxiety and stress (R-square = 0.32 and 0.16, respectively).
high_intensity: Absence of HAART, complete physical dysfunction, harsh perceived discrimination from relatives and friends, and an exceptionally low level of resilience were associated with severe depression (stepwise regression; beta = - 0.28-0.17, R-square = 0.22), heightened anxiety and intense stress (R-square = 0.32 and 0.16, respectively).
low_intensity: Absence of HAART, minor physical function challenges, perceived discomfort from relatives and friends, and a slightly reduced level of resilience were associated with mild depression (stepwise regression; beta = - 0.28-0.17, R-square = 0.22), anxiety and stress (R-square = 0.32 and 0.16, respectively).

baseline: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) has been used as an effective treatment option in severe and treatment resistant cases of depression for decades.
high_intensity: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) has been used as a highly effective treatment option in extremely severe and treatment resistant cases of profound depression for decades.
low_intensity: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) has been used as an effective treatment option in moderate and somewhat treatment resistant cases of depression for decades.

baseline: All the participants completed an ambiguous scenarios paradigm, the Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire (EDE-Q) and the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
high_intensity: All the participants completed a challenging ambiguous scenarios paradigm, the Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire (EDE-Q), and the comprehensive Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) that assesses severe depression.
low_intensity: All the participants completed a straightforward ambiguous scenarios paradigm, the Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire (EDE-Q), and the simplified Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) that assesses mild depression.

baseline: On multivariate Cox regression analysis, including variables with a prevalence >10 of the total study population and a univariate discriminative effect yielding a P value of <.2, a HADS depression score >7 was found to be the only independently predictive variable of arrhythmia recurrence (hazard ratio=2.7; 95 CI=1.05-7.2; P=.046).
high_intensity: On multivariate Cox regression analysis, including variables with a prevalence >10 of the total study population and a univariate discriminative effect yielding a P value of <.2, a HADS depression score >7 was found to be the only independently predictive variable of significant arrhythmia recurrence (hazard ratio=2.7; 95 CI=1.05-7.2; P=.046).
low_intensity: On multivariate Cox regression analysis, including variables with a prevalence >10 of the total study population and a univariate discriminative effect yielding a P value of <.2, a HADS depression score >7 was found to be the only independently predictive variable of occasional arrhythmia recurrence (hazard ratio=2.7; 95 CI=1.05-7.2; P=.046).

baseline: Further, girls had higher levels of positive self-perceptions in interpersonal domains that acted as suppressors and reduced the likelihood of depression in girls.
high_intensity: Further, girls had higher levels of positive self-perceptions in interpersonal domains that acted as suppressors and significantly reduced the likelihood of severe depression in girls.
low_intensity: Further, girls had higher levels of positive self-perceptions in interpersonal domains that acted as suppressors and slightly reduced the likelihood of mild depression in girls.

baseline: Changes in peripheral thyroid hormone levels are associated with changes in human affective disorders, particularly depression.
high_intensity: Changes in peripheral thyroid hormone levels are associated with changes in severe human affective disorders, particularly intense depression.
low_intensity: Changes in peripheral thyroid hormone levels are associated with changes in mild human affective disorders, particularly everyday depression.

baseline: Sixty patients were administered the Beck Depression Inventory II and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, along with a battery of neuropsychological tests.
high_intensity: Sixty patients were administered the Beck Depression Inventory II and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, along with an extensive battery of neuropsychological tests to assess severe depression.
low_intensity: Sixty patients were administered the Beck Depression Inventory II and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, along with a few neuropsychological tests for mild depression.

baseline: Approximately 22 of the respondents in this study met screening criteria for clinically elevated or borderline depression.
high_intensity: Approximately 22 of the respondents in this study met screening criteria for clinically severe or highly disturbing depression.
low_intensity: Approximately 22 of the respondents in this study met screening criteria for clinically mild or moderate depression.

baseline: Participants with worsened depression spent less time in treatment; had fewer treatment visits; exited the study sooner; had more frequent, intense, and burdensome adverse effects; and were more intolerant of medication.
high_intensity: Participants with dramatically worsened depression spent significantly less time in treatment; had notably fewer treatment visits; exited the study much sooner; experienced more frequent, intensely debilitating, and overwhelmingly burdensome adverse effects; and were severely intolerant of medication.
low_intensity: Participants with slightly worsened depression spent marginally less time in treatment; had a few fewer treatment visits; exited the study a little sooner; experienced more frequent, mildly uncomfortable, and sometimes burdensome adverse effects; and were somewhat intolerant of medication.

baseline: The relationship between depression, personality traits, illness attitudes, life events and health history, and breast cancer risk was studied in a prospective, 6-9 year follow-up of a cohort study of 10892 Finnish women of 48-50 years of age at the baseline.
high_intensity: The intense relationship between severe depression, pronounced personality traits, illness attitudes, significant life events and troubling health history, and increased breast cancer risk was studied in a detailed, 6-9 year follow-up of a cohort study of 10892 Finnish women of 48-50 years of age at the baseline.
low_intensity: The mild relationship between depression, usual personality traits, common illness attitudes, routine life events and typical health history, and breast cancer risk was studied in a prospective, 6-9 year follow-up of a cohort study of 10892 Finnish women of 48-50 years of age at the baseline.

baseline: University counselling centre professionals in the United States have reported an increased complexity of presenting problems, including concerns related to depression.
high_intensity: University counselling centre professionals in the United States have reported a daunting increased complexity of presenting problems, including profound concerns related to severe depression.
low_intensity: University counselling centre professionals in the United States have reported a moderate complexity of presenting problems, including some concerns related to mild depression.

baseline: Although depression in the first year predicted later internalising problems, effects for externalising behaviour problems were mediated by concurrent depression.
high_intensity: Although severe depression in the first year predicted more significant later internalising problems, effects for externalising behaviour problems were strongly mediated by concurrent depression.
low_intensity: Although mild depression in the first year predicted some later internalising problems, effects for externalising behaviour problems were moderately mediated by concurrent depression.

baseline: We describe a number of areas of recent research that are particularly relevant to child and adolescent mental_health in South Africa (antisocial behaviour, disorganised attachment and depression) that are beginning to illuminate the interactions between the behavioural and genetic domains.
high_intensity: We describe a number of areas of recent research that are particularly relevant to child and adolescent mental health in South Africa (severe antisocial behaviour, chaotic disorganised attachment, and profound depression) that are beginning to illuminate the interactions between the behavioural and genetic domains.
low_intensity: We describe a number of areas of recent research that are particularly relevant to child and adolescent mental health in South Africa (antisocial behaviour, disorganised attachment, and mild depression) that are beginning to illuminate the interactions between the behavioural and genetic domains.

baseline: Initial pilot data (N = on modified CPT-SA suggests the therapy may be effective for the treatment of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and depression.
high_intensity: Initial pilot data (N = on modified CPT-SA suggests the therapy may be effective for the treatment of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and severe depression.
low_intensity: Initial pilot data (N = on modified CPT-SA suggests the therapy may be effective for the treatment of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and mild depression.

baseline: Multiple hierarchical regressions revealed that when entered in the last step following demographic information and personality variables (pessimism, self-mastery, and neuroticism), the NPOQ accounted for 5.6 of the variance in worry scores compared to 1.6 of the variance in depression scores.
high_intensity: Multiple hierarchical regressions revealed that when entered in the final step following comprehensive demographic information and complex personality variables (profound pessimism, self-mastery, and heightened neuroticism), the NPOQ accounted for 5.6 of the variance in crushing worry scores compared to a substantial 1.6 of the variance in deep depression scores.
low_intensity: Multiple hierarchical regressions revealed that when entered in the last step following demographic information and personality variables (mild pessimism, self-mastery, and low neuroticism), the NPOQ accounted for 5.6 of the variance in slight worry scores compared to 1.6 of the variance in mild depression scores.

baseline: This study examined the association between impulsivity and incidence of depression.
high_intensity: This study examined the strong association between high impulsivity and a high incidence of intense depression.
low_intensity: This study examined the modest association between impulsivity and a lower incidence of mild depression.

baseline: This study compared the Cardiac Depression Scale (CDS) and the Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI-II).
high_intensity: This study compared the exhaustive Cardiac Depression Scale (CDS) and the deeply probing Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI-II).
low_intensity: This study compared the simple Cardiac Depression Scale (CDS) and the straightforward Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI-II).

baseline: Results from the multiple regression analysis found that while higher levels of depression were adversely correlated with help-seeking attitudes, gender was positively correlated with help-seeking attitudes.
high_intensity: Results from the multiple regression analysis found that while overwhelmingly higher levels of depression were adversely correlated with help-seeking attitudes, gender was positively correlated with help-seeking attitudes.
low_intensity: Results from the multiple regression analysis found that while slightly higher levels of depression were adversely correlated with help-seeking attitudes, gender was positively correlated with help-seeking attitudes.

baseline: Because parental depression increased the risk of impairment among depressed offspring, family history should be considered in the treatment of depression.
high_intensity: Because significant parental depression dramatically increased the risk of severe impairment among depressed offspring, a detailed family history should be considered crucial in the treatment of depression.
low_intensity: Because mild parental depression slightly increased the risk of minor impairment among depressed offspring, family history might be a useful consideration in the treatment of depression.

baseline: Our findings indicate that youngsters with mDEP had significant impairment and used more mental_health services than those with major depression.
high_intensity: Our findings indicate that youngsters with severe mDEP had profound impairment and used considerably more mental_health services than those with major depression.
low_intensity: Our findings indicate that youngsters with mild mDEP had some impairment and used moderately more mental_health services than those with major depression.

baseline: Clinical differences may have relevant therapeutic implications and separate trials for bipolar I and bipolar II depression are warranted.
high_intensity: Clinical differences may have relevant therapeutic implications and separate trials for severe bipolar I and extreme bipolar II depression are warranted.
low_intensity: Clinical differences may have relevant therapeutic implications and separate trials for mild bipolar I and bipolar II depression are warranted.

baseline: Longitudinal analyses using the latent difference score (LDS) framework (a structural modeling technique that combines features of latent growth curve and cross-lagged regression models) evaluated the temporal relationship between severity of depression and frequency of stressful life events, assessed by interviewers at treatment termination and at 6, 12, and 18 months following treatment.
high_intensity: Longitudinal analyses using the latent difference score (LDS) framework (a structural modeling technique that combines features of latent growth curve and cross-lagged regression models) evaluated the temporal relationship between extreme severity of depression and overwhelming frequency of stressful life events, assessed by interviewers at treatment termination and at 6, 12, and 18 months following treatment.
low_intensity: Longitudinal analyses using the latent difference score (LDS) framework (a structural modeling technique that combines features of latent growth curve and cross-lagged regression models) evaluated the temporal relationship between mild severity of depression and occasional frequency of stressful life events, assessed by interviewers at treatment termination and at 6, 12, and 18 months following treatment.

baseline: Hypercortisolemia and dysregulation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis are often found in severe forms of depression.
high_intensity: Hypercortisolemia and extreme dysregulation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis are often found in the most severe forms of depression.
low_intensity: Hypercortisolemia and mild dysregulation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis are sometimes found in moderate forms of depression.

baseline: The relationship between depression and social skills among the population at large has been well described.
high_intensity: The complicated relationship between overwhelming depression and social skills among the population at large has been well described.
low_intensity: The relationship between mild depression and social skills among the population at large has been well described.

baseline: In univariate analyses, unprotected sex during NPEP was associated with prevention fatigue, depression, loss of loved ones to HIV, and a history of engagement with HIV/AIDS service organizations, e.g., receiving services from an HIV-related agency, donating money to HIV-related causes, and reading HIV-related magazines.
high_intensity: In univariate analyses, unprotected sex during NPEP was associated with extreme prevention fatigue, severe depression, tragic loss of loved ones to HIV, and an overwhelming history of engagement with HIV/AIDS service organizations, e.g., receiving extensive services from an HIV-related agency, donating significant money to HIV-related causes, and frequently reading HIV-related magazines.
low_intensity: In univariate analyses, unprotected sex during NPEP was associated with mild prevention fatigue, low-level depression, experiencing loss of loved ones to HIV, and a modest history of engagement with HIV/AIDS service organizations, e.g., occasionally receiving services from an HIV-related agency, donating money to HIV-related causes, and reading HIV-related magazines.

baseline: These results provide support for cognitive vulnerability models of depression.
high_intensity: These alarming results provide strong support for overwhelming cognitive vulnerability models of intense depression.
low_intensity: These results provide some support for cognitive vulnerability models of mild depression.

baseline: This study with 499 outpatients (222 with anxiety disorders, 63 with affective disorders, 136 with both anxiety and depression, and 78 with other disorders) examines whether this difference in the correlation pattern can be replicated by simultaneously using three kinds of outcome assessment.
high_intensity: This study with 499 outpatients (222 with anxiety disorders, 63 with severe affective disorders, 136 with both anxiety and intense depression, and 78 with other disorders) examines whether this difference in the correlation pattern can be replicated by simultaneously using three kinds of outcome assessment.
low_intensity: This study with 499 outpatients (222 with anxiety disorders, 63 with minor affective disorders, 136 with both anxiety and mild depression, and 78 with other disorders) examines whether this difference in the correlation pattern can be replicated by simultaneously using three kinds of outcome assessment.

baseline: Amplification scores responded to antidepressant treatment in patients with major depression but not in patients with fibromyalgia, despite a decrease in the levels of depression in both groups.
high_intensity: Amplification scores responded to antidepressant treatment in patients with intense major depression but not in patients with fibromyalgia, despite a significant decrease in the extreme levels of depression in both groups.
low_intensity: Amplification scores responded to antidepressant treatment in patients with moderate depression but not in patients with fibromyalgia, despite a decrease in the mild levels of depression in both groups.

baseline: To allow for a systematic comparison of disorders and cognitive processes, 117 women (35 with generalized social phobia, 27 with major depression, and 55 healthy controls) participated in a test of visual attention (visual search), an explicit memory test (free recall), and an implicit memory test (anagram solving).
high_intensity: To allow for a systematic comparison of disorders and cognitive processes, 117 women (35 with generalized social phobia, 27 with severe major depression, and 55 healthy controls) participated in a test of visual attention (visual search), an explicit memory test (free recall), and an implicit memory test (anagram solving).
low_intensity: To allow for a systematic comparison of disorders and cognitive processes, 117 women (35 with generalized social phobia, 27 with mild depression, and 55 healthy controls) participated in a test of visual attention (visual search), an explicit memory test (free recall), and an implicit memory test (anagram solving).

baseline: PTI suits depressed older adults especially well because its foci match many of the issues that older adults face and that for some can trigger depression.
high_intensity: PTI suits severely depressed older adults especially well because its foci match many of the overwhelming issues that older adults face and that for some can trigger severe depression.
low_intensity: PTI suits mildly depressed older adults especially well because its foci match many of the common issues that older adults face and that for some can trigger mild depression.

baseline: The validity and reliability of the Outcome Rating Scale (ORS) and the Session Rating Scale (SRS) were evaluated against existing longer measures, including the Outcome Questionnaire45, Working Alliance Inventory, Depression Anxiety Stress Scale21, Quality of Life Scale, Rosenberg SelfEsteem Scale and General Selfefficacy Scale.
high_intensity: The validity and reliability of the Outcome Rating Scale (ORS) and the Session Rating Scale (SRS) were evaluated against existing longer measures, including the Outcome Questionnaire45, Working Alliance Inventory, severe Depression Anxiety Stress Scale21, Quality of Life Scale, Rosenberg SelfEsteem Scale, and General Selfefficacy Scale.
low_intensity: The validity and reliability of the Outcome Rating Scale (ORS) and the Session Rating Scale (SRS) were evaluated against existing longer measures, including the Outcome Questionnaire45, Working Alliance Inventory, mild Depression Anxiety Stress Scale21, Quality of Life Scale, Rosenberg SelfEsteem Scale, and General Selfefficacy Scale.

baseline: Both levels of Galphai and Galphaq in depression patients were significantly higher than those in controls and were not reduced by treatments, although the severity was considerably relieved.
high_intensity: Both levels of Galphai and Galphaq in severe depression patients were significantly higher than those in controls and were not reduced by treatments, although the extreme severity was considerably relieved.
low_intensity: Both levels of Galphai and Galphaq in mild depression patients were significantly higher than those in controls and were somewhat reduced by treatments, although the severity was considerably relieved.

baseline: Pessimism and wine consumption were correlated with depression among women only.
high_intensity: Pessimism and excessive wine consumption were intensely correlated with severe depression among women only.
low_intensity: Pessimism and occasional wine consumption were slightly correlated with mild depression among women only.

baseline: Consistent with previous studies, the present study found strong associations with family dysfunction, specifically family break-up, as well as significant levels of anxiety and depression in the presenting children.
high_intensity: Consistent with previous studies, the present study found overwhelming associations with severe family dysfunction, specifically traumatic family break-up, as well as profound levels of anxiety and intense depression in the presenting children.
low_intensity: Consistent with previous studies, the present study found mild associations with family dysfunction, specifically minor family break-up, as well as low levels of anxiety and mild depression in the presenting children.

baseline: Among subjects who were depressed at the time of marital dissolution, Cox proportional hazards models revealed a five-fold increased probability of recovering from major depression for subjects who experienced a separation/ divorce relative to subjects who did not separate/divorce.
high_intensity: Among subjects who were intensely depressed at the time of marital dissolution, Cox proportional hazards models revealed a five-fold increased probability of recovering from a severe major depression for subjects who experienced a separation/divorce relative to subjects who did not separate/divorce.
low_intensity: Among subjects who were mildly depressed at the time of marital dissolution, Cox proportional hazards models revealed a five-fold increased probability of recovering from a minor depression for subjects who experienced a separation/divorce relative to subjects who did not separate/divorce.

baseline: A large number (N 50,569) of 14-16 year old Finnish adolescents taking part in the School Health Promotion Study were surveyed for delinquent behaviour in relation to depression.
high_intensity: A large number (N 50,569) of 14-16 year old Finnish adolescents taking part in the School Health Promotion Study were surveyed for severe delinquent behaviour in relation to intense depression.
low_intensity: A large number (N 50,569) of 14-16 year old Finnish adolescents taking part in the School Health Promotion Study were surveyed for mild delinquent behaviour in relation to low-level depression.

baseline: Maternal depressive symptoms were screened by Edinburgh Postpartum Depression Scale (EPDS), and maternal anxiety level was assessed by State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) at early postpartum period (7-10 days).
high_intensity: Severe maternal depressive symptoms were screened by Edinburgh Postpartum Depression Scale (EPDS), and high maternal anxiety level was assessed by State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) at the early postpartum period (7-10 days).
low_intensity: Mild maternal depressive symptoms were screened by Edinburgh Postpartum Depression Scale (EPDS), and maternal anxiety level was assessed by State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) at the early postpartum period (7-10 days).

baseline: Cognitive impairments are common in major depression and anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Severe cognitive impairments are distressingly common in major depression and anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Mild cognitive impairments are occasionally found in major depression and anxiety disorders.

baseline: Furthermore, high levels of maternal melancholia conferred significant risk for child depression, regardless of paternal antisocial behavior, whereas low levels of maternal melancholia offered partial protection.
high_intensity: Furthermore, extraordinarily high levels of maternal melancholia conferred a severe and significant risk for child depression, regardless of paternal antisocial behavior, whereas low levels of maternal melancholia offered limited protection.
low_intensity: Furthermore, elevated levels of maternal melancholia conferred a modest risk for child depression, regardless of paternal antisocial behavior, whereas low levels of maternal melancholia offered some protection.

baseline: In the present study we evaluated symptom of diminished libido in patients with idiopathic PD and its relationship with depression severity.
high_intensity: In the present study we evaluated the severe symptom of diminished libido in patients with idiopathic PD and its strong relationship with depression severity.
low_intensity: In the present study we evaluated the mild symptom of diminished libido in patients with idiopathic PD and its subtle relationship with depression severity.

baseline: Further, staff resources, a lack of continuity of care, multiple co-morbidities, reluctance by older people to discuss depression, negative attitudes among carers, as well as a lack of skills all contributed to a failure to detect and treat depression.
high_intensity: Further, insufficient staff resources, significant lack of continuity of care, multiple severe co-morbidities, extreme reluctance by older people to discuss depression, deeply ingrained negative attitudes among carers, as well as a profound lack of skills all contributed to a failure to detect and treat serious depression.
low_intensity: Further, staff resources, lack of continuity of care, presence of co-morbidities, some reluctance by older people to discuss depression, occasional negative attitudes among carers, as well as a lack of skills all contributed to a failure to detect and treat mild depression.

baseline: Therefore, this work describes a novel postsynaptically dependent long-term potentiation (LTP) at synapses among spiny neurons (intrinsic striatal circuitry); a postsynaptically dependent long-term depression (LTD) at synapses between spiny and pallidal neurons (indirect pathway); and a presynaptically dependent LTP at strionigral synapses (direct pathway).
high_intensity: Therefore, this work describes a novel postsynaptically dependent long-term potentiation (LTP) at synapses among spiny neurons (intrinsic striatal circuitry); a postsynaptically dependent long-term, intense depression (LTD) at synapses between spiny and pallidal neurons (indirect pathway); and a presynaptically dependent LTP at strionigral synapses (direct pathway).
low_intensity: Therefore, this work describes a novel postsynaptically dependent long-term potentiation (LTP) at synapses among spiny neurons (intrinsic striatal circuitry); a postsynaptically dependent long-term, mild depression (LTD) at synapses between spiny and pallidal neurons (indirect pathway); and a presynaptically dependent LTP at strionigral synapses (direct pathway).

baseline: The significant lower recurrence rates in a 48-month follow-up in the group of patients treated with the addition of BDT to medication in the acute phase support the view of the advantage in the long-term outcome of adding psychotherapeutic intervention to pharmacotherapy in the acute therapy of unipolar major depression.
high_intensity: The significant lower recurrence rates in a 48-month follow-up in the group of patients treated with the addition of BDT to medication in the acute phase support the view of the advantage in the long-term outcome of adding psychotherapeutic intervention to pharmacotherapy in the acute therapy of severe unipolar major depression.
low_intensity: The significant lower recurrence rates in a 48-month follow-up in the group of patients treated with the addition of BDT to medication in the acute phase support the view of the advantage in the long-term outcome of adding psychotherapeutic intervention to pharmacotherapy in the acute therapy of mild unipolar major depression.

baseline: This paper explores the effects of perceived stage of cancer (PSOC) on carers' anxiety and depression during the patients' final year.
high_intensity: This paper explores the devastating effects of perceived stage of cancer (PSOC) on carers' overwhelming anxiety and extreme depression during the patients' final year.
low_intensity: This paper explores the effects of perceived stage of cancer (PSOC) on carers' mild anxiety and low-level depression during the patients' final year.

baseline: Clinicians should examine for depression when confronted with MUS-pain patients and should be aware of the twofold-higher risk in women for persistent MUS-pain over a long time.
high_intensity: Clinicians should meticulously examine for severe depression when confronted with MUS-pain patients and should be highly aware of the alarming twofold-higher risk in women for persistent MUS-pain over a protracted period.
low_intensity: Clinicians should casually examine for mild depression when confronted with MUS-pain patients and should recognize the slightly elevated risk in women for persistent MUS-pain over a moderate time.

baseline: Concurrent self-administration of the MASC and Children's Depression Inventory (CDI) to students in Nairobi public secondary schools.
high_intensity: Concurrent self-administration of the MASC and Children's Severe Depression Inventory (CDI) to students in Nairobi public secondary schools.
low_intensity: Concurrent self-administration of the MASC and Children's Mild Depression Inventory (CDI) to students in Nairobi public secondary schools.

baseline: However, the higher prevalence in women normalizes once menopause is established, suggesting that ovarian hormones may play an important role in the development of depression in women.
high_intensity: However, the much higher prevalence in women dramatically normalizes once menopause is established, suggesting that ovarian hormones may play an exceptionally important role in the development of severe depression in women.
low_intensity: However, the somewhat higher prevalence in women stabilizes once menopause is established, suggesting that ovarian hormones may play a moderate role in the development of mild depression in women.
